Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Happy Mammoth:

Happy Mammoth is a high-growth e-commerce company dedicated to empowering women‚Äôs health through natural, science-backed supplements focused on gut, digestive, and hormonal wellness. As a performance-driven company, we are passionate about making a meaningful, lasting impact on our customers' lives. You can learn more about us at https://happymammoth.com/.

Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:


This is a fully remote contractor role, available full-time
The role requires availability during EU hours (GMT)


At Happy Mammoth, you can expect:


A strong salary package
A welcoming and nurturing work environment, with colleagues from around the world
A fast-paced, dynamic, and non-corporate atmosphere where adaptability is key
The chance to be part of our exciting global expansion journey
Flexible working hours
Free access to courses, books and Masterminds
Opportunities for professional growth and development


Job Summary:

As a Data Analyst at Happy Mammoth, you‚Äôll be at the heart of our data-driven efforts. Your insights will directly influence our strategies to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value. In this role, you‚Äôll dive into customer behavior, analyze marketing performance, and provide actionable insights that drive our direct-response and B2C marketing initiatives.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling


Qualifications:


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
Proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly


What will set you apart:


You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life
You thrive taking action, taking responsibility and getting things done before deadlines
You‚Äôre able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
You‚Äôre able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly
You're able to work as part of a team and actively contribute to conversations
A willingness to learn and grow with the business


CVs should be in English

MRM forma parte de McCann Worldgroup y del grupo de empresas Interpublic (NYSE: IPG) y cuenta con 35 oficinas en Am√©rica del Norte, Am√©rica Latina, Europa, Oriente Medio y Asia Pac√≠fico.

  • McCann Worldgroup manifiesta su compromiso con la igualdad y la diversidad.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas ‚Äì immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care ‚Äì and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will work within Customer Engagement Analytics team in Spain, to provide technical expertise in Advance/Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics. The key responsibilities of the role will be to contribute to AbbVie Data Analytics projects and support Data Science projects. Should be highly analytical with love and high affinity for analysis, mathematics and statistics. Additionally, not only should be familiar with quantitative methodologies and programming but also keen on business acumen. The Data Analyst should have passion for data analysis, data quality and accuracy, data exploration, machine learning and out of the box thinking.

Key responsibilities:

Serve as a relevant member of Customer Engagement Analytics, working in close partnership with the rest of team member and Global Winning with Data team to implement global and local initiatives in the affiliate, becoming a trusted partner of the CEx local team.

Develop in collaboration with the commercial teams and other CEx teams, advanced analytics, identify synergies, optimize reporting strategy to generate business relevant outcomes.

Master in different Foundry datasets of varying complexity and size levels and develop new ways to generate creative predictive analytic solutions to work around data limitations.

Identify best practices and extend them to the rest of the organization in terms of repoting & analytics, Proactively identify new analytical approaches that would improve our ability to answer key business questions, by closely collaborating with key business partners to transform key business questions to insights.

Work with business stakeholders to define key business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives and success factors for winning with data initiatives.

Qualifications

BS degree in mathematics, statistics or engineering, computer science or economics complemented with a master in Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Science or equivalent.

Portfolio of work demonstrating data science applications.

Minimum of 2 years of applied data science in fields such as data engineering, predictive modelling,

Experience developing and executing data analytica to address key business questions with positive and measurable outcomes.

Experience analyzing and drawing insights from key internally and externally generated data sets.

Essential skills:

Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen and creative problem solving.

Ability to interact effectively with/present to (verbally or written) to all levels of the organization.

Ability to be agile and nimble changing business conditions, strong collaborative relationships, teamwork across different functions and teams to contribute to productive culture.

Lead strategically and create trust within the team.

Additional Information

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community.‚ÄØ Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

Title: Data Analyst - Fintech
Description:
At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, we are seeking an ambitious and detail-oriented Data Analyst - Payments Specialist to drive data-led insights and support our payments strategy during a critical expansion phase. As a fast-growing B2C company with a strong presence in the US and European markets, we are focused on scaling our brand, optimising payment performance, and enhancing fraud prevention. This role requires a strong analytical mindset and a deep understanding of digital payment ecosystems, transactional data, and customer behaviour. You will play a key role in analysing payment trends, identifying inefficiencies, preventing fraud, and enabling data-driven decision-making across our payments and risk operations.

Key Responsibilities:

You're our perfect candidate if you:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies in payments data and fraud patterns to support rapid issue resolution and risk mitigation
Use advanced Excel skills (e.g., VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, IF conditions) to analyse payment transactions, identify unusual behaviour, and support reconciliation efforts
Ensure data accuracy across payment systems by validating transaction records and flagging inconsistencies or suspicious activity
Identify trends in payment failures, chargebacks, and fraud attempts to drive process improvements and reduce financial risk
Implement consumer data acquisition strategies and e-commerce analytics with a focus on optimising payment funnel performance and detecting fraud signals
Build and apply consumer segmentation and profiling models to detect high-risk behaviours and improve fraud prevention tactics
Respond to data analysis requests from fraud teams, compliance, finance, and operations with a focus on payment performance and fraud detection insights
Retrieve, clean, and prepare transactional data for deep analysis of payment patterns, fraud triggers, and refund behaviours
Contribute to daily, weekly, monthly, and annual reporting on payments KPIs, fraud rates, authorization success rates, and risk events
Perform in-depth analysis on large volumes of payments and fraud-related data using advanced techniques to extract actionable insights
Define and enforce data quality standards specific to payments and fraud monitoring systems, ensuring high confidence in real-time decisions
Maintain expertise in analytics tools and practices relevant to payments processing, fraud detection, and compliance reporting
Collaborate with engineering, product, risk, and business intelligence teams to embed data quality controls across payments and fraud pipelines
Create and optimise metrics and dashboards to monitor payment success, fraud incidents, transaction declines, and risk thresholds
Communicate key insights on payment performance and fraud trends to stakeholders, driving cross-functional initiatives for improvement
Research discrepancies in payment data and correct records to ensure accurate transaction histories and trustworthy reporting
Monitor real-time analytics dashboards for drops in payment success rates or spikes in fraud indicators, enabling swift investigation and escalation
Review and act on data control alerts related to payment processing, chargebacks, fraud scoring models, and transaction integrity
Continuously analyse payment flows to detect fraud attempts, reduce false positives, and improve approval rates through data-driven strategies


Requirements

Your expertise in a nutshell:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, in payments, fraud, or transactional data
Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets and relational databases
Proficient in BI/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel.
Solid understanding of digital payment systems, chargebacks, fraud indicators, and PSPs
Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and data quality best practices
Familiarity with Python, R, or statistical tools (SPSS, SAS) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
Ability to communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proactive, well-organized, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science)


YOUR TEAM:


We're team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and thatthe team's success is your success,then you're one of us!
Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the oce. That's why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.
Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus


Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development


At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities


Work-Life balance


Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!


Comprehensive benefits


Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!


Unique Perks


If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary


Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.




Your Challenge




You will get full ownership of our business data and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyse the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing the efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratisation of data inside the company and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed




You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications/education in Data/ Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar, and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modelling.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.
Have experience working with Tableau.




Why Join Seedtag?




Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure?




Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

Show more
HTML:
We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.


Your Challenge


  • You will get full ownership of our business data and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
  • You will analyse the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
  • You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing the efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
  • You will help build tools that enable the democratisation of data inside the company and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
  • Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.


What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed


  • You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications/education in Data/ Business Intelligence are a plus.
  • You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
  • You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
  • You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
  • You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
  • You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
  • You have experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar, and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
  • You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
  • You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
  • You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

It would be a big plus if you

  • Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modelling.
  • Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.
  • Have experience working with Tableau.


Why Join Seedtag?


Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!


Additional Perks


  • Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
  • Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
  • Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
  • Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate¬†Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure‚Äôs growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role‚Äôs relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization‚Äôs growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
Certifications such as:
Google Analytics Certification
Tableau/Power BI certifications
Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.¬†

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.¬†

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.¬†

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company‚Äôs DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.
¬†

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Power BI & Finance Data)

Location: Spain, Fully Remote - Spanish & UK Residents accepted

Start Date: January 2026

Duration: 12+ Months

Rate: ¬£45/50 per hour

Language: English; Spanish is a nice to have




Key Responsibilities:

Analysis & Financial Insights: Conduct in-depth analysis of financial data (sales, revenue, profit, sustainability) to assess dealer performance and identify areas for improvement.
Data Modeling & Transformation: Leverage Power BI and other tools to transform and model complex data from various financial systems, primarily Snowflake/SQL, into actionable insights.
Customer Interaction & Relationship Building: Actively engage with business partners to gather requirements, understand business needs, and translate them into technical solutions. Build strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure alignment and delivery of high-value insights.
BI Solutions Development: Develop and maintain robust Business Intelligence (BI) solutions, with a focus on financial metrics and visual reporting. This includes working on data flows, data models, and dynamic reporting dashboards using Power BI.
Collaboration & Agile Development: Work in Agile teams alongside colleagues in Spain and India to design and implement data solutions with high criticality and complex data models.
Proactive Problem Solving: Identify areas for process improvement, propose solutions, and be an active go-getter in driving value for the business.




Skills & Experience Required:

BI & Power Platform Expertise: At least 5 years of experience in Business Intelligence solutions, specifically with Power BI, Power Apps, and Power Automate. Expertise in Power Query (M language), DAX, data modeling, and dynamic Row-Level Security (RLS) in Power BI.
Financial Data Analysis: Strong experience in analyzing financial data such as sales, revenue, profit, and sustainability metrics. Ability to work with financial indicators and assess financial health.
Data Engineering & ETL Processes: Experience with ETL processes, data warehouses (Snowflake), and integration of data from various sources (ERP, CRM, SQL, APIs, etc.).
Data Modeling & Data Flows: Proficiency in designing and building data models, transforming raw data into clean, structured, and insightful datasets for reporting.
Business Analysis: Ability to work with business teams to identify and define statistical indicators, metrics, and ratios for business needs, ensuring that the data aligns with business goals.
Collaboration & Communication: Strong communication skills with the ability to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Proven experience in gathering requirements and translating them into technical specifications.
Agile Methodologies: Experience working within Agile teams, with a strong focus on delivering high-quality, customized BI solutions.
Proactive & Independent: A proactive, self-driven attitude with the ability to work independently and take ownership of tasks and responsibilities.




Key Tools & Technologies:

Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Data Modeling, Visuals)
Power Apps & Power Automate
Snowflake (Data Warehousing, ETL)
SQL, MySQL (Data Sources)
ERP, CRM Systems (Data Integration)
Agile Development Methodologies




Desirable Traits:

Customer-Focused: Ability to maintain ongoing communication with clients, ensuring solutions meet their requirements.
Proactive Approach: Ability to take initiative, propose solutions, and work in a fast-paced environment.
Detail-Oriented: High attention to detail with a focus on delivering high-quality results.




Working Environment:

Fully remote role, but preference for candidates based in Spain, Portugal, or the UK.
Collaborative environment with team members based in The UK, Spain and India.
Agile work environment with an emphasis on critical, high-impact solutions.




This role is an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst with a strong financial background and BI solution expertise, offering the chance to make a significant impact within a dynamic, international team.

If you are available and interested in this opportunity, please apply for further information.

Please note due to high volumes of applications we are unable to contact every application. If you do not hear back from us within 7 days of sending your application, please assume that you have not been successful on this occasion.

At Lucid, we celebrate difference and value diverse perspectives, underpinned by our values ‚ÄòHonesty, Integrity and Pragmatism‚Äô. We are proud to provide equal opportunities in line with our Diversity and Inclusion policy and welcome applications from all suitably qualified or experienced people, regardless of personal characteristics. If you have a disability or health condition and seek support throughout the recruitment process, please do not hesitate to contact us via the details below.

‚óè Reporting de datos de Tr√°fico y Conversi√≥n con datos de Ga4 en colaboraci√≥n con el equipo de anal√≠tica digital.

‚óè An√°lisis del tr√°fico por canales y por categor√≠as para las BUs eCommerce de Food y Non Food, as√≠ como la definici√≥n de planes de acci√≥n con los diferentes canales de adquisici√≥n para maximizar la conversi√≥n web y app.

‚óè Evaluaciones de usabilidad y tracking de nuevos desarrollos para analizar el dise√±o y desempe√±o de cada proyecto UX que se pone en marcha

‚óè Trabajo transversal con departamentos de Anal√≠tica y Data para explotar diferentes fuentes de informaci√≥n, explotar datos de forma homog√©nea y extraer conclusiones globales y desde una perspectiva Omnicanal

‚óè Comunicaci√≥n con Grupo Carrefour para homogeneizar herramientas y fuentes de research y compartir an√°lisis y resultados

‚óè Gesti√≥n de herramientas como Google Analytics, Similar Web, Sensor Tower, Semrush o Botify para la comprensi√≥n global del comportamiento del usuario dentro y fuera del entorno Carrefour


Se requiere:

‚óè Experiencia demostrable entre 3 y 5 a√±os en puesto similar

‚óè Estudios universitarios finalizados (Grado Marketing, Ciencias de la Informaci√≥n, ADE o similar)

‚óè Conocimientos t√©cnicos: Anal√≠tica web, Data Studio, nociones de dise√±o gr√°fico. Otras herramientas de an√°lisis y medici√≥n: Contentsquare, Getfeedback, AB Tasty...

‚óè Nivel avanzado de Ingl√©s (C1/C2)

‚óè Capacidad Anal√≠tica y transversal para trabajar con otras B.U.

‚óè Perfil de car√°cter multidisciplinar, con una parte de an√°lisis de datos (Google analytics, contentsquare etc...) y una aplicaci√≥n a negocio y visi√≥n 360o que le permita extraer insights relevantes.

‚óè Se valorar√° nociones de maquetaci√≥n, html, GTM y gesti√≥n de codigo web.


Que te ofrecemos desde Carrefour:

  • La oportunidad de crecer y desarrollarte profesionalmente, gracias a que somos una compa√±√≠a en constante expansi√≥n y evoluci√≥n.
  • Formar parte de una multinacional que apuesta por el uso de las √∫ltimas tecnolog√≠as, te permitir√° trabajar en diversos proyectos y estar en continua formaci√≥n.
  • Un salario competitivo en el mercado, junto con ventajas y beneficios para los colaboradores/as.
  • Posibilidad de trabajar en un ambiente din√°mico.
  • Compartir nuestro compromiso con la inclusi√≥n, ayudando desde la Fundaci√≥n Solidaridad Carrefour a mejorar la situaci√≥n de muchas personas en riesgo de exclusi√≥n social.


Valoraremos todas las candidaturas interesadas y si eres la persona seleccionada para avanzar en el proceso, nos pondremos en contacto contigo para darte m√°s detalles del puesto y conocer tu perfil.


¬°Muchas gracias!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Embat was born to design the best way for medium and large sized enterprises to plan their finances and monitor their cash flow in real time.




We are building a financial management platform that allows them to understand what has happened in the past, track what is happening today and forecast the future of their businesses.




Our mission is to build a product that leverages technology and excellent client experience to empower our clients to make the best business decisions by accessing the best financial information, 100x more efficiently than using Excel files.




Our solution translates into savings of up to 75% of the time that financial teams spend on manual tasks. This allows them to focus on what matters most: making a greater impact within their organization and achieving a better balance between personal and professional life.




Our platform is already the trusted treasury management software of a large number of medium and large-sized corporates in Europe.




Composed of a fantastic team of people of 80+ members with different backgrounds and nationalities.




Backed by reputable international investors with the ambition to make Embat global and a great place to work! We are backed by top-tier international VCs.




In February 2024, we closed our third round of investment worth 15 million euros! This has been led by the renowned international investment fund Creandum, with the invaluable support of our partners Samaipata, 4Founders Capital, VentureFriends, Hugo Ar√©valo and Martin Blessing.




As a Data Analyst, you will join our Data team and also work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success to help scale Embat‚Äôs commercial engine through data.




We‚Äôre looking for someone with 0‚Äì2 years of experience, curious by nature, and excited about turning raw data into insights. You‚Äôll help the team track performance, identify bottlenecks, uncover opportunities, and ultimately make better, faster decisions.




We pride ourselves on working in an agile, collaborative environment, with daily interaction across teams. You‚Äôll have ownership from day one and the space to grow your skills with guidance from experienced peers.




What will you do?





Support the collection, cleaning, and transformation of data from different tools (CRM, marketing platforms, customer success platforms).


Build and maintain dashboards and performance reports related to revenue, pipeline, marketing and retention.


Execute ad-hoc analyses to solve real business problems and communicate findings clearly to stakeholders.


Contribute to improving data accuracy by identifying inconsistencies and working cross-functionally to solve them.


Help document key metrics, sources and logic used in reporting processes.


Identify and help implement process automation and self-serve reporting opportunities.


Learn how to work with business teams and translate their questions into data-driven insights.
What are we looking for?


0‚Äì2 years of experience in data-related roles


Technical background (engineering, math, physics, statistics, economics or similar). Other degrees welcome if paired with a data bootcamp or master‚Äôs.


Basic SQL and Python knowledge


You are comfortable with numbers, and have high attention to detail


You are proactive, eager to learn, and a problem-solver by nature


You enjoy working cross-functionally with teams from different backgrounds


Strong communication and structured thinking


You speak Spanish fluently and have a working level of English
What comes with working at Embat?


We offer a platform that allows you to reach your professional and personal goals.


A competitive salary according to the project and responsibility.


English Classes.


Hybrid working setup & flexible schedule.


Latest technology of your choice to do your impactful work with.


Access to private health insurance with Sanitas.


Access to salary on demand, restaurante card, transport card, and kindergarten checks through Payflow.


Career progression - Twice-yearly performance reviews.


An opportunity to work hand in hand with our founders who built their careers in Investment Banking at J.P. Morgan for more than a decade


Team Buildings plans

Title: Data Analyst with Tableau and SQL (Hybrid - Madrid)
Description:
üöÄ We are still looking for the very Top Talent‚Ä¶and we would be delighted if you were to join our team!

More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer and Great Place to Work company with over 35.000 employees all over the world and presence in more than 35 countries. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies.




üîé What we look for?

We are looking for a Data Business Analyst with at least 3 years of experience to join the Data Visualization Competence Center with Tableau and SQL skills to support the transition to a new data platform of our client from the banking sector.




High english level is required.




Availability to go to the client's offices in the centre of Madrid 3 days a week.




‚öô Key Responsibilities:

Analyse the current BI landscape, understand business needs, and identify gaps between the legacy and future data environments.
Read, interpret, troubleshoot, and eventually build or enhance Tableau reports, and work hands-on with SQL to validate and explore data as part of your analysis..
Building dashboards.




üí° Mandatory requirements:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field such as Data Analytics, Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or related discipline 3+ years in a data/BI/business analyst or similar role
Solid hands-on experience with Tableau and SQL
Ability to conduct gap analysis and map current vs future state in data/reporting environments
Skilled in creating clear, structured documentation
Ability to understand and communicate data/reporting-related changes and its business impact
Ability to translate technical findings into clear, business-friendly insights Data analysis and problem solving skills
Exceptional communication skills to interact with both technical teams and business stakeholders.
Detail-oriented mindset with the ability to manage multiples tasks and prioritize effectively
Proactive, collaborative, and customer-focused approach to solving problems
English at least B2+/C1




üí∞ ¬øWhat can we offer?

-‚úàÔ∏è 23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!

-‚ù§Ô∏è Numerous benefits (Heath Care Plan, Internet Connectivity, Life and Accident Insurances).

Title: BI Analyst - Data Visualization
Description:
Hey there!

We‚Äôre Fever, the world‚Äôs leading tech platform for culture and live entertainment,

Our mission? To democratize access to culture and entertainment. With our proprietary cutting-edge technology and data-driven approach, we‚Äôre revolutionizing the way people engage with live entertainment.

Every month, our platform inspires over 300 million people in +40 countries (and counting) to discover unforgettable experiences while also empowering event creators with our data and technology, helping them scale, innovate, and enhance their events to reach new audiences.

Our results? We‚Äôve teamed up with major industry leaders like Netflix, F.C. Barcelona, and Primavera Sound, presented international award-winning experiences, and are backed by several leading global investors! Impressive, right?

To achieve our mission, we are looking for bar-raisers with a hands-on mindset who are eager to help shape the future of entertainment!

Ready to be part of the experience?

Now, let‚Äôs discuss this role and what you will do to help achieve Fever‚Äôs mission.

Business Intelligence & Data Visualization Analyst

About The Role

Fever is looking for an Analyst that will play a vital role in taking our products to the next level, deepening/ widening our current understanding of our users and identifying improvement opportunities for our product. We're looking for someone with great analysis skills, the ability to get things done and a genuine interest in our customers.

This is the perfect position for someone who knows a variety of techniques and tools related to data analysis (examples of techniques: SQL, clustering, predictive models, pattern recognition, examples of tools: R, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc), enjoys working in a team and loves digging into data to uncover product/business problems and opportunities. You will work closely with different areas of the business. We also value the ability to understand how to prioritize, think on how things will scale, make tradeoffs and balance the business needs with technical constraints.

Key Responsibilities


Create new visualizations according to all Fever teams needs and new requests
Optimize and maintain all those visualizations
Fully understand Fever's data model to be on top on new visualization requests and study their viability
Auditing of current reporting & analytics
Auditing any changes to ensure data accuracy and normalization of data
Working to develop meaningful segmentation models, behavioral analysis of key user segments to analyze churn including elements like origin source, onboarding, plan types and feature retention
Completing critical analysis that will drive growth and provide insights


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree with Engineering/Technical background required.
0-2 Years of relevant experience
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; strong bias towards data-based decision.
To love everything data - designing models, reporting, driving results/growth
Excellent written and spoken English
Good time management skills.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with developers, business owners, and senior business leaders.
High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.


Preferred Qualifications


Top-tier grades
An excellent understanding of SQL or other query languages preferred
Experience in a cross-functional team.
Experience working in Strategy (MicroStrategy) is a plus


Benefits


Attractive compensation package
Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
Work in a location in the heart of the city, with possible travel across our markets
Home-office friendly
Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee
English Lessons and Gympass
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow
We have free snacks, drinks and fruit at the office!


Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch

Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.

If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Ruby Labs is a leading tech company that creates and operates innovative consumer products. We offer a diverse range of opportunities across the health, education, and entertainment industries. Our innovative teams are driving the future of consumer-led products, and we're always looking for passionate individuals to join us. Learn more about our story at: https://rubylabs.com/about-us/

About The Role

Ruby Labs is hiring a Junior‚ÄìMiddle Data Analyst to join our fast-paced and rapidly growing team. In this role, you will create new reports, improve existing ones, and ensure data accuracy to support informed decision-making. You'll work across a variety of products and clients, helping to build their future data environments and playing a critical role in leveraging data for strategic insights.

Key Responsibilities


Partner with Product Owners and Data Teams to support data needs.
Control and monitor marketing and product metrics using Mixpanel and Tableau.
Create new reports and collaborate with Product Owners and Developers to maintain high-quality event tracking by aligning on event naming and mapping standards for new features and A/B tests.
Set up and manage tracking systems (pixels, postbacks, events) across platforms (Meta, Google, MMPs, etc.); maintain and troubleshoot server-to-server integrations.
Ensure accurate attribution across paid channels and platforms.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to support business insights.
Use SQL to retrieve and analyze data for reports and team requests.
Collaborate closely with the Data Team to ensure consistency in reporting and data quality across the organization.
Support campaign measurement and performance analysis.
Ensure data integrity and consistency across analytics tools and databases.


Qualifications


Degree in an analytical field such as Mathematics, Data Science, or Economics.
Minimum of 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights in large datasets.
Excellent verbal communication skills.
Strategic thinking and ability to make data-driven decisions aligned with organizational goals.
Experience in Product Analytics.
Experience with Mixpanel, GA4, Amplitude, or similar tools.
Basic knowledge of SQL.
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Looker, or similar.
Familiarity with server-side tracking, MMPs, CDPs, and tag managers.


Nice to Have


Strong spoken and written English.
Experience in Marketing Analytics.
Experience with Python or R.
Experience with GCP and BigQuery.
Familiarity with platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, etc.
Experience with orchestration frameworks like Airflow.
Familiarity with git and the code review process.
Understanding of affiliate and performance marketing.


Location

Ruby Labs operates within the CET (Central European Time) zone. Applicants from any country are welcome to apply for the position as long as they are located within approximately ¬± 4 hours of CET. This ensures optimal collaboration and communication during working hours.

Benefits

Discover the perks of being part of our vibrant team! We offer:


Remote Work Environment: Embrace the freedom to work from anywhere, anytime, promoting a healthy work-life balance.
Unlimited PTO: Enjoy unlimited paid time off to recharge and prioritize your well-being, without counting days.
Paid National Holidays: Celebrate and relax on national holidays with paid time off to unwind and recharge.
Flexible Independent Contractor Agreement: Unlock the benefits of flexibility, autonomy, and entrepreneurial opportunities. Benefit from tax advantages, networking opportunities, reduced employment obligations, and the freedom to work from anywhere. Read more about it here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dHF4ctKlez75whdn-ybUwP5d5Wr0BdwVrorrm_fM40Q/preview


Be part of our fast-growing team and seize this excellent opportunity for personal and professional growth!

Interview Process

After submitting your application, we conduct a thorough review which typically takes 3 to 5 days, but may occasionally take longer due to the volume of applications received. If we see a potential fit, we proceed with the following steps:


Recruiter Screening (40 minutes)
Technical Interview (60 minutes)
Final Interview (40 minutes)


Life at Ruby Labs

At Ruby Labs, we are more than a team; we're a community united in pushing the boundaries of technology and innovation. Our combined passion fuels our ambition for excellence, driving impact that resonates around the globe.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that a diversity of thought and backgrounds builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. Show more
HTML:
About Us

Ruby Labs is a leading tech company that creates and operates innovative consumer products. We offer a diverse range of opportunities across the health, education, and entertainment industries. Our innovative teams are driving the future of consumer-led products, and we're always looking for passionate individuals to join us. Learn more about our story at: https://rubylabs.com/about-us/

About The Role

Ruby Labs is hiring a Junior‚ÄìMiddle Data Analyst to join our fast-paced and rapidly growing team. In this role, you will create new reports, improve existing ones, and ensure data accuracy to support informed decision-making. You'll work across a variety of products and clients, helping to build their future data environments and playing a critical role in leveraging data for strategic insights.

Key Responsibilities

  • Partner with Product Owners and Data Teams to support data needs.
  • Control and monitor marketing and product metrics using Mixpanel and Tableau.
  • Create new reports and collaborate with Product Owners and Developers to maintain high-quality event tracking by aligning on event naming and mapping standards for new features and A/B tests.
  • Set up and manage tracking systems (pixels, postbacks, events) across platforms (Meta, Google, MMPs, etc.); maintain and troubleshoot server-to-server integrations.
  • Ensure accurate attribution across paid channels and platforms.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to support business insights.
  • Use SQL to retrieve and analyze data for reports and team requests.
  • Collaborate closely with the Data Team to ensure consistency in reporting and data quality across the organization.
  • Support campaign measurement and performance analysis.
  • Ensure data integrity and consistency across analytics tools and databases.

Qualifications

  • Degree in an analytical field such as Mathematics, Data Science, or Economics.
  • Minimum of 1 year of experience as a Data Analyst.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights in large datasets.
  • Excellent verbal communication skills.
  • Strategic thinking and ability to make data-driven decisions aligned with organizational goals.
  • Experience in Product Analytics.
  • Experience with Mixpanel, GA4, Amplitude, or similar tools.
  • Basic knowledge of SQL.
  • Experience with BI tools such as Tableau, Looker, or similar.
  • Familiarity with server-side tracking, MMPs, CDPs, and tag managers.

Nice to Have

  • Strong spoken and written English.
  • Experience in Marketing Analytics.
  • Experience with Python or R.
  • Experience with GCP and BigQuery.
  • Familiarity with platforms such as Google Ads, Facebook Ads, etc.
  • Experience with orchestration frameworks like Airflow.
  • Familiarity with git and the code review process.
  • Understanding of affiliate and performance marketing.

Location

Ruby Labs operates within the CET (Central European Time) zone. Applicants from any country are welcome to apply for the position as long as they are located within approximately ¬± 4 hours of CET. This ensures optimal collaboration and communication during working hours.

Benefits

Discover the perks of being part of our vibrant team! We offer:

  • Remote Work Environment: Embrace the freedom to work from anywhere, anytime, promoting a healthy work-life balance.
  • Unlimited PTO: Enjoy unlimited paid time off to recharge and prioritize your well-being, without counting days.
  • Paid National Holidays: Celebrate and relax on national holidays with paid time off to unwind and recharge.
  • Flexible Independent Contractor Agreement: Unlock the benefits of flexibility, autonomy, and entrepreneurial opportunities. Benefit from tax advantages, networking opportunities, reduced employment obligations, and the freedom to work from anywhere. Read more about it here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dHF4ctKlez75whdn-ybUwP5d5Wr0BdwVrorrm_fM40Q/preview

Be part of our fast-growing team and seize this excellent opportunity for personal and professional growth!

Interview Process

After submitting your application, we conduct a thorough review which typically takes 3 to 5 days, but may occasionally take longer due to the volume of applications received. If we see a potential fit, we proceed with the following steps:

  • Recruiter Screening (40 minutes)
  • Technical Interview (60 minutes)
  • Final Interview (40 minutes)

Life at Ruby Labs

At Ruby Labs, we are more than a team; we're a community united in pushing the boundaries of technology and innovation. Our combined passion fuels our ambition for excellence, driving impact that resonates around the globe.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that a diversity of thought and backgrounds builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status. Join us and be part of a company that is crafting the future of technology across multiple industries.

Title: Data & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Product team to the next level üöÄ


Team and Role


If you have experience in working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©


What you¬¥ll be doing


Your day-to-day as a Data & Analytics Specialist:


Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse (BigQuery) using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio/Metabase to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.
What we¬¥re looking for


You¬¥re a great fit if you...


Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data analyst/engineer.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling)
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.


Bonus points:


A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience working with vector DDBB and building data resources for AI consumption
What's in it for you?


Compensation üí∞

Our recruitment process


As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this July, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!

Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.


More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

We are a 70-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!

A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Product team to the next level üöÄ

  • Team and Role

If you have experience in working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©

  • What you¬¥ll be doing

Your day-to-day as a Data & Analytics Specialist:

  • Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
  • Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse (BigQuery) using dbt and Airflow.
  • Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
  • Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
  • Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio/Metabase to communicate results and track KPIs.
  • Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
  • Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
  • Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
  • Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
  • Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
  • Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.
  • What we¬¥re looking for

You¬¥re a great fit if you...

  • Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
  • At least 2 years of experience as a Data analyst/engineer.
  • Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
  • Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling)
  • Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
  • A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
  • Fluency in English and Spanish.

Bonus points:

  • A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.

THE JOB:

This includes but is not limited to developing data models and dashboards in the BI Platform to support all business stakeholders.

Support project management activities related to Data & Analytics: content preparation and follow-up activities

REQUIREMENTS:



Knowledge about project management procedures and best practices.
Proficient in PowerPoint and Excel.
Analytics background. Knowledge of database concepts and relational databases (e.g. MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, ClickHouse) and data exploitation technics
Experience of developing reports in SAP Analytic Cloud (SAC), Power BI, AFO and/or Analysis for Excel.
Working knowledge of Alteryx and/or Power Automate is a strong advantage

Organized & effective - take a well-ordered, structured approached in task management.
Strong influencing and communication skills.

English proficiency.

You have the ability to collaborate and work remotely.
You are able to work independently and set priorities.
You have the ability to process numerical information.
You have strong communications skills and a strong work ethic and attitude.
You have the ability to be flexible and are able to deal with change in a fast-moving environment.
You have the ability to operate successfully in a matrix structure.
You are good at building relationships with all key stakeholders and establish internal and external networks.
You are at ease with and have the ability to work with senior stakeholders in the business.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Are you passionate about capital markets and technology? Are you looking for a new challenging position? Do you want to work in an agile international and self-organized environment where collaboration, trust, and innovation are paramount? Then, our Business Intelligence team wants to hear from you.

We are looking for a BI Specialist who is a data enthusiast and interested in back office Market operations to join our Data Managing Back Office team. You will work in a diverse and flexible environment in close cooperation with various business units, and both internal and external clients.

¬†

¬†

¬†

What you will do

Contact with infrastructures and supervisory authorities, supporting as well national and foreign entities in their reporting to PTI (Post-Trade Interface)
Supervision of compliance with internal procedures and entities compliance supervision
Collaborate with internal business partners to gather data and reporting requirements
Design robust and scalable data models and maintain PowerBI dashboards.As well as optimize models and queries for performance and efficiency
Perform data and visualization analysis to extract value-added conclusions for business partners
Flexible working hours. There are 3 rotating shifts from: 08:00 to 17:00, 09:00 to 18:00 and 12:00 to 20:30 (this one is done once a week)

¬†

¬†

¬†

What you bring

Studies in business administration, finance and/or capital markets, having also a high technology mindset and interest
Global vision of the functioning of the different Market entities and their interrelationships. Knowledge of the functioning of infrastructures such as trading venues, CCP or IBERCELAR and knowledge related to messaging (FIX, XML, ISO...) would be an asset
Technical knowledge of PowerBI: data modeling and visualization and knowledge of SQL and databases functioning. Excel and VBA macros will be a plus too
Functional knowledge of cloud technologies capabilities such Azure will be a plus too
Strong analytical and detail-oriented skills with a teamwork spirit
High level of oral and written English and Spanish (B2 minimum)

¬†

¬†

¬†

What We Offer

Hybrid model up to 40% working from home
37,5 hours/week with flexible schedule and 29+2 holidays
Daily meal allowance
Additional Medical Insurance for employee and family
Pension fund
Access to technical and language learning platforms
Free parking spots, charger spots and shuttle bus (only for Las Rozas - Madrid location)

  • Studies in business administration, finance and/or capital markets, having also a high technology mindset and interest
  • Global vision of the functioning of the different Market entities and their interrelationships. Knowledge of the functioning of infrastructures such as trading venues, CCP or IBERCELAR and knowledge related to messaging (FIX, XML, ISO...) would be an asset
  • Technical knowledge of PowerBI: data modeling and visualization and knowledge of SQL and databases functioning. Excel and VBA macros will be a plus too
  • Functional knowledge of cloud technologies capabilities such Azure will be a plus too
  • Strong analytical and detail-oriented skills with a teamwork spirit
  • High level of oral and written English and Spanish (B2 minimum)

 

 

 

What We Offer

  • Hybrid model up to 40% working from home
  • 37,5 hours/week with flexible schedule and 29+2 holidays
  • Daily meal allowance
  • Additional Medical Insurance for employee and family
  • Pension fund
  • Access to technical and language learning platforms
  • Free parking spots, charger spots and shuttle bus (only for Las Rozas - Madrid location)

Title: Consumer Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Category:

Sales

Job Family:

International Sales

Job Description:

Develop Schreiber‚Äôs Consumer Insights discipline in order to understand and communicate the holistic voice of the consumer to enable strategic solutions and drive profitable growth. Influence internal and external customers to implement recommended strategies that are founded in fact based market trends. This includes deployment of our syndicated resources (e.g., IRI/Nielsen, Datassential, NPD) to create/support selling strategies relevant to our product/customer mix for external and internal partners.

Our main goal is to transform complex data into actionable insights that provide support to all Sales business areas for strategic decision making, as well as leverage the industry trends and consumer behaviors to provide a vision on the strategic innovation & portfolio for our today & future customers.

Role And Responsibilities


Data Interpretation: You will utilise research tools to extract and interpret data, providing actionable insights and actionable recommendations. From data to recommendations. Supporting the business to make decisions/ transform data into sales
Deliver strategic guidance to Sales, PLS, and leadership teams by generating actionable consumer behavior and sales insights from primary and syndicated data. Offer measurable business solutions based on category and customer knowledge. Conduct competitive analysis and benchmarking to assess market positioning and consumer perceptions across European markets.
Product Analysis: Analyze potential markets/products from a customer, competitor and consumer standpoint, store checks IN countries with Sales Partners, tasting sessions with R&D and Sales.
Share best practices and create an understanding of issues faced in the marketplace, and potential implications of insights. Presentations will involve direct customer calls. Develop sales stories that provide actionable and unique insights.
Monitor consumer purchase panel and market intelligence information to deliver specific information on consumer channel trends in marketplace. Utilize information for outside sources to drive story and develop priorities.


Key Ingredients:


Bachelors in Business Administration, Marketing or related field
5+ Years of Experience in Sales. Experience as a research supplier or in-house client within the Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) industry is preferred
Fluency in English, both written and spoken. French and other languages will be considered as a plus
Advanced experience in database extraction, exploitation, and analysis
Experience and expertise using syndicated CPG data (Nielsen/Iri/ Kantar/Euromonitor) for business analysis and effective story telling
Autonomous & Curious, self-starter
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Familiarity with research vendors and research methodologies.
Experience with the folowing tools: Nielsen DDBB, Circana DDBB, Kantar, internal & external sales sources, Excel, PPT and Office
Ideally experience with data visualization tools like Power BI
Knowledge of research methods (qualitative & quantitative), utilization and provision
Expertise in understanding data and interpreting it in real life business situations
Mental agility: ability to interpret results and present clear recommendations
Proven analytical ability to interpret complex data and translate it into actionable insights
Open mind and used to work in multidisciplinary teams in international and national environment across different business groups & product categories
Client oriented, flexible and proactive
Travel availability up to 10% (on annual basis)


Schreiber Foods is an Equal Opportunity Employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Title: Business Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Job Description




We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst Trainee to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We AreAt Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.

Your Challenge

Support the Data & Insights team in transforming data into meaningful business insights.
Assist in analysing the performance of Seedtag‚Äôs Contextual products and internal processes.
Help build tools and dashboards that support data-driven decision-making across teams.
Learn how to automate internal processes to increase team efficiency.
Gain exposure to the adTech ecosystem and develop business acumen.
Collaborate with experienced analysts and actively participate in team discussions.
Take ownership of learning opportunities and technical development.

What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed

Currently completing or recently completed a Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
Strong interest in data analysis, business intelligence, and technology.
Basic knowledge of SQL and a willingness to develop your technical skills.
Some academic or personal experience with programming languages (e.g., Python, R) or Excel/Google Sheets.
Curiosity about data visualisation tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Detail-oriented mindset and eagerness to learn in a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication skills and a collaborative attitude.
Motivation to understand how data impacts business decisions.
A good level of English, both written and spoken.

It would be a big plus if:

Have worked on academic or personal projects involving data analysis or reporting.
Have taken online courses or earned certifications related to SQL, data analytics, or visualisation.
Understand basic business KPIs or performance metrics.

Why Join Seedtag?Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!

Additional Perks

Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.

Ready to join the Seedtag adventure? Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.
