Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.




Your Challenge




You will get full ownership of our business data and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyse the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing the efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratisation of data inside the company and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed




You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications/education in Data/ Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar, and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modelling.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.
Have experience working with Tableau.




Why Join Seedtag?




Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks




Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure?




Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas ‚Äì immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care ‚Äì and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will work within Customer Engagement Analytics team in Spain, to provide technical expertise in Advance/Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics. The key responsibilities of the role will be to contribute to AbbVie Data Analytics projects and support Data Science projects. Should be highly analytical with love and high affinity for analysis, mathematics and statistics. Additionally, not only should be familiar with quantitative methodologies and programming but also keen on business acumen. The Data Analyst should have passion for data analysis, data quality and accuracy, data exploration, machine learning and out of the box thinking.

Key responsibilities:

Serve as a relevant member of Customer Engagement Analytics, working in close partnership with the rest of team member and Global Winning with Data team to implement global and local initiatives in the affiliate, becoming a trusted partner of the CEx local team.

Develop in collaboration with the commercial teams and other CEx teams, advanced analytics, identify synergies, optimize reporting strategy to generate business relevant outcomes.

Master in different Foundry datasets of varying complexity and size levels and develop new ways to generate creative predictive analytic solutions to work around data limitations.

Identify best practices and extend them to the rest of the organization in terms of repoting & analytics, Proactively identify new analytical approaches that would improve our ability to answer key business questions, by closely collaborating with key business partners to transform key business questions to insights.

Work with business stakeholders to define key business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives and success factors for winning with data initiatives.

Qualifications

BS degree in mathematics, statistics or engineering, computer science or economics complemented with a master in Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Science or equivalent.

Portfolio of work demonstrating data science applications.

Minimum of 2 years of applied data science in fields such as data engineering, predictive modelling,

Experience developing and executing data analytica to address key business questions with positive and measurable outcomes.

Experience analyzing and drawing insights from key internally and externally generated data sets.

Essential skills:

Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen and creative problem solving.

Ability to interact effectively with/present to (verbally or written) to all levels of the organization.

Ability to be agile and nimble changing business conditions, strong collaborative relationships, teamwork across different functions and teams to contribute to productive culture.

Lead strategically and create trust within the team.

Additional Information

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives and serving our community.‚ÄØ Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

Title: AI & Data Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Overview

At The Roadmap, we‚Äôve helped hundreds of businesses grow fast ‚Äî and now we‚Äôre building the next phase of our company with AI, automation, and smarter systems at the core of how we work.

We‚Äôre looking for an AI & Data Intelligence Specialist to help us connect the dots ‚Äî across leads, trends, client behaviour, and internal systems. This is a hybrid role, based in Madrid (2 days in-office, 3 days remote), and will play a key part in helping our sales, marketing, and leadership teams work faster, smarter, and more strategically.

This role is perfect for someone who loves research, pattern recognition, AI tools, and deep work. You don‚Äôt need to be a communicator or strategist ‚Äî but you do need to be obsessed with structure, curious about tech, and excited to make systems better for everyone around you.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

You‚Äôll work with the leadership, sales, and marketing teams to:


Research business data across industries, platforms, and lead sources
Structure and organise data so it‚Äôs actionable and easy to use
Use AI tools to assist with research, analysis, and automation
Spot patterns in company behaviour and share insights with sales/marketing
Help build internal systems to qualify leads, prioritise outreach, and support campaign targeting
Continuously experiment with new tools and methods to improve speed, accuracy, and output


This Role Is For Someone Who...


Loves deep research, structuring data, and figuring out how things work
Is excited by AI and curious about how to use it for automation, analysis, and workflow design
Enjoys working independently, focusing on detailed work without distraction
Is naturally organised and methodical ‚Äî and likes turning chaos into clean, structured output
Is based in Madrid or willing to relocate for a hybrid HQ role
Wants to work with a team that values clarity, trust, and the freedom to experiment


What Makes This Role Different


You‚Äôll help build something new ‚Äî not follow old processes
You‚Äôll work across departments but stay focused on structure, insights, and execution
You‚Äôll be encouraged to explore tools, test ideas, and find smarter ways of working
You‚Äôll have the freedom to go deep into research, build systems, and let your work speak for itself
You won‚Äôt be expected to pitch, present, or lead calls ‚Äî just to build the brainpower behind the work


Perks and Benefits


Hybrid setup ‚Äì 2 days in the Madrid office, 3 days remote
Flexibility to travel while working
4.2-day work week rolling out soon
Access to advanced tools and AI platforms ‚Äî with freedom to explore new ones
Multiple business areas to work across ‚Äî from sales and strategy to marketing and onboarding
Competitive base salary based on experience
Bonuses tied to the impact of your work and company growth
Pay reviews and role evolution as systems mature and the team expands
Supportive, focused team that values smart thinking and efficient systems


About The Roadmap

Established in 2019, our marketing agency offers personalized digital services to lay solid foundations and improve your online presence with a custom marketing roadmap for your business.

Our Team

We‚Äôre a team of international young professionals aiming to make marketing refreshingly simple for businesses and brands.

Our Values

We go above and beyond to exceed your expectations, constantly innovating with our marketing roadmap to stay ahead of the curve.

More about us

  • Research business data across industries, platforms, and lead sources
  • Structure and organise data so it‚Äôs actionable and easy to use
  • Use AI tools to assist with research, analysis, and automation
  • Spot patterns in company behaviour and share insights with sales/marketing
  • Help build internal systems to qualify leads, prioritise outreach, and support campaign targeting
  • Continuously experiment with new tools and methods to improve speed, accuracy, and output

This Role Is For Someone Who...

  • Loves deep research, structuring data, and figuring out how things work
  • Is excited by AI and curious about how to use it for automation, analysis, and workflow design
  • Enjoys working independently, focusing on detailed work without distraction
  • Is naturally organised and methodical ‚Äî and likes turning chaos into clean, structured output
  • Is based in Madrid or willing to relocate for a hybrid HQ role
  • Wants to work with a team that values clarity, trust, and the freedom to experiment

What Makes This Role Different

  • You‚Äôll help build something new ‚Äî not follow old processes
  • You‚Äôll work across departments but stay focused on structure, insights, and execution
  • You‚Äôll be encouraged to explore tools, test ideas, and find smarter ways of working
  • You‚Äôll have the freedom to go deep into research, build systems, and let your work speak for itself
  • You won‚Äôt be expected to pitch, present, or lead calls ‚Äî just to build the brainpower behind the work

Perks and Benefits

  • Hybrid setup ‚Äì 2 days in the Madrid office, 3 days remote
  • Flexibility to travel while working
  • 4.2-day work week rolling out soon
  • Access to advanced tools and AI platforms ‚Äî with freedom to explore new ones
  • Multiple business areas to work across ‚Äî from sales and strategy to marketing and onboarding
  • Competitive base salary based on experience
  • Bonuses tied to the impact of your work and company growth
  • Pay reviews and role evolution as systems mature and the team expands
  • Supportive, focused team that values smart thinking and efficient systems

About The Roadmap

Established in 2019, our marketing agency offers personalized digital services to lay solid foundations and improve your online presence with a custom marketing roadmap for your business.

Our Team

We‚Äôre a team of international young professionals aiming to make marketing refreshingly simple for businesses and brands.

Our Values

We go above and beyond to exceed your expectations, constantly innovating with our marketing roadmap to stay ahead of the curve.

More about us

Title: Business Intelligence Trainee
Description:
Job Description: Trainee ‚Äì Business Intelligence

THE JOB:

This includes but is not limited to developing data models and dashboards in the BI Platform to support all business stakeholders.

This position will report to the BI Business Partners and will work closely with the key members of the business areas.

KEY ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



Support project management activities related to Data & Analytics: content preparation and follow-up activities
Report implementation - Create and maintain required BI reports and dashboards; work with the BI team to improve data quality & automatization; prototype new reports and BI solutions.
Will support the BI Business Partner in their duties and ad-hoc analysis.
Provides coaching and training for end-users regarding the BI tools.



REQUIREMENTS:



Knowledge about project management procedures and best practices.
Proficient in PowerPoint and Excel.
Analytics background. Knowledge of database concepts and relational databases (e.g. MySQL, SQL Server, Oracle, ClickHouse) and data exploitation technics
Experience of developing reports in SAP Analytic Cloud (SAC), Power BI, AFO and/or Analysis for Excel.
Working knowledge of Alteryx and/or Power Automate is a strong advantage
Ability to deliver tactical solutions while managing different issues.
Organized & effective - take a well-ordered, structured approached in task management.
Strong influencing and communication skills.
Critical thinker ‚Äì ability to understand the logical connections between ideas, identify, construct and evaluate arguments.
Think Strategically - foresee and take action to deal with problems and opportunities.
Change Management - be an advocate for positive change and improvements.
Motivated individual able to take projects from development to deployment.
Maintains a favorable working relationship with all teams to foster and promote a cooperative and harmonious working climate which will be conducive to maximum employee morale, productivity and efficiency.
Communicates openly and clearly both verbally and in writing and pitches information at the appropriate level.
English proficiency.



WHAT ABOUT YOU:



You have the ability to collaborate and work remotely.
You are able to work independently and set priorities.
You have the ability to process numerical information.
You have strong communications skills and a strong work ethic and attitude.
You have the ability to be flexible and are able to deal with change in a fast-moving environment.
You have the ability to operate successfully in a matrix structure.
You are good at building relationships with all key stakeholders and establish internal and external networks.
You are at ease with and have the ability to work with senior stakeholders in the business.



OUR COMPANY:

The Radisson Hotel Group is one of the most dynamic hotel companies operating in over 80 countries with strong brands such as Radisson, Radisson Collection, Radisson Blu, Radisson Red, Country Inn & Suites and Park Inn.

The Radisson Hotel Group

Title: Data & Analytics Specialist
Description:
Hi! üëãüèº

At Shakers, we're on the lookout for a Data & Analytics Specialist to take our Product team to the next level üöÄ


Team and Role


If you have experience in working autonomously on technical data projects, thrive in a dynamic startup environment, and are ready to take your career to the next level, we want to hear from you.

This role offers the opportunity to enhance Shakers' analytics, with the chance to shape the next generation way of working. If you‚Äôre excited by the prospect of working in a fast-paced, innovative environment, collaborating with a talented team, and making a direct impact, this is the opportunity for you! ü§©


What you¬¥ll be doing


Your day-to-day as a Data & Analytics Specialist:


Writing efficient SQL queries for large-scale data warehouses.
Defining, building, and maintaining ETL models in our data warehouse (BigQuery) using dbt and Airflow.
Building data integrations and ensuring data quality across pipeline layers.
Documenting and maintaining code and queries in GitLab.
Creating dashboards and reports in Looker/Looker Studio/Metabase to communicate results and track KPIs.
Conducting exploratory analysis to shape projects and provide actionable recommendations.
Presenting insights to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Collaborating with PMs, designers, and engineers to define data needs, request app events, integrate third-party tools, and develop data models.
Supporting feature design with product managers and engineers through performance measurement and impact testing.
Developing organization-wide data sources to empower business teams in data exploration.
Working across teams to improve data practices and promote a data-driven culture.
What we¬¥re looking for


You¬¥re a great fit if you...


Strong alignment with our principles‚Äîwe take this very seriously.
At least 2 years of experience as a Data analyst/engineer.
Proficiency in writing and understanding complex SQL queries and handling large datasets.
Experience using Python for data science tasks (data cleaning, API calls, SQL calls, modeling)
Familiarity with data visualization tools like Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, or Looker.
A graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields.
Fluency in English and Spanish.


Bonus points:


A Master's degree or Bootcamp in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related sciences.
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar.
Experience working with vector DDBB and building data resources for AI consumption
What's in it for you?


Compensation üí∞

The salary range for this position is between 40.250‚Ç¨ and 51.750‚Ç¨ OTE (on target earnings) gross annual salary.

The salary consists of:


Between 35.000‚Ç¨ & 45.000‚Ç¨ fixed salary
Up to 6.750‚Ç¨ quarterly bonus based on performance & potential (15%)


Why you¬¥ll love working at Shakers üíö


Be part of a rapidly growing, internationally expanding startup. üåç
Have an ambitious professional development plan to help you reach your full potential.
Enjoy an unbeatable team culture‚Äîask anyone on our team!
Take advantage of our hybrid ful flex methodology: a mix of remote and in-office work, with our office located in the heart of Madrid, Calle Vel√°zquez.
Perks include wellness programs, gym access, English classes, medical insurance, and more.


At the office... üìç


Wellness programs, English classes, private medical insurance, and more
Organic fruit, great coffee and vibrant energy!
In our Madrid office, catered lunch included
Our recruitment process


As a startup, we are very agile and we like to see results quickly, which is why prioritize efficiency in our recruitment process.

Our goal is to have you onboard this July, so you can hit the ground running and make an impact from day one!

The Road to Joining Our Team


Round 1, Cultural Fit: Kick things off with an informal chat with our People & Culture team. Don‚Äôt worry‚Äîwe just want to get to know you better, learn about your goals, hobbies, and more!
Round 2, Case Study & Technical Skills with Product Team: Join two members of our Product team for a deep dive into a case study. This is your chance to showcase your client management skills and demonstrate how you approach problem-solving.
Round 3, Meet the Team: Have a conversation with additional team members to further explore your skillset and ensure there's a great cultural fit. This is also your chance to ask questions and see how we collaborate.
Final check, CEO Chat: Meet H√©ctor, our CEO! He‚Äôs excited to connect with you, talk about Shakers‚Äô future, and discuss your vision and expectations.


More about Shakers

At Shakers we imagine, design, and create the next-generation way of working.

Our vision is to be the leading community and platform in the world that helps companies work with freelance teams through our technology.

We are a 70-person, fast growing startup based in Madrid. It's the place for you if you're looking for a high-performance, very dynamic & technological environment surrounded by ambitious people!

Our DNA

At Shakers, we are obsessed with our values. Half of our bonuses are performance-based, and the other half come from embodying what it means to be a true Shaker!

WINNING TEAM üèÜ

We all feel like part of a winning team‚Äîone that pushes boundaries, challenges the status quo, and moves the needle! We set ambitious goals and seek people who are driven to achieve them.

F1C10 üí™üèº

We‚Äôre building an environment where fear doesn‚Äôt hold us back. Experimentation and learning from failure are part of our DNA. Fail fast, grow faster. Fail 1X, chase 10X. We value risk-takers who aren‚Äôt afraid to go big!

STAY HUMBLE ü§≤üèº

We embrace a beginner‚Äôs mindset‚Äîalways evolving, always learning, and always finding new solutions. At Shakers, humility combined with ambition fuels our success, and when we blend the two, the results are extraordinary!

A huge thanks for being interested in Shakers, we'd love to see you soon.

Title: Data Analyst (Growth & Marketing)
Description:
üìö TripleTen is a U.S.-based tech school internationally recognized for its excellence in education and transformative impact. We‚Äôre rapidly expanding in Brazil, helping more and more people break into the tech industry‚Äîregardless of where they‚Äôre starting from. We value talent, promote continuous learning, and offer real challenges that drive both personal and professional growth in a global and innovative environment.

We're looking for passionate analyst to help the team set up experiments and validate growth and marketing hypothesis in a fast-paces growth team in Brazil EdTech market.

What you will do:

Growth:


Identify growth opportunities through data analysis
Monitor conversion funnels from impression to enrollment completion
Execute A/B testing and analyze marketing experiments
Track qualified lead generation metrics (MQLs and SQLs)
Analyze user behavior and build end-to-end reporting to track it
Map customer journey and identify optimization opportunities


Marketing:


Conduct cohort analysis for different marketing segments
Analyze performance across channels (Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn, SEO, email marketing)
Create attribution models to understand channel impact
Help marketing and sales departments to sync by clarifying pyramid of metrics
Support remarketing and nurturing strategies with data-driven insights
Create visualizations for ROI, ROAS, CAC (Customer Acquisition Cost), and LTV (Lifetime Value)
Present actionable insights for budget and strategy optimization
Develop and maintain daily marketing campaign dashboards using Tableau


Requirements:


3+ years of experience in Data Analytics, specifically in Marketing, Growth or Product fields
Advanced English
Expertise in Tableau (dashboard creation, calculated fields, parameters, actions)
Proficiency in SQL or Python for marketing data extraction and manipulation
Familiarity with marketing automation tools (RD Station, HubSpot or Salesforce)
Knowledge of digital campaign analysis and performance metrics


What we can offer you:


100% remote work, with flexibility and work-life balance
Paid time off (vacation and national holidays)
Opportunity to make a real, direct impact on the company's results by actively contributing to our growth
A diverse, global team with people based in the U.S., Latin America, Brazil, Serbia, Georgia, and more than 10 other countries
Show more

Title: Arlo Europe Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Arlo Europe, part of Verisure, is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate Data Analyst who is successful in building long term relationships, works proactively and is driven by numbers and problem-solving. If these qualities describe you and how you work as well as having experience in demand planning, you might be the one we are looking for!

As a Data Analyst, you will analyse and visualize data to help with the successful launch and scale of our various programs and so that we can make better decisions as a company. In particular, the role will be leading and ensuring that the large datasets we have are effectively utilized by team.

Working with Arlo Europe at Verisure is being part of an industry leading world-class company that has a strong entrepreneurial spirit.¬†

Strategic context and Value proposition ¬†

Verisure is the leading provider of monitored security solutions in Europe. In 2019, we formed a strategic partnership with Arlo, a world leader in connected cameras. Verisure acquired all rights to Arlo‚Äôs European business, in particular, the exclusive distribution rights for Arlo branded camera products for all sales channels in Europe, including e-commerce and retail. Additionally, Verisure is entering into a supply agreement with Arlo whereby we get access to the full portfolio and past and future innovation stream of Arlo camera products to sell through the Verisure direct or partner channels across all our countries.

Today, Verisure does not focus on e-commerce and retail channels. Instead, we drive our core go to market channels: direct field sales, alliances and telesales. The acquisition of Arlo Europe gives us a strong leadership position in these two emerging and important channels for our business. This transaction has strategic importance. Camera led subscription services building on surveillance versus professionally monitored security are now creating attractive incremental growth opportunities.

Arlo Europe is a leader in the Smart Home Market in Europe. We provide peace of mind to our customers for them to have total control over the protection of the things and ones they love. Pioneering, professional grade technology and industry leading AI allows them to stay connected to their property from wherever they are, so they can rest easy knowing everything is safe and secure. Whether it‚Äôs keeping an eye on packages, checking the wellbeing of family or deterring and preventing unwelcome visitors, Arlo prides itself on giving customers the most accurate view on what‚Äôs going on when they are away.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will:

Create reports and data visualizations to guide decision-making across the operation
Respond promptly, accurately and efficiently to data requests and questions¬†
Support supply chain with master data updates as needed¬†
Drive data integrity including identifying and acquiring missing information¬†¬†
Present your findings clearly to diverse audiences across the company
Proactively identify inconsistencies in the data through your visualizations and with statistical tests¬†
Continuously improve SQL and python skills, helping you automate repetitive work and multiply yourself¬†
Learn quickly through experimentation
Location

Permanent hire based in Madrid, Spain (hybrid).

Reports and organization structure

Directly reporting to Finance Director for Arlo Europe.

Candidate profile

Experiences and Qualifications

The Data Analyst is a critical function at Verisure Arlo Europe, working closely with the Sales team, Demand Planning, Logistics, Order Management and Finance teams to ensuring that the large datasets we have are effectively utilized across the organization. This is a highly visible and cross-functional role with an outsized impact. This role will report to the Head of Logistics & Order Fulfillment Arlo Europe.

Skills required
Professional with minimum of 3 years of experience
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field and/or equivalent experience or evidence of exceptional deductive ability
Expert in data analysis, visualization, and communication, with prior full-time work experience strongly preferred
Experience creating dashboards/visualizations using, e.g., PowerBI (or similar).
Detail-oriented/relentless, willing to find cracks in the system to expose problems.
Proficient in Advanced MS Excel, SQL and Python. Data visualization programs such PowerBi is preferred.
Experience in supply chain / manufacturing Program Management helpful.
Perform well in a fast-paced-start-up technology environment and achieve/deliver excellent results.
Communicate clearly and collaborate with multiple stakeholders
Experienced in Sourcing, MRP and fulfilment systems is plus
Highly proficient in automation and supply chain analytics
Fluent English (c1)

Competencies
Pay close attention to details and conduct accurate analysis
View the business from a holistic perspective
Thrive in high-pressure situations and prioritize effectively.
Collaborate effective with team members.
Demonstrate cultural sensitivity and adaptability in diverse contexts.

¬†Strong fit with our Company DNA
Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.
Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.
Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers, and we learn continuously.
Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.
With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Diversity & Inclusion

Verisure is an equal opportunities employer. We recognize the richness that diversity brings and encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply. We champion an inclusive and collaborative culture and empower all employees to succeed and grow. Please reach out to us if you have any specific requirements throughout the recruitment process, we are happy to help.

We Are People Who Protect People

We are the leading provider of professionally monitored alarms for residential households and small businesses in Europe.

Peace of mind for families and small businesses

We believe it is a human right to feel safe and secure. We now protect more than 5 million families and small businesses. Our service includes 24/7 monitoring, expert verification and response, customer care, service and maintenance services, and professional technical support. As well as protecting against intrusion, we protect against fire, attack, theft, life-threatening emergencies and other hazards. Verisure people are dedicated and committed and provide what we believe is the best customer service in the industry.

Leading across a broad footprint

We are the leading provider of residential and small business monitored alarms in Europe. We operate in 17 countries across Europe and Latin America. Our business is driven by organic growth, based on our differentiated business model. We attract high quality customers. We work hard to ensure that our customers are happy. This contributes to an industry leading level of attrition and a long customer lifetime.

A technology-enabled human services company

Our 26,000 team-mates are the foundation of our company. Our business model combines technology and human expertise to protect people. We are a human services company. More than 80% of our colleagues interact with customers every day. This connection provides the insight that inspires our innovation. These insights are a source of advantage. We leverage these insights with the significant investment we make into product and service innovation. The close customer contact also fuels the pride which drives engagement.

35 years of experience ‚Äì and many more to come

We have been protecting what matters most since 1988. Over that time, we have expanded beyond our roots in the Nordics and Spain. We now serve most of Europe and have also established a strong presence in Latin America. In 2017, to evolve our operating model, strategic innovation, operational excellence and access to talent, we opened our new Group headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland. In 2019, we formed a strategic partnership with Arlo, a world leader in connected cameras. Verisure acquired all rights to Arlo‚Äôs European business. This allows us to offer connected camera services in Europe as a complement to our professionally monitored security service. It also allows us to access new go-to-market opportunities in retail and e-commerce.

Show more
HTML:
Arlo Europe, part of Verisure, is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate Data Analyst who is successful in building long term relationships, works proactively and is driven by numbers and problem-solving. If these qualities describe you and how you work as well as having experience in demand planning, you might be the one we are looking for!

As a Data Analyst, you will analyse and visualize data to help with the successful launch and scale of our various programs and so that we can make better decisions as a company. In particular, the role will be leading and ensuring that the large datasets we have are effectively utilized by team.

Working with Arlo Europe at Verisure is being part of an industry leading world-class company that has a strong entrepreneurial spirit. 

Strategic context and Value proposition  

Verisure is the leading provider of monitored security solutions in Europe. In 2019, we formed a strategic partnership with Arlo, a world leader in connected cameras. Verisure acquired all rights to Arlo‚Äôs European business, in particular, the exclusive distribution rights for Arlo branded camera products for all sales channels in Europe, including e-commerce and retail. Additionally, Verisure is entering into a supply agreement with Arlo whereby we get access to the full portfolio and past and future innovation stream of Arlo camera products to sell through the Verisure direct or partner channels across all our countries.

Today, Verisure does not focus on e-commerce and retail channels. Instead, we drive our core go to market channels: direct field sales, alliances and telesales. The acquisition of Arlo Europe gives us a strong leadership position in these two emerging and important channels for our business. This transaction has strategic importance. Camera led subscription services building on surveillance versus professionally monitored security are now creating attractive incremental growth opportunities.

Arlo Europe is a leader in the Smart Home Market in Europe. We provide peace of mind to our customers for them to have total control over the protection of the things and ones they love. Pioneering, professional grade technology and industry leading AI allows them to stay connected to their property from wherever they are, so they can rest easy knowing everything is safe and secure. Whether it‚Äôs keeping an eye on packages, checking the wellbeing of family or deterring and preventing unwelcome visitors, Arlo prides itself on giving customers the most accurate view on what‚Äôs going on when they are away.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, you will:

  • Create reports and data visualizations to guide decision-making across the operation
  • Respond promptly, accurately and efficiently to data requests and questions 
  • Support supply chain with master data updates as needed 
  • Drive data integrity including identifying and acquiring missing information  
  • Present your findings clearly to diverse audiences across the company
  • Proactively identify inconsistencies in the data through your visualizations and with statistical tests 
  • Continuously improve SQL and python skills, helping you automate repetitive work and multiply yourself 
  • Learn quickly through experimentation
Location

Permanent hire based in Madrid, Spain (hybrid).

Reports and organization structure

Directly reporting to Finance Director for Arlo Europe.

Candidate profile

Experiences and Qualifications

The Data Analyst is a critical function at Verisure Arlo Europe, working closely with the Sales team, Demand Planning, Logistics, Order Management and Finance teams to ensuring that the large datasets we have are effectively utilized across the organization. This is a highly visible and cross-functional role with an outsized impact. This role will report to the Head of Logistics & Order Fulfillment Arlo Europe.

Skills required
  • Professional with minimum of 3 years of experience
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field and/or equivalent experience or evidence of exceptional deductive ability
  • Expert in data analysis, visualization, and communication, with prior full-time work experience strongly preferred
  • Experience creating dashboards/visualizations using, e.g., PowerBI (or similar).
  • Detail-oriented/relentless, willing to find cracks in the system to expose problems.
  • Proficient in Advanced MS Excel, SQL and Python. Data visualization programs such PowerBi is preferred.
  • Experience in supply chain / manufacturing Program Management helpful.
  • Perform well in a fast-paced-start-up technology environment and achieve/deliver excellent results.
  • Communicate clearly and collaborate with multiple stakeholders
  • Experienced in Sourcing, MRP and fulfilment systems is plus
  • Highly proficient in automation and supply chain analytics
  • Fluent English (c1)

Competencies
  • Pay close attention to details and conduct accurate analysis
  • View the business from a holistic perspective
  • Thrive in high-pressure situations and prioritize effectively.
  • Collaborate effective with team members.
  • Demonstrate cultural sensitivity and adaptability in diverse contexts.

  • Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.
  • Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.
  • Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers, and we learn continuously.
  • Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.
  • With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

Title: Bi Lead Analyst - Pharma & Portfolio Intelligence
Description:
At Suanfarma, we are looking for a BI Lead Analyst to join our team in HQ.Suanfarma is a global leader in the development, manufacturing, and distribution of active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs).

With over 30 years of experience, we are committed to innovation, sustainability, and delivering high-quality products that improve health and well-being around the world.Responsibilities:Prepare product/API dossiers including market sizing, pricing/ASP, competition, exclusivity expiration indicators, regulatory status, and suppliers.Build and maintain dashboards in Qlik Sense and recurring reports for Business Development, Commercial, and R&D teams.Integrate, clean, and reconcile data from multiple internal and external sources, ensuring data quality and traceability.Manage and prioritize incoming analysis requests, track progress, and consolidate deliverables.Provide insights and visualizations for business case documentation in collaboration with BD and R&D.Requirements:Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering (Industrial, Computer Science, Telecommunications, Data Science), Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Economics, Life Sciences (Pharmacy, Chemistry), or related fields.2‚Äì4 years of experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, ideally in the pharmaceutical industry or consultancy with pharma clients.Strong command of Qlik Sense: data modeling, dashboard creation, version control, and publication.Advanced Excel: pivot tables, Power Query, data cleaning, and consolidation.Experience working with pharmaceutical data sources (e.g., IQVIA, Cortellis/Clarivate); ability to understand coverage, limitations, and use cases.Ability to support strategic analysis and initiative selection for portfolio expansion.Solid skills in both quantitative and qualitative analysis to support portfolio selection and new product development.Ability to translate business requirements into data models that support strategic decision-making.Experience working cross-functionally to ensure analytical robustness and business relevance.Professional proficiency in English; legal residency and work permit in Spain.Python for light automation (pandas, reporting) ‚Äì nice to have, not mandatory.Basic knowledge of exclusivity expiration indicators (patents, SPCs, regulatory) and their commercial implications.Familiarity with Power BI (limited use) and collaborative tools (Teams, SharePoint).Experience standardizing templates/SOPs and implementing quality review workflows.Languages:English : Professional fluency (documentation, meetings, and analysis).Key Skills & Knowledge:Qlik Sense : data modeling, reloads, advanced expressions, visualizations.Excel & Power Query : data transformation, joins, normalization, version control.Pharma data sources : understanding IQVIA (units, channels, volumes, limitations); basic knowledge of Cortellis/Clarivate.Market analysis : market sizing, trends, competitive benchmarking, exclusivity expiration indicators, ex-manufacturer vs. retail price analysis.Product development understanding : from API R&D to FDF commercialization .Visualization & storytelling : creation of clear graphics, executive summaries, methodological annexes.Data quality : data dictionaries, update criteria, source traceability.Documentation : experience developing templates, style guides, review checklists.Python (nice to have) : automating repetitive tasks and generating reports.Personal Attributes:Hands-on mindset and strong attention to data quality.Structured thinking and great attention to detail.Synthesis skills: ability to turn data into actionable recommendations.Effective time management and ability to prioritize multiple requests.Cross-functional collaboration and clear communication.Curiosity about the API/generics market and commitment to continuous learning.High standards of ethics and compliance when working with licensed/confidential data.Availability for a hybrid work model and occasional travel if needed.Interested?If this sounds like your next challenge, send us your CV at ******.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Barcelona - Spain

Flexible working: 60% home office / week‚ÄØ

Job type: Permanent, Full time‚ÄØ - Hybrid

About The Job

At Sanofi, we're committed to providing next-gen healthcare through the power of data insights and AI. As a Data Engineer in our Manufacturing & Supply Digital Data Foundations team, you'll play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive innovation and business value. You'll be part of an exciting journey to revolutionize our manufacturing processes through data-driven decision making.

We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people's lives. Our Digital Data & Technology organization is transforming Sanofi into an AI-driven powerhouse, creating trusted, high-quality data platforms that enable better decision-making across our global operations.

Main Responsibilities


Design and implement robust data engineering pipelines for Manufacturing & Supply systems, including SAP S4/HANA, QMS, LIMS, and MES
Create and maintain data integration solutions with comprehensive lifecycle management
Develop data visualization solutions using design-thinking approaches to deliver high-value products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in agile pods to understand and translate business requirements
Ensure data quality and compliance with regulatory requirements (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX)
Build and optimize data models to support Manufacturing & Supply analytics needs


About You


Experience in data engineering and ETL/ELT development, particularly with Informatica/IICS and DBT/Airflow
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in Python for data transformation
Knowledge of data governance principles and quality assessment methodologies
Experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
Agile mindset with excellent communication and collaboration skills


Why choose us?


Drive innovation at the intersection of healthcare and technology
Develop your expertise with cutting-edge data and AI platforms
Enjoy a thoughtful rewards package that recognizes your contribution
Take advantage of flexible working arrangements and comprehensive health benefits
Work with global teams on transformative digital initiatives
Access continuous learning opportunities and career growth paths


nullPursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Join Sanofi and step into a new era of science - where your growth can be just as transformative as the work we do. We invest in you to reach further, think faster, and do what‚Äôs never-been-done-before. You‚Äôll help push boundaries, challenge convention, and build smarter solutions that reach the communities we serve. Ready to chase the miracles of science and improve people‚Äôs lives? Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst Junior- Control Tower
Description:
Description

The EU External Fulfilment (EF) network consists of circa 35 operations which offer flexible solutions to the CF network operated by external providers (3PL providers). EU EF primarily provides: (1) network capacity solutions (storage/throughput), (2) special operation solutions (Hazmat, BWS, IXD, SDC, ICC, etc) and (3) emerging market penetration solutions. EU EF is currently undergoing an operational transformation, driving demand for enhanced expertise in Outbound (OB).

The goal of EU 3PL Control Tower is to provide an excellent operational end to end, 24/7 support, in 3PL buildings across European/UK External Fulfillment chain. We aim to provide the standardized and optimized process with frustration free communication. This role is for a highly driven and motivated individual with operational experience and innovative, hands-on approach.

This position involves the daily operational tasks resolutions and day to day communication with 3PL and Amazon team of problem solvers and node managers on their KPIs management.

The successful candidate will be responsible for: a- Provide reactive/proactive support to 3PL Providers and Amazon internals, b- Work on internal Projects to improve/automate 3PL Control Tower services. This person has a strong delivery record, attention to details and will be able to work independently with limited supervision.

This job involves 3PL operations monitoring and ops support, within a team that covers 24/7 shift pattern, for 30+ buildings in Europe/UK.

The shift to cover is Night Shift: 10pm CET to 6am CET, Sunday to Thursday (Friday and Saturday: days off).

Key job responsibilities


Providing the operational guidance to 3PL
Being a communication bridge between 3PL and Amazon stakeholders
Mitigating CX risk by CPT management support, resolving OB errors and managing shipment cancellations
Supporting on Transportation escalations.
Uploading critical data for supply chain and transportation visibility
Checking process and Amazon standard compliance
Optimization of actual Control Tower Outbound processes, aiming to automatize the actual tasks of the team, applying BI skills.
Work on Projects to improve actual 3PL Control Tower services, and capture new services that can be scalable to all 3PL sites.


Basic Qualifications


- Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
- C1 English level
- Spanish C2 level


Preferred Qualifications


High school or equivalent diploma.
Focus on details and analytical approach.
Expertise in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, AI, etc.
Experience in logistics.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Job ID: A3046653

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Kiwi.com

Kiwi.com is a leading global travel-tech company headquartered in the Czech Republic. Our innovative algorithm enables users to find better route options and prices other search engines can‚Äôt see, daily performing billions of price checks across 95% of global flight content. Are you bold, bright and curious? Join a global business that‚Äôs still got a start-up heart.

About Our Content Analytics Team

Our team is responsible for providing data-centric insights that enable the optimization of our flight content acquisition and processing. We use extensive datasets to support booking channel performance, improve autobooking efficiency and ensure data quality across our systems. Our work directly impacts Kiwi.com 's ability to offer our customers unique travel combinations and a smooth booking experience worldwide. We combine technical expertise with business understanding to build data-informed recommendations across multiple teams and stakeholders.

What You Will Do


You will conduct complex ad-hoc analysis using BigQuery and Looker, delivering insights that support thoughtful decision-making.
By creating and maintaining dashboards for key business metrics, you will help make data accessible and meaningful for stakeholders.
You will work with Looker's analytical layer, defining explores, measures and dimensions to support robust data exploration.
You will collaborate on building data models and support data quality through rigorous QA processes in collaboration with our data engineers.
You will evaluate and improve our complex flight booking and data acquisition systems, identifying opportunities for optimization.
You‚Äôll create data-informed recommendations by sharing practical insights with our flight content ecosystem.
You will help develop monitoring and alerting tools for product operations, enabling proactive incident detection and prevention.


What You Will Need


Your strong SQL skills and experience with BigQuery or similar data warehouses.
You have experience with BI tools (we use Looker) and a solid understanding of data modeling and data quality standards.
You can translate complex analytical findings into actionable insights that drive results.
You bring experience working with large datasets and collaborating with multiple stakeholders across teams.
Your excellent communication skills in English enable you to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
You have an analytical mindset with a strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and precision in your work.
You are capable of working independently while aligning with and contributing to team goals.


We offer you


We offer a hybrid and flexible work environment. A lovely, modern office in the center of Barcelona (Passeig de Gracia) with great views and amenities.
Monthly entitlement of 200 Euro redeemable through Cobee. Cobee is a benefits platform offering a range of benefits (meals, transport, nursery, health insurance, and physical wellness) and flexible compensation. It also allows our employees to allocate up to 30% of their gross salary to the consumption of certain products or services, leveraging tax exemption.
We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days and sick days.
Annual financial bonus based on company and individual performance.
Flight vouchers to celebrate your Kiwi anniversaries.
Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
Dogs are welcome in our offices.


Interested? Join us and help us make travel more accessible to all.

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it‚Äôs finished, we‚Äôre going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/ .

Title: Master Data Analyst
Description:
CUSTOMER SERVICE MASTER DATA ANALYST Location: Barcelona, Spain

The Customer Service Master Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of master data processes within the market. This role plays a key part in maintaining high-quality master data execution and overseeing data execution from the Shared Service Center. The role is critical for driving efficiency in master data management and ensuring seamless customer service operations.

Your main focus:


Ensure Master Data Readiness & Quality: Deliver accurate and timely data setup KPIs for product activation, PIPO management, customer setup, logistics, and pricing conditions. Guarantee data readiness for new product launches and promotional activities. Train Sales and Marketing teams to follow global standards and ensure accurate input using standard templates.
Governance and Execution of Master Data Processes: Own and enforce master data execution processes, ensuring compliance with business standards. Develop protocols and workflows to maintain master data quality and implement continuous improvement practices.
Oversee Shared Service Center Operations: Monitor and validate the quality of master data execution by the Shared Service Center, ensuring SLA adherence.
Conduct quality control checks and provide feedback to improve processes and performance.
Data Insights and Analytics: Consolidate master data insights and share them with the Master Data Leader to support informed decision-making.


Working for Coty means constant opportunities and change. You will be managing a lot of things at the same time, but this is also what makes it exciting!

Key success measures for the Customer Services Master Data Analyst include the following:


Timeliness and Accuracy: Ensure master data updates are completed within SLA timeframes and accurately on the first attempt.
Process and Compliance: Adhere to SLAs, protocols, governance standards, and achieve high audit compliance rates.
Quality and Efficiency: Maintain high QC pass rates, resolve data issues quickly, and ensure data completeness in all entries.
Stakeholder Satisfaction and Reporting: Deliver timely analytics and reports while achieving strong feedback from internal stakeholders.


The Customer Services Master Data Analyst will liaise with various cross-functional and remote teams, such as:


Customer Service Operations
Shared Service Center
Master Data Global Teams
IT CoE


YOU ARE A COTY FIT

You have excellent problem solving skills and have the ability to think quickly & work under tight deadlines. As a CS Master Data Analyst, you get energy from working in a fast-paced, diverse, and challenging environment. You have strong attention to detail and organisation skills, and can communicate effectively and collaborate with various stakeholders.

Other than that, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree, higher vocational training or vocational training in Data Management, or a related field.
2 to 4 years of experience in master data management, customer service, or related fields.
Proficiency in SAP and data governance tools.
Basic fluency/proficiency in English and proficient or native in any of the following languages: Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, German
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools will be a plus (e.g., Excel, Power BI, Tableau).
Familiarity with customer and product master data processes in SAP (customer set up, activation, PIPO, pricing conditions).


Our Benefits

As our Customer Service Master Data Analyst, some of the benefits you will receive are:


Competitive remuneration and perks will be matched with your experience and knowledge.
Ticket restaurant (daily diet for meals)
Company products / Access to the company shop
Life and accident insurance


RECRUITMENT PROCESS


A screening call with the recruiters
A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
A second interview (optionally)
Feedback, verbal offer
Hiring


About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!
Show more

RECRUITMENT PROCESS

  • A screening call with the recruiters
  • A first online/in-person interview with hiring managers
  • A second interview (optionally)
  • Feedback, verbal offer
  • Hiring

About Coty

Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skincare, and body care. At Coty, we celebrate the entire human kaleidoscope and cultivate a culture of fearless kindness. Therefore, we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. We do not discriminate against any candidate or employee and strive to be an open, inclusive and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self. Join us in making over the world of beauty!

Title: Data Analyst - Business Performance Analytics
Description:
What You'll Do:

As part of the Business Performance Analytics (BPAX) team within Sales Strategy, your primary mission will be to deliver robust, intuitive, and actionable business insights that empower Criteo‚Äôs CRO and Commercial leaders to shape and drive the company‚Äôs commercial strategy.

You will apply a data-driven approach to uncover insights and explain business performance. This role involves working with large and complex datasets, requiring strong analytical curiosity, creativity in data exploration, and the ability to synthesize findings into a compelling narrative that supports strategic decision-making.

Your Mission


Build advanced analytical views to decode and communicate global performance patterns
Perform in-depth competitive analyses, measuring the business impact of competitors‚Äô activities across key markets
Leverage external and internal data to understand client behavior, identify high-value client clusters (e.g., through CLTV studies), and qualify the potential of clients and prospects across new and existing business areas
Size business growth opportunities and risks, and translating findings into actionable recommendations for multiple levels of stakeholders



Who You Are:


2‚Äì3 years of experience in a similar analytics role (experience in AdTech is a plus)
A Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in a quantitative field (e.g., Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, or Business)
Strong analytical skills and intellectual curiosity, with the ability to structure and solve complex problems
Solid understanding of statistical modeling and data interpretation
Hands-on experience with SQL for data manipulation and extraction
Proficiency in Python for data analysis
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Power BI and/or Tableau
Strong presentation skills (including PowerPoint), with the ability to translate complex data into clear business insights and actionable recommendations
Business acumen and the ability to act as a trusted advisor to commercial stakeholders
Excellent communication skills and fluency in English
A proactive, autonomous mindset, with the ability to manage multiple projects, set milestones, coordinate with cross-functional teams, and drive initiatives forward



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We‚Äôre shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs‚Äînever on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer:

üè† Own your work style ‚Äì Build your work around your life and not the other way around.

üìà Grow with us ‚Äì Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

üí™ Your wellbeing matters ‚Äì Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

ü§ù A team that cares ‚Äì Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

üí∏ Fair pay & perks ‚Äì Competitive salary, equity, performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.

Title: Data Analyst, Solutions & Innovation
Description:
What You'll Do:

As a member of our Analytics Solutions & Innovation (AXSI) team, you will act as a key analytical partner to our commercial organization, helping to steer innovation from the ground up. Your role will be crucial in developing new ways to measure and demonstrate value for our clients.


Solution Prototyping & Development: Translate complex business questions into scalable data analyses, prototyping new measurement methodologies for Criteo‚Äôs latest upper-funnel solutions using our rich shopper graph dataset.
Client & Internal Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams and clients to deeply understand their business needs and how they measure the value of upper-funnel marketing activities.
Iterative Analysis & Validation: Design and execute analyses to validate new measurement approaches, iterating on prototypes with internal partners to refine them for production readiness.
Product Innovation & Scalability: Partner with Product and R&D teams to develop feature requests, transforming your successful analytical prototypes into scalable, fully-fledged Criteo products.
Data-Driven Innovation: Leverage cutting-edge tech like Hadoop, Vertica, Tableau, Git, Python, and SQL to build innovative analytical solutions from the ground up.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with commercial and product teams to deliver insights that drive the development of new, revenue-generating solutions.



Who You Are:


You have at least 1 year of hands-on data analysis experience, with proficiency in SQL and Python.
A natural problem-solver with a passion for analytics and a logical approach to challenges.
Business-minded with a talent for turning data insights into actionable product strategies.
Passionate about product development and turning analytical prototypes into real-world solutions.
Excellent ability to synthesize complex information and present clear, actionable recommendations.
A team player who thrives in a collaborative, inclusive, and vibrant workspace.
Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Eligible to work in Spain with no restrictions.



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform. üåü

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

Title: BI Analyst Intern
Description:
What You'll Do:

The Global Reporting Team (GRT) at Criteo is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining a portfolio of performance reports across sales, business, and finance domains. As a BI Analyst Intern, you‚Äôll work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment where your contributions will directly impact decision-making across the company.

This internship offers a unique opportunity to deepen your technical skills while gaining exposure to a wide range of business functions. You‚Äôll collaborate with experienced analysts and stakeholders to deliver high-quality, automated reporting solutions.

As an intern, alongside the rest of the team, you will be responsible for :


Collaborate with stakeholders to gather and translate business needs into technical reporting requirements.
Design, build, and maintain dashboards and reports using SQL and BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Perform data validation, troubleshoot inconsistencies, and ensure data accuracy across reporting layers.
Automate recurring reporting processes using scripts or workflow tools.
Document processes, create user guides, and contribute to internal knowledge sharing.



Who You Are:


Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Business Analytics).
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills in English (spoken and written).
Comfortable working independently and collaboratively in a dynamic environment.
Demonstrated interest in data, analytics, and technology.
Technical skills required: SQL (ability to write complex queries, perform joins, etc), Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, data manipulation), understanding of ETL processes and data modeling concepts.
Bonus skills: BI Tools (experience with Power BI, Tableau, or similar visualization platforms), familiarity with cloud data platforms, basic Python for data analysis or automation.
English speaking fluency, Russian is considered a plus (not mandatory)



We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We‚Äôre shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs‚Äînever on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst - Tableau
Description:
Hays is collaborating with the leading company in the pharmaceutical sector, TOP 10 pharma with more than 146 affiliates around the world and 47 employees, of which 1,600 are located in Spain. They create innovative medicines for people and animals, adding value through innovation for all three business areas: human pharmaceuticals, animal health, and contract manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals. Now they are in the expansion phase and are developing the animal area. Our client is forming a technological hub that will serve the entire group internationally.




We are looking for a Data Analyst with Tableau to join the team.




Your Commitment will include:

Design and implement necessary visualizations with Tableau that allow stakeholders to understand the reliability level of a certain dataset.
Plan a roadmap of improvements for selected datasets alongside the focus area owners and deploy it accordingly.
Work closely with data engineers, platform managers, business analysts, and focus area owners to understand requirements, formats, completeness, consistency, and accuracy of those datasets that are part of the omnichannel approach.
Use DBT to transform and model data in Snowflake, ensuring that data is well-structured and accessible.
Add new features and enrich the customer journey data model within Snowflake that provides customer knowledge across channels.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical data solutions within Snowflake.




Achieving the difference requires the following skills:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Engineering, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proven experience as a developer with a focus on Snowflake and SQL language. Experience in tuning queries and interpreting query explain plans is valued. Python language experience is also nice to have.
Hands-on experience working with Snowflake cloud data, including transformation and querying.
Ability to create interactive dashboards and visualizations with Tableau.
Committed, proactive, and curious personality, reliable, open, and innovative with a strong interest in business intelligence disciplines.
Fluent English. Any other language is an advantage.




What we offer:

Indefinite contract. Full-time job.
Participation in international projects.
Hybrid work, 1 day office week.
Office: San Cugat del Vall√®s.
Flexible Schedule ‚Äì Monday to Friday from 8/9 to 5/6.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
P2P.org is the largest institutional staking provider with a TVL of over $10B and a market share exceeding 20% in restaking.

We are continually focused on researching and improving our infrastructure to extract maximum APR while enhancing security. For instance, in ETH and SOL, our NRR is on average 10% higher than the market, and in DOT, it's 20% higher.

We also place significant focus and resources on launching new networks such as TON, Avail, Monad, Babylon, Story, Berachain, and others, along with yield products. From restaking, where we are the largest operator with a 20+% market share, to yield aggregators on stablecoins.

Our clients include BitGo, Copper, Crypto.com, Ledger, ByBit, Bitget, OKX, HTX, Bitvavo, SBI, and others, who choose us for our client-centric approach and extensive product line from unified API to widgets and custom dApps.

We are also actively expanding our product line, exploring RWA, data, yield, and service products for banks, exchanges, custodians, and wallets.

P2P.org unites talented individuals globally ‚ù§Ô∏è

Despite our distributed team, we share a passion for decentralized finance - a fairer system for all. We code, learn, create, and connect to shape finance's future üí∞

P2P.org boasts a strong reputation and network. We prioritize customer satisfaction and, as tech enthusiasts, develop innovative solutions that bolster our brand.

You will


Analyze large, complex datasets (on-chain and off-chain) to derive strategic and product insights
Develop models and dashboards to monitor validator performance, user behavior, and protocol performance
Investigate network economics, user incentives, and staking flows to support growth strategies, research new revenue opportunities
Conduct exploratory and root-cause analysis of ecosystem or performance changes
Build data tools and reporting frameworks to scale internal decision-making
Present insights and data stories clearly to technical and non-technical audiences


You have


5+ years of experience in data analysis, strategy, or research roles in tech, fintech, or crypto
Proficiency in advanced SQL and Python (must be comfortable working with large, complex datasets)
Strong business acumen and problem-solving skills ‚Äì ability to work from ambiguous problem statements to clear recommendations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)
Experience with data visualization tools like Superset, Metabase, Looker, or Tableau
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field


Nice to have


Prior work in Web3, or an active interest in the crypto space
Experience with blockchain data platforms: Dune Analytics, The Graph, Flipside, etc.
Exposure to staking protocols, validator infrastructure, or DeFi analytics
Experience of building data pipelines with tools like dbt, Airflow etc.


At P2P.org we have a team of experts with their own unique approach and ownership culture. Together we gain experience and make dreams come true! üåü


Full-time Contractor (Indefinite-term Consultancy Agreement)
Competitive salary level in $ (we can also pay in Crypto)
Well-being program
Mental Health care program
Compensation for education, including Foreign Language & professional growth courses
Equipment & co-working reimbursement program
Overseas conferences, community immersion
Positive and friendly communication culture


P2P.org is committed to providing equal opportunities. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability.
