Title: Data Analyst Junior- Control Tower
Description:
Description

The EU External Fulfilment (EF) network consists of circa 35 operations which offer flexible solutions to the CF network operated by external providers (3PL providers). EU EF primarily provides: (1) network capacity solutions (storage/throughput), (2) special operation solutions (Hazmat, BWS, IXD, SDC, ICC, etc) and (3) emerging market penetration solutions. EU EF is currently undergoing an operational transformation, driving demand for enhanced expertise in Outbound (OB).

The goal of EU 3PL Control Tower is to provide an excellent operational end to end, 24/7 support, in 3PL buildings across European/UK External Fulfillment chain. We aim to provide the standardized and optimized process with frustration free communication. This role is for a highly driven and motivated individual with operational experience and innovative, hands-on approach.

This position involves the daily operational tasks resolutions and day to day communication with 3PL and Amazon team of problem solvers and node managers on their KPIs management.

The successful candidate will be responsible for: a- Provide reactive/proactive support to 3PL Providers and Amazon internals, b- Work on internal Projects to improve/automate 3PL Control Tower services. This person has a strong delivery record, attention to details and will be able to work independently with limited supervision.

This job involves 3PL operations monitoring and ops support, within a team that covers 24/7 shift pattern, for 30+ buildings in Europe/UK.

The shift to cover is Night Shift: 10pm CET to 6am CET, Sunday to Thursday (Friday and Saturday: days off).

Key job responsibilities


Providing the operational guidance to 3PL
Being a communication bridge between 3PL and Amazon stakeholders
Mitigating CX risk by CPT management support, resolving OB errors and managing shipment cancellations
Supporting on Transportation escalations.
Uploading critical data for supply chain and transportation visibility
Checking process and Amazon standard compliance
Optimization of actual Control Tower Outbound processes, aiming to automatize the actual tasks of the team, applying BI skills.
Work on Projects to improve actual 3PL Control Tower services, and capture new services that can be scalable to all 3PL sites.


Basic Qualifications


- Relevant experience working with the MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Outlook)
- C1 English level
- Spanish C2 level


Preferred Qualifications


High school or equivalent diploma.
Focus on details and analytical approach.
Expertise in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, AI, etc.
Experience in logistics.


Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you‚Äôre applying in isn‚Äôt listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.

Title: Data Analyst - Tableau
Description:
Hays is collaborating with the leading company in the pharmaceutical sector, TOP 10 pharma with more than 146 affiliates around the world and 47 employees, of which 1,600 are located in Spain. They create innovative medicines for people and animals, adding value through innovation for all three business areas: human pharmaceuticals, animal health, and contract manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals. Now they are in the expansion phase and are developing the animal area. Our client is forming a technological hub that will serve the entire group internationally.




We are looking for a Data Analyst with Tableau to join the team.




Your Commitment will include:

Design and implement necessary visualizations with Tableau that allow stakeholders to understand the reliability level of a certain dataset.
Plan a roadmap of improvements for selected datasets alongside the focus area owners and deploy it accordingly.
Work closely with data engineers, platform managers, business analysts, and focus area owners to understand requirements, formats, completeness, consistency, and accuracy of those datasets that are part of the omnichannel approach.
Use DBT to transform and model data in Snowflake, ensuring that data is well-structured and accessible.
Add new features and enrich the customer journey data model within Snowflake that provides customer knowledge across channels.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical data solutions within Snowflake.




Achieving the difference requires the following skills:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Engineering, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proven experience as a developer with a focus on Snowflake and SQL language. Experience in tuning queries and interpreting query explain plans is valued. Python language experience is also nice to have.
Hands-on experience working with Snowflake cloud data, including transformation and querying.
Ability to create interactive dashboards and visualizations with Tableau.
Committed, proactive, and curious personality, reliable, open, and innovative with a strong interest in business intelligence disciplines.
Fluent English. Any other language is an advantage.




What we offer:

Indefinite contract. Full-time job.
Participation in international projects.
Hybrid work, 1 day office week.
Office: San Cugat del Vall√®s.
Flexible Schedule ‚Äì Monday to Friday from 8/9 to 5/6.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Location: We are flexible! Come and join us either in Hamburg, Berlin, Barcelona or Athens.

FREENOW empowers smarter mobility decisions helping people to move freely and cities to thrive.

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst (m/f/d) to collaborate with our product squads, using data to build a flawless product experience. You will join the Product Data Team and work closely with PMs, designers, UX researchers, developers, and other data functions to discover new product opportunities, validate hypotheses, and launch valuable features to our users.

Be ready to work in a multinational, diverse, highly motivated and collaborative team of passionate analysts who strive for excellence and like to have fun. Are you ready for your next ride?

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURES WILL INCLUDE:


Providing expertise and collaborating with stakeholders to generate new product feature ideas and improvements, and also estimating the potential impact of planned projects.
Continuously engaging with the product squads to gain an understanding of the problems that need to be solved, gathering requirements, and defining the best deliverables to match the business needs.
Having full ownership of your analysis, from ideation to communication of results and making recommendations to all levels of the company including senior management and prioritization committees.
Developing and evaluating A/B test experiments or other analyses to measure and report the performance of released features, ensuring that we are launching the correct changes and features in our apps.
Working closely with our developers and data engineers to create and capture data that is aligned with the business logic and allows modeling and analysis.
Being involved throughout the complete product lifecycle in order to guarantee a data-driven process.
Bringing new insights and championing them using your analyses, dashboards, and good storytelling! We value ideas over hierarchy, and there's always a new path to follow if your idea is convincing and well-backed with data.
You will have the opportunity to steer our products, which kind of features should be developed, and which changes should be made to solve hundreds of thousands of users' daily needs.


TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE:


You have curiosity in your essence, which motivates you to answer WHY things happened, not only scratching the surface, but aiming for well-founded actionable results
Degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, or other fields with a strong mathematical-statistical background
3+ years experience in working as a Data Analyst in a data-driven analytics environment, preferably within tech product organizations, having direct contact with stakeholders.
Exceptional analytical skills, lateral thinking, and proven experience in solving highly challenging problems.
Very good knowledge of SQL, databases, and statistical programming tools (e.g. Python, R) so that exploratory analyses can be performed, reports created and ETLs maintained
Good understanding and hands-on experience in analyzing and interpreting A/B test results, backed by statistical knowledge.
Experience in working with data visualisation tools (e.g.Tableau, Qlikview) and event tracking (e.g. Mixpanel, GA, Firebase)
You are able to communicate findings in a concise and clear manner to a wide variety of stakeholders to support data-driven decision making by using data visualisation and storytelling and have excellent English communication skills.


BENEFITS & PERKS IN A NUTSHELL:


Flexible working arrangements
LinkedIn Learning
Sabbatical & special leave policies
WeRoad partnership
Birthday, 24th + 31st December off
Short term EU work policy
Mobility Credit
Health Insurance
Employee assistance program


Plus more local benefits depending on your work location!

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION:

FREE NOW is an equal opportunity employer and we consider qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability or age.

We want you to grow and evolve, bring your true self to work.

SEE WHAT OUR AWESOME COLLEAGUES SAY ABOUT US:

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to work closely with the ML and Product teams. The candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!¬†

This is a full-time position based in Barcelona.

Your tasks and responsibilities:

Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to influence Product & ML strategies.¬†
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance.
Develop dashboards and processes to ensure data influences decisions at all levels of the company.

Skills and requirements:

3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst / Data Scientist.
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a Quantitative Field (Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science).
Strong problem-solving skills, ability to formulate questions, run analysis to articulate a recommendation.
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present analysis and conclusions.
Strong knowledge and experience of statistical concepts and hypothesis testing.
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus.

Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:

Integrate a highly motivated, young and dynamic team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbecue, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Ticket Restaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28 countries
And more!
Show more

Description:
Researcher/Engineer to support data-based weather forecasting (R2/RE2)

Position

Researcher/Engineer to support data-based weather forecasting (R2/RE2)

Closing Date

Sunday, 31 August, 2025

Reference:

339_25_ES_GES_RE2

Job Title:

Researcher/Engineer to support data-based weather forecasting (R2/RE2)

About BSC

The Barcelona Supercomputing Center - Centro Nacional de Supercomputaci√≥n (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain.

It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, was a founding and hosting member of the former European HPC infrastructure PRACE (Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe), and is now hosting entity for EuroHPC JU, the Joint Undertaking that leads large-scale investments and HPC provision in Europe.

The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress.

BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 1000 staff from 60 countries.

Look At The BSC Experience

BSC-CNS YouTube Channel

Let's stay connected with BSC Folks!

We are particularly interested for this role in the strengths and lived experiences of women and underrepresented groups to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights in science and IT research.

In instances of equal merit, the incorporation of the under-represented sex will be favoured.

We promote Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, fostering an environment where each and every one of us is appreciated for who we are, regardless of our differences.

If you consider that you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to continue applying for the job offer.

We value diversity of experiences and skills, and you could bring unique perspectives to our team.

Context And Mission

The Earth Sciences Department of Barcelona Supercomputing Center (BSC-ES), led by Prof Francisco Doblas-Reyes, develops and use weather, air quality and climate models to improve the current simulation capabilities at both regional and global scales.

The Department is looking for a postdoctoral researcher or research engineer to work on the development of a machine-learning-based, high-resolution, short-term regional weather forecast system for Southern Europe.

The work will be performed using ECMWF's Anemoi framework and developed with a team of physical and computer scientists.

The resulting weather forecasts will be compared to operational weather forecasts simulations performed by different institutions.

The evaluation will include the use of standard verification tools and the analysis of the physical consistency of the predictions.

The researcher will also collaborate with other Department members that use the Anemoi framework to develop global climate emulators and purpose-built machine-learning models for air-quality forecasting.

The incumbent will have the opportunity to collaborate with several European meteorological services.

Key Duties

Lead the development of data-based regional weather forecasting for Southern Europe

Perform a set of short-term weather forecasts for the region to assess the forecast system quality

Evaluate the properties of the weather forecast system, both in terms of forecast quality and the physical consistency of the predictions

Preparing and submitting supercomputing access proposals to support the simulations and LLM tuning

Collaborate with the community developing similar data-based weather forecast systems

Requirements

Education

An MSc in computer science, atmospheric science, applied mathematics, fluid dynamics, or a related discipline

Essential Knowledge And Professional Experience

Experience in machine- and/or deep-learning methods

Experience in atmosphere modelling (or environmental modelling)

Programming skills: scripting (e.g. bash, python) and data analysis is required

Experience In HPC Is Required

Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience

Interest in participating in the writing and, when possible, leading the preparation of research and computing proposals

Knowledge of version control systems (git, svn, cvs...)

Interest in tutoring and/or advising students

Competences

Fluency in spoken and written English, while fluency in other European languages will be also valued

Highly collaborative spirit

Ability to work independently but still as part of a coordinated team

Conditions

The position will be located at BSC within the Earth Sciences Department

We offer a full-time contract (37.5h/week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, restaurant tickets, private health insurance, support to the relocation procedures

Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration

Holidays: 23 paid vacation days plus 24th and 31st of December per our collective agreement

Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona

Starting date: May 2025

Applications procedure and process

All applications must be submitted via the BSC website and contain:

A full CV in English including contact details

A cover/motivation letter with a statement of interest in English, clearly specifying for which specific area and topics the applicant wishes to be considered.

Additionally, two references for further contacts must be included.

Applications without this document will not be considered.

Development of the recruitment process

The selection will be carried out through a competitive examination system ("Concurso-Oposici√≥n").

The Recruitment Process Consists Of Two Phases:

Curriculum Analysis: Evaluation of previous experience and/or scientific history, degree, training, and other professional information relevant to the position.


40 points


Interview phase: The highest-rated candidates at the curriculum level will be invited to the interview phase, conducted by the corresponding department and Human Resources.

In this phase, technical competencies, knowledge, skills, and professional experience related to the position, as well as the required personal competencies, will be evaluated.


60 points.


A minimum of 30 points out of 60 must be obtained to be eligible for the position.

The recruitment panel will be composed of at least three people, ensuring at least 25% representation of women.

In accordance with OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for each vacancy at the beginning of the process.

After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will begin the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview.

At a minimum, a personality questionnaire as well as a technical exercise will be conducted during the process.

The panel will make a final decision, and all individuals who participated in the interview phase will receive feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.

At BSC, we seek continuous improvement in our recruitment processes.

For any suggestions or comments/complaints about our recruitment processes, please contact ******.

For more information, please follow this link.

Deadline

The vacancy will remain open until a suitable candidate has been hired.

Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted.

OTM-R principles for selection processes

BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R).

This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment panels and recognizing career breaks etc.

BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion.

We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable state or local law.

For more information follow this link

Job Title:

About BSC

The Barcelona Supercomputing Center - Centro Nacional de Supercomputaci√≥n (BSC-CNS) is the leading supercomputing center in Spain.

It houses MareNostrum, one of the most powerful supercomputers in Europe, was a founding and hosting member of the former European HPC infrastructure PRACE (Partnership for Advanced Computing in Europe), and is now hosting entity for EuroHPC JU, the Joint Undertaking that leads large-scale investments and HPC provision in Europe.

The mission of BSC is to research, develop and manage information technologies in order to facilitate scientific progress.

BSC combines HPC service provision and R&D into both computer and computational science (life, earth and engineering sciences) under one roof, and currently has over 1000 staff from 60 countries.

Look At The BSC Experience

BSC-CNS YouTube Channel

Let's stay connected with BSC Folks!

We are particularly interested for this role in the strengths and lived experiences of women and underrepresented groups to help us avoid perpetuating biases and oversights in science and IT research.

In instances of equal merit, the incorporation of the under-represented sex will be favoured.

We promote Equity, Diversity and Inclusion, fostering an environment where each and every one of us is appreciated for who we are, regardless of our differences.

If you consider that you do not meet all the requirements, we encourage you to continue applying for the job offer.

We value diversity of experiences and skills, and you could bring unique perspectives to our team.

Context And Mission

The Earth Sciences Department of Barcelona Supercomputing Center (BSC-ES), led by Prof Francisco Doblas-Reyes, develops and use weather, air quality and climate models to improve the current simulation capabilities at both regional and global scales.

The Department is looking for a postdoctoral researcher or research engineer to work on the development of a machine-learning-based, high-resolution, short-term regional weather forecast system for Southern Europe.

The work will be performed using ECMWF's Anemoi framework and developed with a team of physical and computer scientists.

The resulting weather forecasts will be compared to operational weather forecasts simulations performed by different institutions.

The evaluation will include the use of standard verification tools and the analysis of the physical consistency of the predictions.

The researcher will also collaborate with other Department members that use the Anemoi framework to develop global climate emulators and purpose-built machine-learning models for air-quality forecasting.

The incumbent will have the opportunity to collaborate with several European meteorological services.

Key Duties

Lead the development of data-based regional weather forecasting for Southern Europe

Perform a set of short-term weather forecasts for the region to assess the forecast system quality

Evaluate the properties of the weather forecast system, both in terms of forecast quality and the physical consistency of the predictions

Preparing and submitting supercomputing access proposals to support the simulations and LLM tuning

Collaborate with the community developing similar data-based weather forecast systems

Requirements

Education

An MSc in computer science, atmospheric science, applied mathematics, fluid dynamics, or a related discipline

Essential Knowledge And Professional Experience

Experience in machine- and/or deep-learning methods

Experience in atmosphere modelling (or environmental modelling)

Programming skills: scripting (e.g. bash, python) and data analysis is required

Experience In HPC Is Required

Additional Knowledge and Professional Experience

Interest in participating in the writing and, when possible, leading the preparation of research and computing proposals

Knowledge of version control systems (git, svn, cvs...)

Interest in tutoring and/or advising students

Competences

Fluency in spoken and written English, while fluency in other European languages will be also valued

Highly collaborative spirit

Ability to work independently but still as part of a coordinated team

Conditions

The position will be located at BSC within the Earth Sciences Department

We offer a full-time contract (37.5h/week), a good working environment, a highly stimulating environment with state-of-the-art infrastructure, flexible working hours, extensive training plan, restaurant tickets, private health insurance, support to the relocation procedures

Duration: Open-ended contract due to technical and scientific activities linked to the project and budget duration

Holidays: 23 paid vacation days plus 24th and 31st of December per our collective agreement

Salary: we offer a competitive salary commensurate with the qualifications and experience of the candidate and according to the cost of living in Barcelona

Starting date: May 2025

Applications procedure and process

All applications must be submitted via the BSC website and contain:

A full CV in English including contact details

A cover/motivation letter with a statement of interest in English, clearly specifying for which specific area and topics the applicant wishes to be considered.

Additionally, two references for further contacts must be included.

Applications without this document will not be considered.

Development of the recruitment process

The selection will be carried out through a competitive examination system ("Concurso-Oposici√≥n").

The Recruitment Process Consists Of Two Phases:

Curriculum Analysis: Evaluation of previous experience and/or scientific history, degree, training, and other professional information relevant to the position.

  • 40 points

Interview phase: The highest-rated candidates at the curriculum level will be invited to the interview phase, conducted by the corresponding department and Human Resources.

In this phase, technical competencies, knowledge, skills, and professional experience related to the position, as well as the required personal competencies, will be evaluated.

  • 60 points.

A minimum of 30 points out of 60 must be obtained to be eligible for the position.

The recruitment panel will be composed of at least three people, ensuring at least 25% representation of women.

In accordance with OTM-R principles, a gender-balanced recruitment panel is formed for each vacancy at the beginning of the process.

After reviewing the content of the applications, the panel will begin the interviews, with at least one technical and one administrative interview.

At a minimum, a personality questionnaire as well as a technical exercise will be conducted during the process.

The panel will make a final decision, and all individuals who participated in the interview phase will receive feedback with details on the acceptance or rejection of their profile.

At BSC, we seek continuous improvement in our recruitment processes.

For any suggestions or comments/complaints about our recruitment processes, please contact ******.

For more information, please follow this link.

Deadline

The vacancy will remain open until a suitable candidate has been hired.

Applications will be regularly reviewed and potential candidates will be contacted.

OTM-R principles for selection processes

BSC-CNS is committed to the principles of the Code of Conduct for the Recruitment of Researchers of the European Commission and the Open, Transparent and Merit-based Recruitment principles (OTM-R).

This is applied for any potential candidate in all our processes, for example by creating gender-balanced recruitment panels and recognizing career breaks etc.

BSC-CNS is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion.

We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or any other basis protected by applicable state or local law.

Title: Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
Who we are:

Want to make an impact? Join our pack and come work (and play!) with us.




We believe everyone deserves the unconditional love of a pet‚Äîand at Rover, our mission is to make it easier to experience that love. Founded in 2011, the Rover app and website connect dog and cat parents with loving pet sitters and dog walkers in neighborhoods across the US, Canada, and Europe. We empower our community of trusted pet sitters and dog walkers to run their own pet care businesses on Rover with the tools and security of a global company to back them.




Headquartered in Seattle, Washington, we work closely with our teams in Barcelona, San Antonio, Spokane, and remote locations. We‚Äôve got a reputation for being a great place to work, having been named among the 100 Best Companies to Work For in Seattle Business Magazine and Washington‚Äôs Best Workplaces in the Puget Sound Business Journal. We're an agile, fast-growing company, and our leadership comes from some of the world's most respected tech companies.




At Rover, our furry coworkers are just as important as our human ones‚Äîand we wouldn‚Äôt have it any other way. Along with making the joys of pet parenthood more accessible, we‚Äôre committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and welcoming community of pet people‚Äîand that starts with our employees.




Who we're looking for:

The Marketing Analytics team supports the company‚Äôs marketing efforts, while also working with teams throughout the organization. The analytics team is responsible for a number of business-critical reports and data models that our global marketing teams rely on for daily reporting, budgeting, and analysis. We measure marketing attribution to understand how people become Rover customers, provide campaign reporting to monitor trends in cost efficiency and optimization, deliver lifecycle data to action against a variety of customer behaviors, and narrate the business to identify and prioritize new opportunities.




We are looking for an Analyst to support our Growth, International Expansion, Lifecycle, and SEO stakeholders with a focus on improving our reporting and dashboard structure. The ideal candidate will have experience working closely with business stakeholders and building data-driven narratives that enable clear decision making.




*This is a hybrid position that has the minimum expectation to work out of our Barcelona Office in the Poblenou neighborhood two days per week on Mondays and Thursdays. For this reason, candidates must be based in Barcelona or willing to relocate.




Your Responsibilities:

Work closely with analytics peers and marketing teams to narrate trends and insights, with a particular focus on our customer acquisition marketing programs.
Design reports and dashboards that enable clear, data-driven decision-making for marketing and cross-functional teams.
Refine our marketing attribution models to drive optimal resource allocation across paid and organic marketing channels.
Expand your expertise by supporting experiments such as A/B testing and Market Match tests to optimize strategies across multiple marketing functions.




Your Qualifications:

At least 2 years experience working with complex datasets to support business decision making.
Fluency in SQL.
Data visualisation tool experience (e.g. Mode, Looker, Tableau, etc.)
Ability to adapt your communication style to translate complex data insights for different audiences.
You have experience in owning small-to-medium projects from design to completion with limited guidance from your manager.
You understand when you are blocked, proactively seeking out for help within the team or the organization to move the project forward.




Nice to Have:

Python or R familiarity is helpful, but we welcome candidates eager to develop these skills.
Experience evaluating results of A/B tests as well as expertise in statistical analysis.
Understanding of marketing metrics such as clicks, CPC, CTR, impressions, and unit economics like customer LTV, payback period, and CAC.




Benefits of working at Rover:

Competitive compensation
Long-term incentive plan with a company performance-based cash payout
Permanent contract
Pension plan
Meal tickets through Cobee
Generous PTO allowance
Private health insurance
Discounted gym membership
Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
Monetary help for adopting a dog or cat plus yearly credit to use on our platform
A wide variety of snacks, fresh fruit, and beverages in our kitchen to keep yourself going
Regular team activities, including happy hours, game nights, and more




Rover is an equal-opportunity employer committed to promoting a diverse, inclusive, and inventive environment with the best employees. We‚Äôre driven by seeing our people succeed and grow, and we work to ensure everyone contributes to their fullest potential. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, protected veteran status, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and ordinances.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Happy Mammoth:

Happy Mammoth is a high-growth e-commerce company dedicated to empowering women‚Äôs health through natural, science-backed supplements focused on gut, digestive, and hormonal wellness. As a performance-driven company, we are passionate about making a meaningful, lasting impact on our customers' lives. You can learn more about us at https://happymammoth.com/.

Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:


This is a fully remote contractor role, available full-time
The role requires availability during EU hours (GMT)


At Happy Mammoth, you can expect:


A strong salary package
A welcoming and nurturing work environment, with colleagues from around the world
A fast-paced, dynamic, and non-corporate atmosphere where adaptability is key
The chance to be part of our exciting global expansion journey
Flexible working hours
Free access to courses, books and Masterminds
Opportunities for professional growth and development


Job Summary:

As a Data Analyst at Happy Mammoth, you‚Äôll be at the heart of our data-driven efforts. Your insights will directly influence our strategies to optimize customer acquisition, retention, and lifetime value. In this role, you‚Äôll dive into customer behavior, analyze marketing performance, and provide actionable insights that drive our direct-response and B2C marketing initiatives.

Responsibilities:


Collect, analyze, and interpret data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform our business strategies
Build, maintain, and automate dashboards and reports to track KPIs, including ROAS, CPA, conversion rates, CLTV, and customer retention metrics
Work closely with cross-functional teams, such as marketing, product, and finance, to provide data-driven insights that support campaign performance and strategic marketing decisions
Provide ad hoc analysis to address specific business questions
Ensure data quality and accuracy by regularly validating and cleansing datasets
Communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through reports, presentations, and storytelling


Qualifications:


Proven experience in data analysis, preferably with a focus on e-commerce
Proficiency in SQL and Excel
Proven experience in data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Data Studio, Looker, Power BI or similar)
Hands-on experience with cloud-based data warehouses and architectures (familiarity with Google BigQuery is a strong asset)
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Effective communicator with the ability to convey complex data insights clearly


What will set you apart:


You have a genuine hunger for success in all parts of your life
You thrive taking action, taking responsibility and getting things done before deadlines
You‚Äôre able to self-manage based upon the overall scope and work required
You‚Äôre able to diagnose and solve technical problems quickly
You're able to work as part of a team and actively contribute to conversations
A willingness to learn and grow with the business


CVs should be in English

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Madrid, Spain (Relocation Package Included)




Job Summary:

We are seeking a results-driven Data Analyst with strong experience in Tableau, SQL, and data analytics to support data-driven decision-making across the organization. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, building insightful dashboards, and delivering actionable business intelligence to key stakeholders.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop, maintain, and enhance interactive dashboards and reports using Tableau and other BI tools
Analyze large datasets using SQL to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that support strategic business decisions
Work with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and translate them into functional BI solutions
Perform gap analysis between legacy systems and new data platforms to ensure reporting continuity
Validate and reconcile data across different sources to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency
Communicate complex findings in a clear, concise, and business-friendly manner through reports, visualizations, and presentations
Assist in defining and documenting data definitions, business rules, and report specifications
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business units to support data initiatives




Required Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Business Intelligence, or a related field
3+ years of professional experience as a Data Analyst, BI Analyst, or similar role
Strong expertise in SQL for data extraction, analysis, and validation
Proficient in using Tableau for building dashboards, data storytelling, and visualizations
Experience working with large datasets and relational databases
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail
Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Proficiency with other BI tools (e.g., Power BI, QlikView, Looker) is a plus
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data governance is desirable




Preferred Skills:

Experience working in cloud data environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP)
Familiarity with Python or R for data analysis (optional but beneficial)
Exposure to Agile development practices
Understanding of KPIs, metrics, and performance tracking in a business context

Title: Data Analyst - Fintech
Description:
At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, we are seeking an ambitious and detail-oriented Data Analyst - Payments Specialist to drive data-led insights and support our payments strategy during a critical expansion phase. As a fast-growing B2C company with a strong presence in the US and European markets, we are focused on scaling our brand, optimising payment performance, and enhancing fraud prevention. This role requires a strong analytical mindset and a deep understanding of digital payment ecosystems, transactional data, and customer behaviour. You will play a key role in analysing payment trends, identifying inefficiencies, preventing fraud, and enabling data-driven decision-making across our payments and risk operations.

Key Responsibilities:

You're our perfect candidate if you:


Investigate, prioritise, and document anomalies in payments data and fraud patterns to support rapid issue resolution and risk mitigation
Use advanced Excel skills (e.g., VLOOKUPs, pivot tables, IF conditions) to analyse payment transactions, identify unusual behaviour, and support reconciliation efforts
Ensure data accuracy across payment systems by validating transaction records and flagging inconsistencies or suspicious activity
Identify trends in payment failures, chargebacks, and fraud attempts to drive process improvements and reduce financial risk
Implement consumer data acquisition strategies and e-commerce analytics with a focus on optimising payment funnel performance and detecting fraud signals
Build and apply consumer segmentation and profiling models to detect high-risk behaviours and improve fraud prevention tactics
Respond to data analysis requests from fraud teams, compliance, finance, and operations with a focus on payment performance and fraud detection insights
Retrieve, clean, and prepare transactional data for deep analysis of payment patterns, fraud triggers, and refund behaviours
Contribute to daily, weekly, monthly, and annual reporting on payments KPIs, fraud rates, authorization success rates, and risk events
Perform in-depth analysis on large volumes of payments and fraud-related data using advanced techniques to extract actionable insights
Define and enforce data quality standards specific to payments and fraud monitoring systems, ensuring high confidence in real-time decisions
Maintain expertise in analytics tools and practices relevant to payments processing, fraud detection, and compliance reporting
Collaborate with engineering, product, risk, and business intelligence teams to embed data quality controls across payments and fraud pipelines
Create and optimise metrics and dashboards to monitor payment success, fraud incidents, transaction declines, and risk thresholds
Communicate key insights on payment performance and fraud trends to stakeholders, driving cross-functional initiatives for improvement
Research discrepancies in payment data and correct records to ensure accurate transaction histories and trustworthy reporting
Monitor real-time analytics dashboards for drops in payment success rates or spikes in fraud indicators, enabling swift investigation and escalation
Review and act on data control alerts related to payment processing, chargebacks, fraud scoring models, and transaction integrity
Continuously analyse payment flows to detect fraud attempts, reduce false positives, and improve approval rates through data-driven strategies


Requirements

Your expertise in a nutshell:


3+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, in payments, fraud, or transactional data
Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets and relational databases
Proficient in BI/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel.
Solid understanding of digital payment systems, chargebacks, fraud indicators, and PSPs
Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and data quality best practices
Familiarity with Python, R, or statistical tools (SPSS, SAS) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
Ability to communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proactive, well-organized, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment
Fluent in English, both written and spoken
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science)


YOUR TEAM:


We're team-first. If you believe in the power of collaboration and thatthe team's success is your success,then you're one of us!
Fun is fundamental. We believe in forming strong bonds in and outside the oce. That's why we have a team-building budget and organize activities to enjoy ourselves.
Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus


Benefits

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US?

Growth and career development


At Leadtech, we prioritize your growth. Enjoy a flexible career path with personalized internal training and an annual budget for external learning opportunities


Work-Life balance


Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!


Comprehensive benefits


Competitive salary, full-time permanent contract, and top-tier private health insurance (including dental and psychological services)
25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!


Unique Perks


If you wish to come, in our office in Barcelona you'll find it complete with free coffee, fresh fruit, snacks, a game room, and a rooftop terrace with stunning Mediterranean views
Additional benefits include ticket restaurant and nursery vouchers, paid directly from your gross salary


Join us in an environment where you're free to innovate, learn, and grow alongside passionate professionals. At Leadtech, you'll tackle exciting challenges and be part of a vibrant team dedicated to delivering exceptional user experiences

Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Leadtech is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer, which means we encourage applications from people with different backgrounds, interests, and personal circumstances. Our team welcomes applicants regardless of their race, gender, age, religion, nationality, sexual orientation, and/or disabilities. All we need is your high energy, skills, and willingness to be part of a great project!

Location

You'll have the flexibility to choose whether you'd like to come to the office every day, from time to time, or work fully remote. We want you to find the best combination for you.

If you prefer to be surrounded with amazing people, our exceptional office is in Barcelona's Blue Building, located right on the city's seafront. Besides our stunning views, you'll enjoy our office perks such as free fruit, snacks, and coffee and you'll also be able to take part in our Mario Kart and table tennis competitions.

The personal data you provide will be used to manage your candidacy for the corporate selection processes that fit your profile. If you wish, you can exercise your rights of access, rectification or cancellation by sending a letter to Avenida Litoral, 12-14, 5ta planta, Barcelona 08005, or emailing us at protecciondedatos@LeadTech.com, including a document that validates your identity.

HTML:
At Leadtech, we've been redefining digital businesses since 2009, creating innovative online solutions that reach millions of users every month. With a diverse team of over 700 members from 23+ nationalities, we're united by a passion for creativity and collaboration.

We specialize in delivering user-centric experiences across web and mobile platforms, where people can connect with our products like never before.

We're proud of our global reach and committed to fostering an inclusive workplace where every individual contributes to our shared vision of bringing cutting-edge projects to life. Learn more about our journey and mission on our About Us page!

About The Role

Due to continuous growth, we are seeking an ambitious and detail-oriented Data Analyst - Payments Specialist to drive data-led insights and support our payments strategy during a critical expansion phase. As a fast-growing B2C company with a strong presence in the US and European markets, we are focused on scaling our brand, optimising payment performance, and enhancing fraud prevention. This role requires a strong analytical mindset and a deep understanding of digital payment ecosystems, transactional data, and customer behaviour. You will play a key role in analysing payment trends, identifying inefficiencies, preventing fraud, and enabling data-driven decision-making across our payments and risk operations.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Research discrepancies in payment data and correct records to ensure accurate transaction histories and trustworthy reporting
  • Monitor real-time analytics dashboards for drops in payment success rates or spikes in fraud indicators, enabling swift investigation and escalation
  • Review and act on data control alerts related to payment processing, chargebacks, fraud scoring models, and transaction integrity
  • Continuously analyse payment flows to detect fraud attempts, reduce false positives, and improve approval rates through data-driven strategies

Requirements

Your expertise in a nutshell:

  • Strong SQL skills and experience with large datasets and relational databases
  • Proficient in BI/reporting tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker) and Excel.
  • Solid understanding of digital payment systems, chargebacks, fraud indicators, and PSPs
  • Experience with data modelling, ETL processes, and data quality best practices
  • Familiarity with Python, R, or statistical tools (SPSS, SAS) is a plus
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
  • Ability to communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical stakeholders
  • Proactive, well-organized, and adaptable in a fast-paced environment
  • Fluent in English, both written and spoken
  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Economics, Computer Science)

YOUR TEAM:

  • Positivity wins the day. Bring a positive attitude and communicate openly. Self-awareness and an openness to learn are always a plus

  • Benefit from a flexible schedule with flextime (7 - 9:30 a.m. start, 3:30 - 6 p.m. end) and the option of working full remote or from our Barcelona office. Enjoy free Friday afternoons with a 7-hour workday, plus a 35-hour workweek in July and August so you can savor summer!

Comprehensive benefits

  • 25 days of vacation plus your birthday off, with flexible vacation options‚Äîno blackout days!

Title: Data Analyst (SQL Coding Skills)
Description:
For one of our main IT customers based in Sant Cugat del Valles (Barcelona), we are looking for a Data Analyst, with advanced SQL knowledge, project and data analyst management skills to develop the EMEA Omni Policy Data Management Coordinator role. The work language will be English.




General Data:

Hours: 09:00 - 18:00h. (40 hours)
Location: Barcelona (hybrid) / also possible Madrid (hybrid)
Start Date: Immediate
Salary range: 28K - 32K




Responsibilities:

Global Omni Amplify online data management project coordinator: Data management flow, analytics, reporting and optimization.
EMEA Omni Policy data management support coordinator : T1/T2 analytics, reporting and optimization.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or related field.
Development experience with programming languages.
SQL skill is critical and required.
Proficiency with data analysis tools: Excel, Power BI, Phyton.




Languages:

English: Advanced Level (Minimun C1).

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Power BI & Finance Data)

Location: Spain, Fully Remote - Spanish & UK Residents accepted

Start Date: January 2026

Duration: 12+ Months

Rate: ¬£45/50 per hour

Language: English; Spanish is a nice to have




Key Responsibilities:

Analysis & Financial Insights: Conduct in-depth analysis of financial data (sales, revenue, profit, sustainability) to assess dealer performance and identify areas for improvement.
Data Modeling & Transformation: Leverage Power BI and other tools to transform and model complex data from various financial systems, primarily Snowflake/SQL, into actionable insights.
Customer Interaction & Relationship Building: Actively engage with business partners to gather requirements, understand business needs, and translate them into technical solutions. Build strong relationships with stakeholders to ensure alignment and delivery of high-value insights.
BI Solutions Development: Develop and maintain robust Business Intelligence (BI) solutions, with a focus on financial metrics and visual reporting. This includes working on data flows, data models, and dynamic reporting dashboards using Power BI.
Collaboration & Agile Development: Work in Agile teams alongside colleagues in Spain and India to design and implement data solutions with high criticality and complex data models.
Proactive Problem Solving: Identify areas for process improvement, propose solutions, and be an active go-getter in driving value for the business.




Skills & Experience Required:

BI & Power Platform Expertise: At least 5 years of experience in Business Intelligence solutions, specifically with Power BI, Power Apps, and Power Automate. Expertise in Power Query (M language), DAX, data modeling, and dynamic Row-Level Security (RLS) in Power BI.
Financial Data Analysis: Strong experience in analyzing financial data such as sales, revenue, profit, and sustainability metrics. Ability to work with financial indicators and assess financial health.
Data Engineering & ETL Processes: Experience with ETL processes, data warehouses (Snowflake), and integration of data from various sources (ERP, CRM, SQL, APIs, etc.).
Data Modeling & Data Flows: Proficiency in designing and building data models, transforming raw data into clean, structured, and insightful datasets for reporting.
Business Analysis: Ability to work with business teams to identify and define statistical indicators, metrics, and ratios for business needs, ensuring that the data aligns with business goals.
Collaboration & Communication: Strong communication skills with the ability to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Proven experience in gathering requirements and translating them into technical specifications.
Agile Methodologies: Experience working within Agile teams, with a strong focus on delivering high-quality, customized BI solutions.
Proactive & Independent: A proactive, self-driven attitude with the ability to work independently and take ownership of tasks and responsibilities.




Key Tools & Technologies:

Power BI (Power Query, DAX, Data Modeling, Visuals)
Power Apps & Power Automate
Snowflake (Data Warehousing, ETL)
SQL, MySQL (Data Sources)
ERP, CRM Systems (Data Integration)
Agile Development Methodologies




Desirable Traits:

Customer-Focused: Ability to maintain ongoing communication with clients, ensuring solutions meet their requirements.
Proactive Approach: Ability to take initiative, propose solutions, and work in a fast-paced environment.
Detail-Oriented: High attention to detail with a focus on delivering high-quality results.




Working Environment:

Fully remote role, but preference for candidates based in Spain, Portugal, or the UK.
Collaborative environment with team members based in The UK, Spain and India.
Agile work environment with an emphasis on critical, high-impact solutions.




This role is an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst with a strong financial background and BI solution expertise, offering the chance to make a significant impact within a dynamic, international team.

If you are available and interested in this opportunity, please apply for further information.

Please note due to high volumes of applications we are unable to contact every application. If you do not hear back from us within 7 days of sending your application, please assume that you have not been successful on this occasion.

At Lucid, we celebrate difference and value diverse perspectives, underpinned by our values ‚ÄòHonesty, Integrity and Pragmatism‚Äô. We are proud to provide equal opportunities in line with our Diversity and Inclusion policy and welcome applications from all suitably qualified or experienced people, regardless of personal characteristics. If you have a disability or health condition and seek support throughout the recruitment process, please do not hesitate to contact us via the details below.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

THE WORLD OF UBISOFT

Ubisoft is a global leader in gaming with teams across the world creating original and memorable gaming experiences, from Assassin‚Äôs Creed, Rainbow Six, to Just Dance and more. We believe diverse perspectives help both players and teams thrive. If you‚Äôre passionate about innovation and pushing entertainment boundaries, join our journey and help us create the unknown!

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile‚ÄØbrings together dedicated and experienced professionals that are focused on crafting high-quality F2P games for mobile. We strongly believe in the core values at the centre of our Ubilife, which encourage us to take ownership of our work, continually striving for excellence while promoting the sharing of knowledge across individuals and teams, without losing our sense of enjoyment and fun, while taking care for one another. We strive for a safe and respectful workplace for all team members and we‚Äôre transparent about the measures we are taking to do so. For this reason, Ubisoft‚Äôs Code of Conduct has been released publicly on our corporate website for all current and future team members.

Do you want to join us in the world of mobile gaming? If so, read on!

Job Description

YOUR DAILY ADVENTURE

Ubisoft Barcelona Mobile is currently seeking a Data Analyst to help our team on their next adventure. The Data Analyst will support insight initiatives for our BI team and will be reporting to our Director of Data & Analytics. Your daily adventure:



Turning data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on research, data exploration and analysis, to drive decisions and strategies for user acquisition, retention, and monetization.
Work with the game teams to provide insights into user behaviour, answer key business questions and support in AB test design and analysis.
Carry out projects on machine learning for behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Debugging and problem-solving issues to ensure the delivery of accurate and clear analysis, reports and tools.
Effectively communicate results and insights to senior stakeholders throughout the organization.
Coordinate, challenge and share the best analytical practices and methods within the organization.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in Machine Learning technologies and Data Science trends.
Contribute to the knowledge base and culture of the team.



Qualifications

YOUR SKILLS

Are you serious about fun? Do you consistently seek out learning opportunities and aim to beat your high score? Are you open to new ideas, perspectives and cultures and believe that it takes a world to build a world? At Ubisoft, you‚Äôll work alongside passionate and talented teams who are imagining the future of entertainment.



Master's degree in a quantitative field (i.e. Physics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science...). PhD in any of these disciplines is a plus.
5+ years relevant work experience in similar positions, ideally in mobile gaming industry.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python for data exploratory analysis
Experience with cloud-based big data solutions such as Redshift, BigQuery.
Solid knowledge of data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker, Microstrategy, etc.
Robust understanding of advanced statistics suitable for analysis of skewed populations.
Experience designing effective ways of communicating, visualising and reporting results/analysis.
Experience in predictive analytics and segmentation.
Excellent problem-solving capabilities with strong attention to details.
Work permit for Spain obtained prior to applying for the position is a must.



What can make you stand out:



Experience with Agile philosophies (e.g.: Scrum, Kanban, XP) and project management tools (e.g.: JIRA)
Software engineering skills, including best practices like CI/CD and Git.
Self-motivation, organization skills, team spirit, proactivity.
Passion for games. Interest in mobile F2P games.



Additional Information

YOUR LIFE AT UBISOFT BARCELONA MOBILE (and PERKS)



Hybrid work model.
Possibility for new parents to work from home 80% of the time.
Flexible working hours: 40-hour workweek with start times between 8 AM and 10 AM (or from 7:30 AM when working onsite to avoid traffic jams), and early leave from 4 PM (Fridays from 2 PM).
Reduced schedule‚ÄØ(35 hrs per week) in July and August, Easter, Christmas holidays, and special days like Sant Jordi and Revetlla de Sant Joan.
Personal Matters Hours:‚ÄØ24 hours paid for by Ubisoft that you can use for personal matters.
Holidays:‚ÄØ25 days per year + 1 day in your‚ÄØUbi-Birthday.
5 extra holiday‚ÄØdays‚ÄØon the year you celebrate your 5th/10th/15th/20th year with us.
Ticket Restaurant: 210‚Ç¨ per month, and‚ÄØFlexible compensation plan‚ÄØ(Ticket Transport & Ticket Nursery).
Health insurance‚ÄØwith Cigna, including‚ÄØPhysiotherapist & Psychology sessions‚ÄØwith a reduced price.
Life Insurance‚ÄØwith AXA.
Mobile Device‚ÄØGrant‚ÄØof 400 EUR‚ÄØstarting on your 1st year in the company.
Language trainings‚ÄØin English, Spanish, and French.
Professional development training & programs, based upon request.
Ubisoft games with discount‚ÄØand Uplay PC for free.
Locally roasted craft coffee‚ÄØby INCAPTO (it‚Äôs very, very good).



Ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. We are an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender sexual orientation, age or disability status.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas ‚Äì immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care ‚Äì and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

The Data Analyst will work within Customer Engagement Analytics team in Spain, to provide technical expertise in Advance/Predictive/Prescriptive Analytics. The key responsibilities of the role will be to contribute to AbbVie Data Analytics projects and support Data Science projects. Should be highly analytical with love and high affinity for analysis, mathematics and statistics. Additionally, not only should be familiar with quantitative methodologies and programming but also keen on business acumen. The Data Analyst should have passion for data analysis, data quality and accuracy, data exploration, machine learning and out of the box thinking.

Key responsibilities:

Serve as a relevant member of Customer Engagement Analytics, working in close partnership with the rest of team member and Global Winning with Data team to implement global and local initiatives in the affiliate, becoming a trusted partner of the CEx local team.

Develop in collaboration with the commercial teams and other CEx teams, advanced analytics, identify synergies, optimize reporting strategy to generate business relevant outcomes.

Master in different Foundry datasets of varying complexity and size levels and develop new ways to generate creative predictive analytic solutions to work around data limitations.

Qualifications

BS degree in mathematics, statistics or engineering, computer science or economics complemented with a master in Big Data, Artificial Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Data Science or equivalent.

Portfolio of work demonstrating data science applications.

Minimum of 2 years of applied data science in fields such as data engineering, predictive modelling,

Experience analyzing and drawing insights from key internally and externally generated data sets.

Analytical reasoning abilities, intellectual curiosity, strong business acumen and creative problem solving.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.




Your Challenge




You will get full ownership of our business data and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyse the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing the efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratisation of data inside the company and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed




You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications/education in Data/ Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar, and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modelling.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.
Have experience working with Tableau.




Why Join Seedtag?




Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks




Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure?




Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure is seeking a talented, innovative, passionate¬†Data Analyst to join our growing and successful Group Marketing Team, reporting to the Group Head of Web development & Analytics.

Verisure is building a talented and passionate Digital Marketing Team, and the Data Analyst position is key to its success! This is your chance to visibly impact on Verisure‚Äôs growth and the development of a best-in-class organization.

The role‚Äôs relevance in data collection and analysis is a great opportunity for a strong talent to develop our organization‚Äôs growth. Our success depends on our people, and we invest in them every day. Working with Verisure is being part of an industry leading, world-class company that thrives on a strong entrepreneurial spirit.

Key Responsibilities

As a core member of the Group Digital Marketing team, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in driving data-informed decision-making by performing the following responsibilities:

Improving the quality and consistency of digital marketing tracking, collaborating with technical teams to maintain a robust data infrastructure and ensure the integrity of analytics data.
Designing, building, and maintaining marketing performance dashboards and reports using Tableau, Looker Studio or similar data visualization tools, ensuring clarity, accuracy, and usability for diverse stakeholders.
Engaging with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, translate them into data requirements, and deliver actionable insights through compelling analysis and visual storytelling.
Partnering with teams across the organization, including Product, CRM, and Web, to identify data opportunities, support campaign measurement, and foster a data-driven culture.
Extracting and manipulating data using SQL to support advanced analytics and reporting needs.
Contributing to the development and lifecycle of Adtech products, including participation in requirement definition, data architecture design, and ongoing maintenance.

Location

The position will be based in Madrid (Spain).

Candidate profile

Qualifications, Experiences, and Competencies

Required Qualifications

Education & Experience

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Marketing, or a related field.
Minimum of 2‚Äì3 years of experience in data analysis within a digital marketing or Adtech environment.
Experience working in multinational or cross-market teams is a plus.

Technical Skills

Good understanding of digital tracking technologies, including GA4, Google Tag Manager, and custom event tracking.
Solid experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker Studio.
Familiarity with digital marketing platforms (e.g. Google Ads, Meta Ads, DV360, etc.).
Knowledge of marketing KPIs, attribution models, customer journey analysis, and performance measurement.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, cleaning, and manipulation across large datasets.
Ability to handle large datasets and navigate data warehouse environments (experience with BigQuery is a plus).
Basic understanding of Python or R for automation and exploratory data analysis is an advantage.

Analytical & Business Acumen

Strong ability to translate business problems into analytical questions and deliver actionable insights.
Working knowledge of conversion funnel analysis, CRO strategies, and campaign optimization.
Experience with A/B testing design, analysis, and interpretation is a plus.

Communication & Collaboration

Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, CRM, Design, and Content.
Proactive, detail-oriented, and comfortable working autonomously in a fast-paced environment.

Languages

Fluent English is required (written and spoken).
Other languages (e.g. Spanish, French, German, or Nordic languages) are a plus.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with Google BigQuery or similar cloud-based data platforms.
Exposure to Adtech environments, CDPs (Customer Data Platforms), or server-side tracking.
Experience with automated reporting solutions or building data pipelines.
Familiarity with marketing mix modeling, predictive analytics, or machine learning use cases.
Certifications such as:
Google Analytics Certification
Tableau/Power BI certifications
Meta or Google Ads certifications

Strong fit with our Company DNA

Passionate in Everything We Do: Our people have a sense of energy that is unmistakable, one that drives us to delight our customers and focus on creating impact quickly.¬†

Committed to Making a Difference: When we say we will do something; we deliver with excellence. We are accountable, focused and operate with discipline.¬†

Always Innovating: We believe that Innovation can be big or small; it‚Äôs a continuous state of mind that inspires us to think differently and always make things better. We are risk takers and we learn continuously.¬†

Winning as a Team: Our people know that by leveraging one another‚Äôs strengths, investing in and developing our team‚Äôs capability and by collaborating well, we will win.

With Trust & Responsibility: Operating with integrity is core to our success. We are humble, honest and value deep mastery and expertise. We do the right thing, always.

The Company

Verisure is the leading European provider of professionally monitored security systems with 24/7 response services. We protect more than 5 million families and small businesses across 17 countries in Europe and Latin America. And our mission is to provide our customers peace of mind by protecting what matters most to them.

With over 35 years of insight, experience, and innovation, Verisure is known for category-creating marketing, sales excellence, innovative products and services, and customer-centricity. Thanks to a strong focus on high quality, our customers are amongst the most satisfied and loyal in our industry. We have some of the strongest double-digit growth and retention rates globally in consumer-facing services which demonstrates our exceptional service levels and strong value proposition to our customers.

Diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging at Verisure

At Verisure, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace, recognising that diversity of thought and background only makes our teams stronger and more innovative. We reject all forms of discrimination and bias, and we believe in access to opportunities for everyone, regardless of gender, age, disability status, race, sexual orientation, or any other status. Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging values are embedded in our company‚Äôs DNA. And we continue to prioritise our DEIB efforts every day to create a more inclusive organisation, enable diverse representation of our community, and ensure equity and meritocracy every step of the way.
¬†

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Barcelona - Spain

Flexible working: 60% home office / week‚ÄØ

Job type: Permanent, Full time‚ÄØ - Hybrid

About The Job

At Sanofi, we're committed to providing next-gen healthcare through the power of data insights and AI. As a Data Engineer in our Manufacturing & Supply Digital Data Foundations team, you'll play a crucial role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive innovation and business value. You'll be part of an exciting journey to revolutionize our manufacturing processes through data-driven decision making.

We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people's lives. Our Digital Data & Technology organization is transforming Sanofi into an AI-driven powerhouse, creating trusted, high-quality data platforms that enable better decision-making across our global operations.

Main Responsibilities


Design and implement robust data engineering pipelines for Manufacturing & Supply systems, including SAP S4/HANA, QMS, LIMS, and MES
Create and maintain data integration solutions with comprehensive lifecycle management
Develop data visualization solutions using design-thinking approaches to deliver high-value products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in agile pods to understand and translate business requirements
Ensure data quality and compliance with regulatory requirements (Data Privacy, GxP, SOX)
Build and optimize data models to support Manufacturing & Supply analytics needs


About You


Experience in data engineering and ETL/ELT development, particularly with Informatica/IICS and DBT/Airflow
Strong SQL skills and proficiency in Python for data transformation
Knowledge of data governance principles and quality assessment methodologies
Experience with cloud technologies, preferably AWS
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
Agile mindset with excellent communication and collaboration skills


Why choose us?


Drive innovation at the intersection of healthcare and technology
Develop your expertise with cutting-edge data and AI platforms
Enjoy a thoughtful rewards package that recognizes your contribution
Take advantage of flexible working arrangements and comprehensive health benefits
Work with global teams on transformative digital initiatives
Access continuous learning opportunities and career growth paths

Let‚Äôs Pursue Progress and Discover Extraordinary ‚Äì together.
