Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Kiwi.com

Kiwi.com is a leading global travel-tech company headquartered in the Czech Republic. Our innovative algorithm enables users to find better route options and prices other search engines can‚Äôt see, daily performing billions of price checks across 95% of global flight content. Are you bold, bright and curious? Join a global business that‚Äôs still got a start-up heart.

About Our Content Analytics Team

Our team is responsible for providing data-centric insights that enable the optimization of our flight content acquisition and processing. We use extensive datasets to support booking channel performance, improve autobooking efficiency and ensure data quality across our systems. Our work directly impacts Kiwi.com 's ability to offer our customers unique travel combinations and a smooth booking experience worldwide. We combine technical expertise with business understanding to build data-informed recommendations across multiple teams and stakeholders.

What You Will Do


You will conduct complex ad-hoc analysis using BigQuery and Looker, delivering insights that support thoughtful decision-making.
By creating and maintaining dashboards for key business metrics, you will help make data accessible and meaningful for stakeholders.
You will work with Looker's analytical layer, defining explores, measures and dimensions to support robust data exploration.
You will collaborate on building data models and support data quality through rigorous QA processes in collaboration with our data engineers.
You will evaluate and improve our complex flight booking and data acquisition systems, identifying opportunities for optimization.
You‚Äôll create data-informed recommendations by sharing practical insights with our flight content ecosystem.
You will help develop monitoring and alerting tools for product operations, enabling proactive incident detection and prevention.


What You Will Need


Your strong SQL skills and experience with BigQuery or similar data warehouses.
You have experience with BI tools (we use Looker) and a solid understanding of data modeling and data quality standards.
You can translate complex analytical findings into actionable insights that drive results.
You bring experience working with large datasets and collaborating with multiple stakeholders across teams.
Your excellent communication skills in English enable you to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
You have an analytical mindset with a strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and precision in your work.
You are capable of working independently while aligning with and contributing to team goals.


We offer you


We offer a hybrid and flexible work environment. A lovely, modern office in the center of Barcelona (Passeig de Gracia) with great views and amenities.
Monthly entitlement of 200 Euro redeemable through Cobee. Cobee is a benefits platform offering a range of benefits (meals, transport, nursery, health insurance, and physical wellness) and flexible compensation. It also allows our employees to allocate up to 30% of their gross salary to the consumption of certain products or services, leveraging tax exemption.
We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days and sick days.
Annual financial bonus based on company and individual performance.
Flight vouchers to celebrate your Kiwi anniversaries.
Relocation package (including visa transfer support).
Dogs are welcome in our offices.


Interested? Join us and help us make travel more accessible to all.

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it‚Äôs finished, we‚Äôre going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/ .

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
TENNIUM is a sports management company specialising in the tennis industry globally. Our vision is to build a multi-business platform within the world of tennis, combining a range of synergetic activities including the organisation of top-tier ATP, WTA and ITF tournaments in Europe and South America, management & representation of top professional players & young talent, and selected consulting engagements with different industry stakeholders.

Marketing Data Analyst (Ticketing & CRM)

Do you have a passion for sport ‚Äî and ideally tennis? We want to build a global database of fans and ticket buyers, and we are looking for someone to help us transform it into actionable information to improve the user experience and business performance. Therefore, we are looking for an analytical mind who is knowledgeable of BI and AI to perform deep analysis and set up data CRM for our B2C business. You will join our Marketing department and in coordination with the ticketing responsible across events.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Your mission will be to lead the analysis of ticketing and CRM data to better understand our fans, optimise sales campaigns, and identify growth opportunities in different tournaments and markets. How?

Capability to evolve the CRM to incorporate new data points across different ticketing platforms (we normally use third party ticketing platforms, but we could eventually develop one inhouse).

CRM set up to have a single repository of information with the objective to insight extraction of different ticketing platforms of all our events, also targeted campaigns to do cross-selling and up-selling initiatives across our events.

Analytical capabilities to create insightful information from the CRM and the ticketing platforms using AI or BI tools.

WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR

3+ years of data analytics experience.
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Marketing, Economics or similar.
Proficiency with tools such as Excel/Sheets, SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and CRM platforms.
Experience with visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker Studio or similar).
Fluent in verbal and written English and Spanish.
Sports enthusiast, tennis especially.
Availability to travel.

NICE TO HAVE

Knowledge of marketing, understanding of key KPIs.
Experience with web analytics and automation tools (e.g., HubSpot, GA4, Meta Ads, Google Ads).

WHAT WE OFFER

Learning in BI/AI applied to high-level events.
Opportunity to propose and lead new data projects.
Permanent contract.
Travel insurance.
Being part of the most prestigious tennis tournaments in Europe.
Opportunities for growth within the company.
Dynamic and collaborative work environment.
Show more

You will join our Marketing department and in coordination with the ticketing responsible across events.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Your mission will be to lead the analysis of ticketing and CRM data to better understand our fans, optimise sales campaigns, and identify growth opportunities in different tournaments and markets. How?

  • Capability to evolve the CRM to incorporate new data points across different ticketing platforms (we normally use third party ticketing platforms, but we could eventually develop one inhouse).

  • CRM set up to have a single repository of information with the objective to insight extraction of different ticketing platforms of all our events, also targeted campaigns to do cross-selling and up-selling initiatives across our events.

  • Analytical capabilities to create insightful information from the CRM and the ticketing platforms using AI or BI tools.

WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR

  • 3+ years of data analytics experience.
  • Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Marketing, Economics or similar.
  • Proficiency with tools such as Excel/Sheets, SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and CRM platforms.
  • Experience with visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker Studio or similar).
  • Fluent in verbal and written English and Spanish.
  • Sports enthusiast, tennis especially.
  • Availability to travel.

NICE TO HAVE

  • Knowledge of marketing, understanding of key KPIs.
  • Experience with web analytics and automation tools (e.g., HubSpot, GA4, Meta Ads, Google Ads).

WHAT WE OFFER

  • Learning in BI/AI applied to high-level events.
  • Opportunity to propose and lead new data projects.
  • Permanent contract.
  • Travel insurance.
  • Being part of the most prestigious tennis tournaments in Europe.
  • Opportunities for growth within the company.
  • Dynamic and collaborative work environment.

Title: Junior Analyst
HTML:
As part of our team, you will leverage your excel and SQL background to address diverse data-related tasks that demand creative approaches and proficiency in cloud-centric implementations.


You will implement full end-to-end projects and be an integral part of our Center of Excellence (CoE).


More specifically, you will be expected to:


Partner with business key-users and Global Anaplan Solution Architects to design, develop, test, and implement Anaplan solutions in the mining/smelting industry;

Lead regional Anaplan projects by collaborating with business teams to gather local business requirements and develop user stories;

Understand, convert and improve Excel based planning and budgeting into dynamic connected Anaplan models;

Train new users on the system and document processes;

Develop test cases and assist in UAT on the technical and functional acceptance;

Manage multiple stakeholders across various business functions;

Perform root cause analyses and propose solutions;

Articulate design and documentation for Anaplan models (process map, user guide, solution design document);

Effectively identify various dimensions, lists, hierarchies and line items, thereby creating a user-friendly and optimized solution;

Create Hub-Spoke & ALM structure along with user experience pages using the Anaplan New User Experience;

Closely follow Anaplan model building best practices;

Detailed understanding & working experience on Anaplan integration (Cloudworks, Anaplan Connect or other ETL tools) is a definite asset;

Understanding & working experience on PlanIQ, Optimizer, Reporting pages, Polaris, Workflow management, etc. is an asset.



Do you have what it takes?


Bachelor's or graduate's degree in Mathematics, Physics, Enginnerings or economics;

Excel Proficiency: Strong Excel skills are a solid foundation for data manipulation and analysis, which are essential in Anaplan modeling (Visual Basic / macros not required)

Demonstrated ability to optimize;

Good understanding of planning budgeting & forecasting;

Understanding of the mining / concentrating / smelting industry is an asset;

Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a global team;

Strong attention to detail and a positive attitude;

Critical thinking and analytical problem-solving skills.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you must be able to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German and/or Spanish is desirable.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üì≤ Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement, leveraging tools such as automation, mobility and AI to drive performance benefits

üí∞ Very competitive compensation structure

üë® üë© üëß üë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents (employee + spouse/partner and children)

üè• Life Insurance

üìà Growth opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)


We are building a multi-cultural and multi-disciplinary dream team in which you will have the opportunity to collaborate with domain experts - enjoying all the perks of a big company but with the energy of a start-up.üòä

Title: Data Analyst - Tableau
Description:
Hays is collaborating with the leading company in the pharmaceutical sector, TOP 10 pharma with more than 146 affiliates around the world and 47 employees, of which 1,600 are located in Spain. They create innovative medicines for people and animals, adding value through innovation for all three business areas: human pharmaceuticals, animal health, and contract manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals. Now they are in the expansion phase and are developing the animal area. Our client is forming a technological hub that will serve the entire group internationally.




We are looking for a Data Analyst with Tableau to join the team.




Your Commitment will include:

Design and implement necessary visualizations with Tableau that allow stakeholders to understand the reliability level of a certain dataset.
Plan a roadmap of improvements for selected datasets alongside the focus area owners and deploy it accordingly.
Work closely with data engineers, platform managers, business analysts, and focus area owners to understand requirements, formats, completeness, consistency, and accuracy of those datasets that are part of the omnichannel approach.
Use DBT to transform and model data in Snowflake, ensuring that data is well-structured and accessible.
Add new features and enrich the customer journey data model within Snowflake that provides customer knowledge across channels.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical data solutions within Snowflake.




Achieving the difference requires the following skills:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Engineering, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proven experience as a developer with a focus on Snowflake and SQL language. Experience in tuning queries and interpreting query explain plans is valued. Python language experience is also nice to have.
Hands-on experience working with Snowflake cloud data, including transformation and querying.
Ability to create interactive dashboards and visualizations with Tableau.
Committed, proactive, and curious personality, reliable, open, and innovative with a strong interest in business intelligence disciplines.
Fluent English. Any other language is an advantage.




What we offer:

Indefinite contract. Full-time job.
Participation in international projects.
Hybrid work, 1 day office week.
Office: San Cugat del Vall√®s.
Flexible Schedule ‚Äì Monday to Friday from 8/9 to 5/6.

Eurofirms Group es la primera empresa nacional de Recursos Humanos. Desde hace m√°s de 30 a√±os, hemos consolidado un modelo de gesti√≥n por valores en el sector de Recursos Humanos, basado en tres pilares fundamentales: Personas-PeopleFirst, Innovaci√≥n y Excelencia.




Somos una empresa orientada a las personas, con buen ambiente de trabajo y con responsabilidad social.

Por eso, de acuerdo con nuestra cultura People first, trabajamos para generar entornos laborales inclusivos en los que cada individuo pueda crecer y desarrollar su mejor versi√≥n. Asimismo, buscamos actuar como agentes de cambio para promover la igualdad de oportunidades en nuestro entorno, fomentando el respeto y apostando por la diversidad en todas sus formas.

Retribuci√≥n en funci√≥n de los valores aportados.

Entre tus funciones, te ocupar√°s de las siguientes tareas:

Dise√±ar una soluci√≥n basada en datos a las preguntas de negocio planteadas.
Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.
Elaborar informes y cuadros de mando mediante herramientas de Business Intelligence, destinados a las dem√°s funciones de negocio que consuman la informaci√≥n.
Realizar extracciones de datos a medida que responden a necesidades puntuales de informaci√≥n.




¬øQu√© esperamos de ti?

Buscamos una persona con una buena comunicaci√≥n y buena capacidad de escucha, con atenci√≥n al detalle y orientado al servicio. Alguien proactivo y aut√≥nomo.




Aptitudes necesarias

Interlocuci√≥n con diversos niveles organizativos y diversas √°reas funcionales.
Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al t√©cnico y viceversa.
Pensamiento estrat√©gico y orientado a sistemas.
Interpretar y asimilar informaci√≥n fragmentada.
Construir historias relevantes a partir de la informaci√≥n contenida en los datos.




Requisitos

Herramientas y conceptos de Business Intelligence (Microsoft, Tableau, QlikSense o similares)
Herramientas de scripting en herramientas de Business Intelligence (SSAS, DAX, Qlik scripting‚Ä¶)
Conocimientos de visualizaci√≥n de datos y visual storytelling (Power BI, Informes SSRS o similares)
Conceptos de modelado de datos e informaci√≥n
Bases de datos y SQL
Hojas de c√°lculo y tablas din√°micas (Excel)




Se valorar√°

Aportar experiencia en herramientas de ETL (SSIS, Power Query, Talend, Informatica Power Center, ‚Ä¶)
Tener conocimientos adicionales de programaci√≥n.
Idioma ingl√©s.




¬øQu√© ventajas tiene trabajar en una empresa People first?

En Eurofirms Group te ofrecemos el mejor entorno y condiciones para que puedas brillar tanto en tu vida profesional como en la personal.




Un trabajo que hace de la conciliaci√≥n una realidad

Tarde libre semanal
Tres d√≠as de teletrabajo a la semana
Retribuci√≥n flexible para ahorrar en tus gastos de manutenci√≥n, transporte, guarder√≠a o seguro m√©dico a trav√©s de Cobee




Tu salud, y la de los tuyos, es lo primero

Mutua de salud gratuita y con descuentos para tu familia, a partir de los 2 a√±os en Eurofirms
Descuentos en la cuota de m√∫ltiples gimnasios, entrenamientos personales, nutrici√≥n y salud mental disponibles en la app Wellhub.

Title: Junior Analyst
HTML:
As part of our team, you will leverage your excel and SQL background to address diverse data-related tasks that demand creative approaches and proficiency in cloud-centric implementations.


You will implement full end-to-end projects and be an integral part of our Center of Excellence (CoE).


More specifically, you will be expected to:


Partner with business key-users and Global Anaplan Solution Architects to design, develop, test, and implement Anaplan solutions in the mining/smelting industry;

Lead regional Anaplan projects by collaborating with business teams to gather local business requirements and develop user stories;

Understand, convert and improve Excel based planning and budgeting into dynamic connected Anaplan models;

Train new users on the system and document processes;

Develop test cases and assist in UAT on the technical and functional acceptance;

Manage multiple stakeholders across various business functions;

Perform root cause analyses and propose solutions;

Articulate design and documentation for Anaplan models (process map, user guide, solution design document);

Effectively identify various dimensions, lists, hierarchies and line items, thereby creating a user-friendly and optimized solution;

Create Hub-Spoke & ALM structure along with user experience pages using the Anaplan New User Experience;

Closely follow Anaplan model building best practices;

Detailed understanding & working experience on Anaplan integration (Cloudworks, Anaplan Connect or other ETL tools) is a definite asset;

Understanding & working experience on PlanIQ, Optimizer, Reporting pages, Polaris, Workflow management, etc. is an asset.



Do you have what it takes?


Bachelor's or graduate's degree in Mathematics, Physics, Enginnerings or economics;

Excel Proficiency: Strong Excel skills are a solid foundation for data manipulation and analysis, which are essential in Anaplan modeling (Visual Basic / macros not required)

Demonstrated ability to optimize;

Good understanding of planning budgeting & forecasting;

Understanding of the mining / concentrating / smelting industry is an asset;

Ability to collaborate effectively and work as part of a global team;

Strong attention to detail and a positive attitude;

Critical thinking and analytical problem-solving skills.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you must be able to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German and/or Spanish is desirable.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üì≤ Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement, leveraging tools such as automation, mobility and AI to drive performance benefits

üí∞ Very competitive compensation structure

üë® üë© üëß üë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents (employee + spouse/partner and children)

üè• Life Insurance

üìà Growth opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)


We are building a multi-cultural and multi-disciplinary dream team in which you will have the opportunity to collaborate with domain experts - enjoying all the perks of a big company but with the energy of a start-up.üòä

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a Business Data Analyst to join our team in Madrid and help shape the future of contextual advertising as we continue to expand globally.

Who We Are

At Seedtag, we lead the way in contextual advertising with our machine learning-powered platform. Our technology provides superior brand safety, human-like content understanding, and advanced cookieless targeting, making ads more engaging and respectful. Founded by two ex-Googlers in 2014, we‚Äôve grown to over 600 Seedtaggers across 18 countries, raising ‚Ç¨250M to revolutionise digital advertising.




Your Challenge




You will get full ownership of our business data and will be expected to propose and conduct analyses that transform Seedtag‚Äôs data into significant business opportunities and KPI improvements.
You will analyse the performance of our current Contextual products and processes and proactively propose initiatives that seek to improve Seedtag‚Äôs commercial and operational results.
You will develop tools that automate internal processes, increasing the efficiency and efficacy of Seedtag teams.
You will help build tools that enable the democratisation of data inside the company and allow Seedtag teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.
Finally, you will build a solid knowledge of the adTech ecosystem and develop strong business acumen.




What You‚Äôll Need to Succeed




You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Engineering. Specific certifications/education in Data/ Business Intelligence are a plus.
You have 3-5 years of experience in a fast-paced environment, either start-up, corporate or consulting.
You have advanced skills in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
You have experience with ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes and tools.
You have knowledge of database management systems (e.g., BigQuery, MySQL).
You have experience working with programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.
You have experience in data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or similar, and you have knowledge of Excel/ Sheets.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights that drive business value.
You have the ability to collaborate with business stakeholders to identify information needs and define business requirements.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

It would be a big plus if you

Have experience in forecasting, trend analysis, and predictive modelling.
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders.
Have experience working with Tableau.




Why Join Seedtag?




Growth & Opportunity: A key moment to join with vast career development prospects.

Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you to balance work and life effortlessly with the option to work from home, the office, or even the beach in our hybrid mode.

Learning & Development: Online courses in ODILO, and optional English or Spanish group classes.

Inclusive Culture: We foster a supportive environment that values personal growth.

Fun & Connection: Participate in team activities, company offsites, and more!




Additional Perks




Flexible benefits plan: Restaurant, transportation, and kindergarten vouchers.
Health insurance: Comprehensive coverage included.
Gympass: Access to wellness programs and fitness classes.
Seedsave Program: Exclusive discounts to help you save for the future.




Ready to join the Seedtag adventure?




Send us your CV and let‚Äôs grow together!

At Seedtag, we‚Äôre committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive. We welcome diverse perspectives as they fuel our innovation and growth. Please let us know if you require accommodations during the hiring process and we‚Äôll ensure a positive and accessible experience.

Title: Data Analyst - Tableau
Description:
Hays is collaborating with the leading company in the pharmaceutical sector, TOP 10 pharma with more than 146 affiliates around the world and 47 employees, of which 1,600 are located in Spain. They create innovative medicines for people and animals, adding value through innovation for all three business areas: human pharmaceuticals, animal health, and contract manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals. Now they are in the expansion phase and are developing the animal area. Our client is forming a technological hub that will serve the entire group internationally.




We are looking for a Data Analyst with Tableau to join the team.




Your Commitment will include:

Design and implement necessary visualizations with Tableau that allow stakeholders to understand the reliability level of a certain dataset.
Plan a roadmap of improvements for selected datasets alongside the focus area owners and deploy it accordingly.
Work closely with data engineers, platform managers, business analysts, and focus area owners to understand requirements, formats, completeness, consistency, and accuracy of those datasets that are part of the omnichannel approach.
Use DBT to transform and model data in Snowflake, ensuring that data is well-structured and accessible.
Add new features and enrich the customer journey data model within Snowflake that provides customer knowledge across channels.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical data solutions within Snowflake.




Achieving the difference requires the following skills:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Engineering, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
Proven experience as a developer with a focus on Snowflake and SQL language. Experience in tuning queries and interpreting query explain plans is valued. Python language experience is also nice to have.
Hands-on experience working with Snowflake cloud data, including transformation and querying.
Ability to create interactive dashboards and visualizations with Tableau.

Hays is collaborating with the leading company in the pharmaceutical sector, TOP 10 pharma with more than 146 affiliates around the world and 47 employees, of which 1,600 are located in Spain. Now they are in the expansion phase and are developing the animal area. Our client is forming a technological hub that will serve the entire group internationally.


We are looking for a Data Analyst with Tableau to join the team.


Your Commitment will include:

  • Work closely with data engineers, platform managers, business analysts, and focus area owners to understand requirements, formats, completeness, consistency, and accuracy of those datasets that are part of the omnichannel approach.
  • Use DBT to transform and model data in Snowflake, ensuring that data is well-structured and accessible.
  • Add new features and enrich the customer journey data model within Snowflake that provides customer knowledge across channels.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into technical data solutions within Snowflake.


Achieving the difference requires the following skills:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Engineering, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
  • Proven experience as a developer with a focus on Snowflake and SQL language. Experience in tuning queries and interpreting query explain plans is valued. Python language experience is also nice to have.
  • Hands-on experience working with Snowflake cloud data, including transformation and querying.
  • Ability to create interactive dashboards and visualizations with Tableau.
  • Committed, proactive, and curious personality, reliable, open, and innovative with a strong interest in business intelligence disciplines.
  • Fluent English. Any other language is an advantage.

Title: Reporting Analyst
Description:
Tradition is the interdealer broking arm of Compagnie Financi√®re Tradition and one of the world's largest interdealer brokers in over-the-counter financial and commodity related products. CFT is represented in over 28 countries, employing over 2,500 people.




Tradition‚Äôs goal is to provide superior client services. It believes its business success is a direct reflection of its employees and recruits. As such, teamwork, creativity, reliability and integrity are components of a work ethic taken very seriously since the company was founded in 1959.




Tradition is currently seeking to appoint a Reporting Analyst to be based within the Madrid office.




Main responsibilities within the Reporting Analyst position include:




Administer and support Salesforce CRM processes, including user management and reporting.
Develop and maintain Excel models for sales/revenue analysis, reporting, and performance tracking.
Assist in building and maintaining dashboards, models and reports using Power BI.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders form various departments to identify & qualify reporting needs.
Document processes and create user guides as needed to support internal users.
Ensure customer data quality and consistency across systems and processes.




Key skills, experience and competencies required to be successful in this role:

Experience with Salesforce CRM administration or similar CRM platforms.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel (e.g., pivot tables, advanced formulas, Power Query).
Familiarity with Power BI / Fabric or similar BI platforms.
Understanding of Microsoft 365 services such as Power Automate, Microsoft Fabric, OneDrive.
Strong analytical thinking, attention to detail, and problem-solving skills.
Good verbal and written communication skills in English.
Good commercial & business acumen in a B2B sales environment.
Comfortable engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Prior experience in the financial services industry is advantageous.
Familiarity with market data licensing is advantageous.




Tradition do not accept agency CV‚Äôs. Please do not forward CV‚Äôs to our employees or Talent team. Tradition are not accountable for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. The Talent team will reach out to trusted agents when required.




Please note, due to the large volume of applications for this position, only suitable candidates will be contacted. If you have not heard from us within 14 days, unfortunately, your application has been unsuccessful.




Tradition welcome all suitable applications and are an equal opportunity employer who value diversity. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications and merit.




By applying for this role, you agree that we may retain your details on our system for a period of 6 months and may contact you for any future vacancies that may arise within the Tradition Group.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
TENNIUM is a sports management company specialising in the tennis industry globally. Our vision is to build a multi-business platform within the world of tennis, combining a range of synergetic activities including the organisation of top-tier ATP, WTA and ITF tournaments in Europe and South America, management & representation of top professional players & young talent, and selected consulting engagements with different industry stakeholders.

Marketing Data Analyst (Ticketing & CRM)

Do you have a passion for sport ‚Äî and ideally tennis? We want to build a global database of fans and ticket buyers, and we are looking for someone to help us transform it into actionable information to improve the user experience and business performance. Therefore, we are looking for an analytical mind who is knowledgeable of BI and AI to perform deep analysis and set up data CRM for our B2C business. You will join our Marketing department and in coordination with the ticketing responsible across events.

ABOUT THE ROLE

Your mission will be to lead the analysis of ticketing and CRM data to better understand our fans, optimise sales campaigns, and identify growth opportunities in different tournaments and markets. How?

Capability to evolve the CRM to incorporate new data points across different ticketing platforms (we normally use third party ticketing platforms, but we could eventually develop one inhouse).

CRM set up to have a single repository of information with the objective to insight extraction of different ticketing platforms of all our events, also targeted campaigns to do cross-selling and up-selling initiatives across our events.

Analytical capabilities to create insightful information from the CRM and the ticketing platforms using AI or BI tools.

WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR

3+ years of data analytics experience.
Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Marketing, Economics or similar.
Proficiency with tools such as Excel/Sheets, SQL, Google Analytics, BigQuery and CRM platforms.
Experience with visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau, Looker Studio or similar).
Fluent in verbal and written English and Spanish.
Sports enthusiast, tennis especially.
Availability to travel.

NICE TO HAVE

Knowledge of marketing, understanding of key KPIs.
Experience with web analytics and automation tools (e.g., HubSpot, GA4, Meta Ads, Google Ads).

WHAT WE OFFER

Learning in BI/AI applied to high-level events.
Opportunity to propose and lead new data projects.
Permanent contract.
Travel insurance.
Being part of the most prestigious tennis tournaments in Europe.
Opportunities for growth within the company.
Dynamic and collaborative work environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Finsolutia intends to reinforce its Information Technology (IT) team with a Data Analyst (M/F).

We are looking for talented and self-motivated individuals for a broad and interesting role working as part of a team based in Lisbon.

Responsibilities


Design and develop Microsoft Power BI reports and Dashboards (Operational, Strategic & Analytical) including data set ingestion and transformation, Data Modeling, Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) using the appropriate report templates depicting status of key performance indicators (KPIs) and other important business metrics for an organization to make data driven decisions
Work with cross-functional teams to gather and document reporting requirements to meet business needs
Build data models, technical and functional documentation with business partners
Review and interpret ongoing business report requirements;
Writing optimized SQL queries for integration with other applications
Designing database tables and related objects;
Transition developed reports and dashboards to interactive/automated dashboards using Power BI
Use T-SQL to develop and implement procedures and functions;
Provide support as required to ensure the availability and optimal performance of developed reports and dashboards for both external and internal users
Design and implement technology best practices, guidelines and repeatable processes
Extract and analyze data using PowerQuery, PivotTables, MS Excel, Power BI and DAX.
Design, develop, update, and optimize Power BI dashboards, reports and scorecards to meet business requirements.


Hard Skills


Understanding of T-SQL programming (Microsoft SQL Server)
Knowledge of Databricks PySpark / SparkSQL
Knowledge of data modeling following the best practices
2+ years of experience in creating reports, dashboards using Power BI Desktop and Server and maintaining Power BI dashboards on servers.
Understanding of tuning of Power BI reports, data sets, and SQL to deliver maximum report performance.
Experience with ETL Processes Experience with Python and C# (nice to have)
Fluent in English


Soft Skills


Proactivity and constant technological evolution;
Team work and result oriented;
Good communication and interpersonal / facilitation skills.


We‚Äôd like to inform you that personal data collected here are exclusively destined to the management of the recruitment process in question and will be processed and storage by Finsolutia, SA, or another Group company, in accordance with Personal Data Protection Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of 27 April 2016 during a period of 5 years, after which they will be definitively eliminated.

We Further Inform You That The Holder Will Have Free Access To Its Personal Data, And May Request Its Updating, Rectification Or Removal By Simply Sending The Request In Writing To

Bernardo Cabral

Data Protection Officer

dpo@finsolutia.com
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Data Analyst at Air Apps, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to drive business insights and optimize product performance. You will create reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to help teams make informed decisions and improve user experience.

This role requires a data-driven mindset, strong analytical skills, and experience with visualization tools to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior, product performance, and key business metrics to identify trends and opportunities.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
Collect, clean, and structure large datasets to ensure accuracy and usability.
Define and track KPIs for marketing, product, and business performance.
Work with SQL, Python, or R to extract, analyze, and manipulate data.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketing teams to provide data-driven insights.
Conduct A/B testing and experiment analysis to improve product features and user engagement.
Identify bottlenecks and opportunities in user journeys and customer funnels.
Present findings in a clear and compelling way to stakeholders and leadership teams.
Stay up to date with industry trends, analytics best practices, and emerging data tools.


Requirements


Around 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for data analysis.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Experience with Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar user analytics tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline optimization is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and manage multiple projects.


What benefits are we offering?


Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
Annual Bonus.
Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
Air Conference - an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.


Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

  • Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Google Data Studio).
  • Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for data analysis.
  • Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
  • Experience with Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar user analytics tools.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
  • Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline optimization is a plus.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and manage multiple projects.

What benefits are we offering?

  • Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
  • Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
  • Annual Bonus.
  • Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
  • Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
  • Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
  • Air Conference - an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


Within CIB, the Transaction Banking business concerns two fundamental business lines:
Cash Management (all products that assist our customers with their liquidity needs, i.e. current accounts, term deposits, payments & collections, forex, etc.)
Global Trade Solutions (all products that assist our customers with their global trade needs, i.e. letters of credit, guarantees, supply chain management, factoring, etc.)
We are looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Data Analyst to join the Transaction Banking COO Office team to be responsible for the Global Trade Solutions & Supply Chain Management business line
Reporting to the Head of Transaction Banking COO Office in Portugal, you will be in charge of generating and maintaining all the necessary business monitoring reports for this perimeter, working on the full end-to-end process from data extraction, data preparation ,data cleaning, data engineering, all to the way to data visualization. In addition the role will require a sharp eye and keen attention to detail as you will handle and manipulate large volumes of data coming from multiple sources, as well as provide support on a few regulatory fronts
This role requires a deep understanding of data analysis techniques, strong analytical skills, and the ability to communicate findings effectively to Senior Management. You will work in close proximity with our risk and GTS colleagus in Paris and with different GTS & SCM counterparties in AMER and APAC countries

Your Main Activities Are


Maintain and enrich our existing Global asset report with the goal of simplifying end user experience and extract key insights at first glance
Prepare all necessary data and generate the visuals to launch a new report covering the Supply Chain Management scope
From a risk standpoint, construct a new report to allow a view on the obligors of our Supply Chain Management clients
Collect, clean, and analyze large data sets from various operational sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Conduct reconciliation exercises on data coming from multiple sources to make sure that figures are consistent and aligned.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data quality checks and validation processes.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend data-driven solutions
Collaborate with Transaction Banking COO and Transaction Banking department Heads who request business analysis
Contribute to the development and governance of our data and support the different business lines with data-driven decision-making


Profile And Skills To Success


Master¬¥s Degree in Computer Science / Information Technology / Information Management
At least 3 years of experience handling large data sets and dealing with ETL processes
Fluent in English (mandatory)
Highly proficient with MS Excel
Experience with Power BI
Proficiency in analytics and data management


About The Team


As Global TB COO team we assist our different business teams in multiple topics, both on daily/monthly needs as in project mode. We have a small team of data analysts/scientists focusing on data who are involved in the conception of data use cases from exploration phase up to production delivery


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
P2P.org is the largest institutional staking provider with a TVL of over $10B and a market share exceeding 20% in restaking.

We are continually focused on researching and improving our infrastructure to extract maximum APR while enhancing security. For instance, in ETH and SOL, our NRR is on average 10% higher than the market, and in DOT, it's 20% higher.

We also place significant focus and resources on launching new networks such as TON, Avail, Monad, Babylon, Story, Berachain, and others, along with yield products. From restaking, where we are the largest operator with a 20+% market share, to yield aggregators on stablecoins.

Our clients include BitGo, Copper, Crypto.com, Ledger, ByBit, Bitget, OKX, HTX, Bitvavo, SBI, and others, who choose us for our client-centric approach and extensive product line from unified API to widgets and custom dApps.

We are also actively expanding our product line, exploring RWA, data, yield, and service products for banks, exchanges, custodians, and wallets.

P2P.org unites talented individuals globally ‚ù§Ô∏è

Despite our distributed team, we share a passion for decentralized finance - a fairer system for all. We code, learn, create, and connect to shape finance's future üí∞

P2P.org boasts a strong reputation and network. We prioritize customer satisfaction and, as tech enthusiasts, develop innovative solutions that bolster our brand.

You will


Analyze large, complex datasets (on-chain and off-chain) to derive strategic and product insights
Develop models and dashboards to monitor validator performance, user behavior, and protocol performance
Investigate network economics, user incentives, and staking flows to support growth strategies, research new revenue opportunities
Conduct exploratory and root-cause analysis of ecosystem or performance changes
Build data tools and reporting frameworks to scale internal decision-making
Present insights and data stories clearly to technical and non-technical audiences


You have


5+ years of experience in data analysis, strategy, or research roles in tech, fintech, or crypto
Proficiency in advanced SQL and Python (must be comfortable working with large, complex datasets)
Strong business acumen and problem-solving skills ‚Äì ability to work from ambiguous problem statements to clear recommendations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills (English)
Experience with data visualization tools like Superset, Metabase, Looker, or Tableau
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field


Nice to have


Prior work in Web3, or an active interest in the crypto space
Experience with blockchain data platforms: Dune Analytics, The Graph, Flipside, etc.
Exposure to staking protocols, validator infrastructure, or DeFi analytics
Experience of building data pipelines with tools like dbt, Airflow etc.


At P2P.org we have a team of experts with their own unique approach and ownership culture. Together we gain experience and make dreams come true! üåü


Full-time Contractor (Indefinite-term Consultancy Agreement)
Competitive salary level in $ (we can also pay in Crypto)
Well-being program
Mental Health care program
Compensation for education, including Foreign Language & professional growth courses
Equipment & co-working reimbursement program
Overseas conferences, community immersion
Positive and friendly communication culture


P2P.org is committed to providing equal opportunities. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or disability.

Title: Data Curator
Description:
Shape the future of innovation, startups & economies

Dealroom is the world‚Äôs startup and venture capital database, used by leading teams like Accel, Index, Atomico, Google, Microsoft, AWS, SAP, and 100+ governments, to discover the world‚Äôs next generation of transformative companies.

We‚Äôre on a mission to accelerate innovation by empowering decision-makers with the most comprehensive data on startups, scaleups, and ecosystems.

Joining Dealroom means working at the confluence of AI, big data, and venture capital and acting as a catalyst at the heart of startup ecosystems. We value relentless client focus, transparency, openness, and candour - the freedom to take risks, admit failures, and speak openly.

About The Data Curation Team

Join our team of data analysts and content curators to improve the quality and accuracy of our data, and to elevate the experience of our users. This role is ideal for team players and problem solvers with an investigative mind looking to enter the world of startups and venture capital. You will develop skills in data quality and classification while expanding your technical toolkit and co-creating scalable solutions. You'll often work directly with our clients.

As a Data Curator, you‚Äôll


Ensure data quality through curation, desk research, classification, content review, and moderation.
Support data operations workflows and assist engineering teams.
Monitor and improve data quality metrics.
Contribute to developing scalable data management solutions.


What You Bring


Academic Credentials: A completed Bachelor's degree in (Business) Information Technology, Finance, Economics, Content Management, or related fields.
Interests: Data and data management tools, from GenAI to Python and BigQuery.
Passion: A demonstrated enthusiasm for technology, startups, and venture capital markets.
Mindset: A proactive, accountable, and urgent approach to work.
Adaptability: Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment where continuous learning, OKRs, ongoing feedback, and curiosity drive success.
Eligibility: Eligibility to work in the EU, residency in the Lisbon area, and fluency in English. Additional language skills are welkom / wilkommen / bienvenido / kyaosopartaal.


What We Bring To The Deal


Ownership: A role where you truly own your work. Show us your capabilities, and we‚Äôll support your growth.
Comprehensive Benefits: Enjoy benefits like a laptop of your choice, flexible hours, a fully equipped home office setup, travel allowances, a development budget, weekly workout sessions, and more.
Global & Inclusive Culture: Join a diverse team spanning over 25 nationalities.
Vibrant Workplace: Work in a dynamic environment in the heart of Lisbon (Baixa-Chiado) with flexible hybrid options.
Meritocratic Environment: We value entrepreneurial thinking and are committed to turning innovative ideas into reality.


Ready to accelerate the future of innovation with us? Share your story, and let‚Äôs create something transformative together.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

At VML, we are a beacon of innovation and growth in an ever-evolving world. Our heritage is built upon a century of combined expertise, where creativity meets technology, and diverse perspectives ignite inspiration. With the merger of VMLY&R and Wunderman Thompson, we have forged a new path as a growth partner that is part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology powerhouse.

Our global family now encompasses over 30,000 employees across 150+ offices in 64 markets, each contributing to a culture that values connection, belonging, and the power of differences. Our expertise spans the entire customer journey, offering deep insights in communications, commerce, consultancy, CRM, CX, data, production, and technology. We deliver end-to-end solutions that result in revolutionary work.

Who We're Looking For

We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Data Analyst with up to 3 years of experience to join our growing team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about turning complex data into actionable insights that support strategic decision-making. You will thrive in collaborative environments, demonstrate analytical thinking, and communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. A strong interest in the energy sector and digital behavior analytics will be key to success in this role.

What You'll Do


Collect, clean, and analyze data from various sources to support business decisions.
Develop and maintain dashboards and interactive reports using Power BI and Looker Studio.
Monitor and interpret digital behavior using Google Analytics 4 (GA4).
Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to support business strategies with data-driven insights.


Who You Are


A data-driven professional with a knack for transforming data into meaningful insights.
A collaborative team player with a keen analytical mindset.
Eager to grow and contribute to impactful projects in the energy industry.
Comfortable communicating complex ideas clearly to varied audiences.


What You'll Need


Up to 3 years of experience in data analytics.
Proficiency with GA4, Power BI, and Looker Studio (required).
Previous experience in the energy sector (required).
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager is a plus.
Fluency in English (written and spoken).
Spanish language skills are a strong plus.


Bonus Points If You Have


Experience working in international or multicultural environments.
A commitment to continuous learning and skill development.
An ability to connect data insights to broader business opportunities.


We believe the best work happens when we're together, fostering creativity, collaboration, and connection. That's why we‚Äôve adopted a hybrid approach, with teams in the office an average of four days a week. If you require accommodations or flexibility, please discuss this with the hiring team during the interview process.

WPP (VML) is an equal opportunity employer and considers applicants for all positions without discrimination or regard to characteristics. We are committed to fostering a culture of respect in which everyone feels they belong and has the same opportunities to progress in their careers.

VML is a WPP Agency. For more information, please visit our website, and follow VML on our social channels via Instagram,‚ÄØLinkedIn, and‚ÄØX.

When you click "Submit Application", this will send any information you add below to VML. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

Title: Data Analyst (Growth & Marketing)
Description:
üìö TripleTen is a U.S.-based tech school internationally recognized for its excellence in education and transformative impact. We‚Äôre rapidly expanding in Brazil, helping more and more people break into the tech industry‚Äîregardless of where they‚Äôre starting from. We value talent, promote continuous learning, and offer real challenges that drive both personal and professional growth in a global and innovative environment.

We're looking for passionate analyst to help the team set up experiments and validate growth and marketing hypothesis in a fast-paces growth team in Brazil EdTech market.

What you will do:

Growth:


Identify growth opportunities through data analysis
Monitor conversion funnels from impression to enrollment completion
Execute A/B testing and analyze marketing experiments
Track qualified lead generation metrics (MQLs and SQLs)
Analyze user behavior and build end-to-end reporting to track it
Map customer journey and identify optimization opportunities


Marketing:


Conduct cohort analysis for different marketing segments
Analyze performance across channels (Google Ads, Facebook Ads, LinkedIn, SEO, email marketing)
Create attribution models to understand channel impact
Help marketing and sales departments to sync by clarifying pyramid of metrics
Support remarketing and nurturing strategies with data-driven insights
Create visualizations for ROI, ROAS, CAC (Customer Acquisition Cost), and LTV (Lifetime Value)
Present actionable insights for budget and strategy optimization
Develop and maintain daily marketing campaign dashboards using Tableau


Requirements:


3+ years of experience in Data Analytics, specifically in Marketing, Growth or Product fields
Advanced English
Expertise in Tableau (dashboard creation, calculated fields, parameters, actions)
Proficiency in SQL or Python for marketing data extraction and manipulation
Familiarity with marketing automation tools (RD Station, HubSpot or Salesforce)
Knowledge of digital campaign analysis and performance metrics


What we can offer you:


100% remote work, with flexibility and work-life balance
Paid time off (vacation and national holidays)
Opportunity to make a real, direct impact on the company's results by actively contributing to our growth
A diverse, global team with people based in the U.S., Latin America, Brazil, Serbia, Georgia, and more than 10 other countries

Title: Data Analyst, Customer Experience
Description:
Department: CX Analytics

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Reporting To: Fedor Suslyaev

Description

Tabby creates financial freedom in the way people shop, earn and save by reshaping their relationship with money. Over 15 million users choose Tabby to stay in control of their spending and make the most out of their money.

The company‚Äôs flagship offering allows shoppers to split their payments online and in-store with no interest or fees. Over 40,000 global brands and small businesses, including Amazon, Noon, IKEA, and SHEIN use Tabby to accelerate growth and gain loyal customers by offering easy and flexible payments online and in stores.

Tabby generates over $10 billion in annual transaction volume for its partner brands and is the highest-rated, most-reviewed, largest, and fastest-growing FinTech in the GCC region.

Tabby launched in 2019 and has since raised +$1 billion in equity and debt funding from global and regional investors, and is now valued at $3.3 billion.

About The Role

As a Middle Data Analyst in the Voice of the Customer (VoC) domain within the Customer Experience (CX) department, you will analyze customer feedback and behavior to drive actionable insights that enhance satisfaction and loyalty. Leveraging diverse data sources, including surveys, reviews, and social media, you will uncover trends, pinpoint pain points, and deliver strategic recommendations that improve customer experience and align with business objectives. Your work will directly influence decision-making across CX teams, product management, and marketing.

What you‚Äôll be doing


Customer Feedback & Sentiment Analysis: Analyze data from VoC programs (CSAT, NPS), applying NLP and text analytics to extract insights and categorize feedback into themes.
Customer Journey Insights: Map customer interactions across touchpoints, correlating VoC data with operational metrics to identify friction points and areas for improvement.
Data Visualization & Reporting: Develop dashboards, reports, and KPIs to communicate findings clearly, ensuring insights drive informed decision-making.
A/B Testing & Performance Evaluation: Design and conduct A/B tests to assess the impact of customer experience initiatives and recommend optimizations.
Public Presentation of Insights: Present key findings and results to stakeholders, including executives, ensuring alignment with customer-centric strategies.
Predictive & Prescriptive Analytics: Use advanced modeling techniques to forecast customer behavior and provide data-driven recommendations to enhance loyalty.
Process Improvement & Innovation: Identify gaps in VoC methodologies, suggest improvements, and implement new tools or techniques to optimize data collection and analysis.



What you‚Äôll need


Work experience as a data analyst for 3+ years.
Advanced knowledge of SQL, Python.
Experience using Tableau/Metabase or similar data visualization tools.
Experience with using GPT/Claude as a tool for work tasks solving.
A structured approach to problem solving alongside strong quantitative skills. You can analyze issues, identify root-causes and recommend solutions.
Ability to come up with hypotheses and ways to improve our processes: backed by data if possible, but also by your expertise and common sense.
Verbal and written communication skills, an ability to interact with business and product teams.
At least upper-intermediate English proficiency.



Job Benefits

Relocation and Employment

We offer remote work from anywhere in the world (our schedule is based on Dubai time though) and are happy to work out an individual relocation plan for you.

Our employees have the opportunity to choose a country for registration: at the moment those are Armenia, Georgia, Serbia, Portugal, Spain, UAE.

What You Can Expect


We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
A working environment that gives you autonomy and responsibility from day one.
You should be comfortable with the idea that the quality of your work will influence the shape of your career.
Participation in the company‚Äôs employee stock options program.



We are passionate about creating an inclusive, high-performing workplace that gives people from all backgrounds the support they need to thrive, grow, and meet their goals (whatever they may be).

If this sounds exciting to you, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
Show more

Title: Data Market Analyst ‚Äì Business Planning
Description:
Imagine a world with zero vehicle accidents, zero vehicle emissions, and wireless vehicle connectivity all around us. Every day, we move closer to making that world a reality. Aptiv‚Äôs passionate team of engineers and developers creates advanced safety systems, high-performance electrification solutions and data connectivity solutions so that automakers can bring advanced capabilities to more people around the globe. This is how we enable sustainable mobility and help to prevent accidents caused by human error.

Want to join us?

Your role:


Conduct internal planning data analysis, transform data into knowledge to provide input for decision, compare data with Market industry-level to support operational and strategic initiatives.
Monitor market share, competitive intelligence, product development trends and EDS portfolio to support market positioning reports.
Align data analysis with company‚Äôs strategic direction. Initiate and support market research and competitor analysis by developing automatization of different data sources.
Collaborate with external research and consulting firms to provide insights to internal functions and leadership.
Participate in customer studies and market environment analysis.
Maintain up-to-date understanding of the EMEA wiring harness market, including key drivers such as electrification, regulatory shifts, consumer behavior, and regional trends.
Contribute to general business planning tasks as needed and support Commercial Teams in regards current and future business.


Your Background


Graduate or Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, and Power BI.
Working knowledge of SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS).
Excellent command of office applications, including PowerPoint and Excel.
Familiarity with Automotive product portfolios and market forecasting.
Experience in market research, data analysis, or a related function.
Fluent in English, with strong written and verbal communication skills.
Able to perform under pressure, work collaboratively, and meet deadlines.


Nice To Have Skills


Experience with VBA, Power Query, Power Pivot, or Power Automate.
Automotive supplier background or direct exposure to manufacturing and business planning in the automotive sector.


Why join us?


You can grow at Aptiv. Aptiv provides an inclusive work environment where all individuals can grow and develop, regardless of gender, ethnicity or beliefs.
You can have an impact. Safety is a core Aptiv value; we want a safer world for us and our children, one with: Zero fatalities, Zero injuries, Zero accidents.
You have support. We ensure you have the resources and support you need to take care of your family and your physical and mental health with a competitive health insurance package.


Privacy Notice - Active Candidates: https://www.aptiv.com/privacy-notice-active-candidates

Aptiv is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Business Data Analyst ‚Äì Commercial
Description:
Location

Hybrid in Lisbon (minimum of 2 days a week from the office)

SHAPE THE FUTURE OF PRIVACY WITH USERCENTRICS

Usercentrics is a global leader in data privacy and privacy-led marketing solutions. We believe there is no need for a trade-off between growth and privacy compliance. Our vision is to unlock the potential of data privacy to empower a thriving digital ecosystem. We work with companies to create a healthy balance between data-driven business and privacy-led marketing for every size of enterprise. Our customers build trust with their users through improved transparency and control to drastically improve marketing and monetization, while achieving full privacy compliance.

We are seeking a highly skilled Business Data Analyst to join our BI Team, with a dedicated focus on supporting the Commercial Team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, funnel analysis, and commercial performance metrics to deliver actionable insights that drive revenue growth and sales efficiency. You will act as a bridge between data analysis and commercial strategy, enabling data-driven decisions and optimizing commercial operations.

Your Tasks


Act as a dedicated BI partner to the Commercial Team, providing insights to improve sales performance, pipeline management, and revenue generation.
Conduct funnel analysis to understand and optimize the sales process, identifying bottlenecks and areas for improvement.
Analyze sales data to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement in sales operations and strategies.
Monitor and report on key sales performance metrics, including pipeline health, win rates, deal velocity, average deal size, etc
Design, develop, and maintain dashboards in Power BI, providing stakeholders with visibility into sales performance and funnel progression.
Use SQL to query and manipulate data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with commercial leaders to identify opportunities for improvement and provide actionable recommendations based on data insights.
Support forecasting efforts by analyzing historical data and trends, enabling accurate revenue projections.
Stay updated on sales trends, tools, and best practices to continuously enhance reporting and analysis.


You Bring


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Data Analytics, Marketing, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, with a focus on B2B SaaS GTM performance and funnel analysis.
Intermediate skills in SQL for querying and analyzing data.
Expertise in Power BI (or similar tools) for creating dashboards, visualizations, and reports.
Strong understanding of sales metrics and KPIs, such as Customer Lifetime Value (CLV), Lead Conversion Rates, and Sales Cycle Length.
Proven experience in conducting and interpreting funnel analysis to optimize sales processes.
Exceptional communication skills to present insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong business acumen with the ability to translate data into actionable recommendations for the sales team.
Experience collaborating with V- and C-level stakeholders, ensuring alignment with strategic objectives.
Growth mindset and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
High degree of proactivity and self-sufficiency, capable of identifying opportunities and driving insights independently


Why join Usercentrics?


Joining Usercentrics means becoming part of a fast-growing, diverse and international team of tech enthusiasts and entrepreneurially-minded who build our success story together
Company culture is important to us - we strive to continuously develop a positive, vibrant and inspiring environment that enables everyone to thrive both personally and professionally
Get involved! We have plenty of initiatives and love to see people from all department enthusiastically participating and shaping our future together in different cross-department projects
Your work-life balance is important to us too - we offer flexible working hours, hybrid working and the possibility of workcations (in accordance with our company policy)
We always remember to have fun along the way, both in our day-to-day work and at our regular team events on site in our offices in Munich, Copenhagen, Odense, Lisbon and Prague or online
You are the most valuable asset to our company which is why we‚Äôre happy to offer awesome benefits like our personal development budget, job-related language courses and a lot more (depending on your location) to focus on your well being


About Us

We are driven by our values #BeBrave, #BetterTogether, #LeadbyExample, #InnovateWithPurpose, #PassionForPrivacy, #GiveBack and #ComeAsYouAre. They show what we believe in and how we work. They help make our team special and guide us in everything we do. They're the heart of our company and inspire us to do our best every day.

We strive to create a diverse, equitable, and inclusive environment (DEI) where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that our different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are our greatest strengths ‚Äî so we are committed to building with them as we foster innovation and drive our success.

We recognize that this is an ongoing journey. We commit to listening and to continuous learning, growth, and improvement. By embracing DEI principles, we will create a more just and equitable society, and we are proud to play our part in making this vision a reality.

We are #BetterTogether.
