Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Data Analyst at Air Apps, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to drive business insights and optimize product performance. You will create reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to help teams make informed decisions and improve user experience.

This role requires a data-driven mindset, strong analytical skills, and experience with visualization tools to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities


Analyze user behavior, product performance, and key business metrics to identify trends and opportunities.
Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
Collect, clean, and structure large datasets to ensure accuracy and usability.
Define and track KPIs for marketing, product, and business performance.
Work with SQL, Python, or R to extract, analyze, and manipulate data.
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketing teams to provide data-driven insights.
Conduct A/B testing and experiment analysis to improve product features and user engagement.
Identify bottlenecks and opportunities in user journeys and customer funnels.
Present findings in a clear and compelling way to stakeholders and leadership teams.
Stay up to date with industry trends, analytics best practices, and emerging data tools.


Requirements


Around 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Google Data Studio).
Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for data analysis.
Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
Experience with Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar user analytics tools.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline optimization is a plus.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and manage multiple projects.


What benefits are we offering?


Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
Annual Bonus.
Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
Air Conference - an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.


Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.
Show more
HTML:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.

The Role

As a Data Analyst at Air Apps, you will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to drive business insights and optimize product performance. You will create reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to help teams make informed decisions and improve user experience.

This role requires a data-driven mindset, strong analytical skills, and experience with visualization tools to turn complex data into actionable insights.

Responsibilities

  • Analyze user behavior, product performance, and key business metrics to identify trends and opportunities.
  • Create and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Looker, Power BI, or Google Data Studio.
  • Collect, clean, and structure large datasets to ensure accuracy and usability.
  • Define and track KPIs for marketing, product, and business performance.
  • Work with SQL, Python, or R to extract, analyze, and manipulate data.
  • Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and marketing teams to provide data-driven insights.
  • Conduct A/B testing and experiment analysis to improve product features and user engagement.
  • Identify bottlenecks and opportunities in user journeys and customer funnels.
  • Present findings in a clear and compelling way to stakeholders and leadership teams.
  • Stay up to date with industry trends, analytics best practices, and emerging data tools.

Requirements

  • Around 3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Looker, Power BI, Google Data Studio).
  • Strong analytical skills with experience in Python or R for data analysis.
  • Knowledge of A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis.
  • Experience with Google Analytics, Mixpanel, Amplitude, or similar user analytics tools.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Experience working with large datasets and cloud-based data warehouses (BigQuery, Redshift, Snowflake).
  • Familiarity with ETL processes and data pipeline optimization is a plus.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, data-driven environment and manage multiple projects.

What benefits are we offering?

  • Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
  • Flexible Paid Time Off (PTO) to support work-life balance.
  • Annual Bonus.
  • Top-tier Health Insurance for peace of mind.
  • Public Transportation Pass to support your commute needs.
  • Coverflex benefits package for meal allowances, well-being, and more.
  • Air Conference - an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Descri√ß√£o da postagem

Data Analyst - Aon Portugal

About The Job

Looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data team. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in turning raw data into actionable insights, helping steer data-driven decision-making across our organization. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to craft visually appealing and interactive PowerBI reports and dashboards that deliver valuable insights into our operations.

You will‚Ä¶


Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and identify opportunities to optimize data use.
Meet regularly with business to help drive a Data driven culture and the adoption of best practices regarding data use.
Develop and maintain interactive PowerBI reports and dashboards.
Create clear and comprehensive visualizations to convey complex data in a straightforward manner.
Conduct data analysis to spot trends, anomalies, and improvement opportunities.


We are looking for‚Ä¶


3-5 years of proven experience in a similar role experience.
Exceptional problem-solving and analytical abilities.
Excellent teamwork and collaboration skills.
Experience in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong data visualization and design skills using PowerBI.
Strong understanding of databases, data relationships, and data integrity techniques.
Knowledge and Proficiency with Databricks is highly desirable.
Basic Management skills.
Fluency in Portuguese, English, Spanish is a plus.


We offer‚Ä¶


Competitive salary and health insurance
Opportunities for growth and professional development.
Dynamic and collaborative work environment.
Work-life balance to support your personal and professional goals.

Title: ESG Data Analyst
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, present in Portugal since 2007. With offices in Lisbon and Oporto, we specialize in the management, implementation, development, and maintenance of information systems. We partner with over 150 active clients across banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy, and transport sectors.

What are we looking for?

‚Ä¢ Actively contribute to the data collection, analysis, and reporting required by the ESG strategy and regulations, working with the ESG Team and under the supervision of the ESG Data Manager

‚Ä¢ Work with different business units and departments to effectively collect and analyze ESG data

‚Ä¢ Assist the ESG Team in the roll-out of new ESG regulations by ensuring collection of new data points

‚Ä¢ Contribute to the preparation of regular internal reporting on ESG-related metrics; assist in analysis to understand trends and where strategic controls are needed

‚Ä¢ Maintain accurate databases from different sources of the relevant ESG metrics to ensure the ESG Team and internal stakeholders can answer questionnaires (rating agencies, investors, clients, etc.)

‚Ä¢ Be part of the roll-out of the technology solution to manage ESG data collection, performance management, and reporting; support the identification of opportunities for improvement on reporting requirements

‚Ä¢ Very good command of English (oral and written)

What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee ‚Äì the system that includes Aubay‚Äôs Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: Hybrid from Lisbon/Porto;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.

What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • We don‚Äôt have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • You will grow in good company. Isn‚Äôt this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?

If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you at maria.t.moreno@aubay.pt!

Personal Data collected by AUBAY PORTUGAL as Data Controller, regarding the identification, contact and professional capabilities of the candidates, in the present procedure, will be processed for the application analysis, having in consideration that the processing is conducted in order to to take the steps, at the request of the data subject, prior to entering into a contract;

Personal data sent through the present application will be kept by Aubay during the application procedure and will remain stored whilst updated (for two years period).

The collected data might be transferred or include other processing activities, as long as the data subject is informed, in the occurrence of a standard application and selection procedure, for the compliance of legal obligations for the time required by law.

For any queries or request regarding personal data protection rights, the Data Subject may contact AUBAY PORTUGAL‚Äôs headquarters in Avenida Duque D`√Åvila, n¬∫46 em Lisboa or use the DPO‚Äôs e-mail - dpo@aubay.pt. The Data Subject also has the right to file a complaint with the National Data Protection Authority ‚Äì www.cnpd.pt.

(please do not include data regarding racial or ethnical origins, political opinions, religion, philosophy, biometrical data, health data, sexual life and orientation, or relating to criminal convictions and offences.)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join our team and start a new adventure in an international and dynamic environment, where you will be able to fulfil your career expectations in a fast growing organization.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will be part of our corporate team, working closely with various departments to transform data into insights and value-added solutions that support strategic decision making and improve performance across the organization.




Your missions

Design, develop and deploy machine learning models to solve business problems
Collect, clean and process structured and unstructured data from multiple sources
Perform statistical analysis and predictive modeling to uncover trends and patterns
Develop dashboards and data visualization tools to communicate findings
Collaborate with IT and business teams to integrate models into operational systems
Validate models and ensure robustness, scalability, and reliability
Stay up to date with the latest data science trends, technologies, and best practices
Document solutions, prepare technical reports, and present results to stakeholders




Your profile

Academic background: bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or similar
Experience with data manipulation and analysis using Python and libraries like pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn
Proficiency in machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques
Familiarity with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Plotly
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and databases (SQL, NoSQL)
Fluent English. French is a plus.
You are analytical, curious, and business-oriented, with excellent communication skills




What we offer

An international community bringing together 110+ different nationalities
An environment where trust has a central place: 70% of our key leaders started their careers at the first level of responsibilities
A robust training system with our internal Academy and 250+ available modules
A vibrant workplace that frequently gathers for internal events (afterworks, team buildings, etc.)




Remote policy: Possibility to work remotely up to 2 days per week

Title: Junior Healthcare Data Analyst
HTML:
Learn About Knok

At knok, we dare to lead and humanize the digital transformation of healthcare. We envision a world where everyone has timely access to quality healthcare through digital technology, creating a more equal society. We genuinely believe in it and you can recognise it in every person who embraces this mission. We are rapidly growing, delivering augmented telemedicine on 4 continents, and we have barely begun!

About The Role

We are looking for a Junior Healthcare Data Analyst to support our teams in turning complex healthcare data into meaningful insights. You'll be working with datasets from different sources, such as clinical operations, insurance processing, and patient journeys - helping us improve care delivery and decision-making.

If you're passionate about using data to make healthcare more accessible and effective, don't stop here - dive deeper!

As an Junior Healthcare Data Analyst, you will:

  • Collect, clean, and analyse healthcare data from multiple sources (e.g. EHR, patient demographics, operational systems), to extract meaningful insights;
  • Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualisations to communicate key metrics and findings to stakeholders, including clinicians, operational teams and leadership team;
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with teams across the organisation, including data science, product management, and clinical operations, to support data-driven decision-making;
  • Perform statistical analysis to support population health management, risk stratification, and clinical outcome optimisation;
  • Contribute to improving data quality by identifying data quality issues and anomalies, and work with relevant stakeholders to address and resolve them

What Makes You a Great Fit For This Journey

  • Bachelor's degree in Biomedical Engineering, Medical Statistics, Biomedical Sciences, Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Health Informatics, or a related field. Master's degree preferred;
  • Experience (academic or professional) with data visualisation tools such as Tableau, Power BI or similar;
  • Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques;
  • Ability to turn complex data into clear insights that support better decision-making;
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and statistical modeling;
  • Ability to explain a dashboard or an analysis to someone without a technical background, in a simple and practical way;
  • Care when working with data to ensure accuracy, consistency and reliability;
  • Ability to manage several analytical tasks at the same time, prioritising what has the greatest impact on the business and patients

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Transformation, adaptability and innovation are part of our DNA.

We're passionate about technology and we want to be part of your story.

Do we share the same passion? You've come to the right place, Smart.




As a Personal Data Protection Analyst, you will play a key role in ensuring that daily GDPR business-as-usual activities are executed within the 1st Line of Defense (1LoD). You will support CIB clients in achieving compliance with Privacy by Design principles and other data protection requirements, working closely with the CIB Central Data Office, the SPOC network (1LoD), and the DPC/DPO network (2LoD).

This role requires both strong technical expertise in data privacy and GDPR as well as excellent communication and organizational skills, as you will interact with diverse stakeholders across the organization.




Key Responsibilities

Ensure CIB project validation processes comply with Privacy by Design principles, supporting Project Managers in data protection activities.
Manage internal and external requests in the CIB GDPR DESK inbox, including Data Subject Rights Requests.
Prepare and publish the CIB GDPR DESK periodic report and maintain a dedicated SharePoint space.
Contribute to the dissemination of a culture of personal data protection within CIB.
Develop and share best practices with the data protection network.




Required Competencies

Minimum 5 years of experience in data privacy, including significant hands-on work with EU GDPR.
Academic background or certification related to EU GDPR (mandatory).
Knowledge of other global privacy laws and regulations is a strong plus.




Technical Skills

Full proficiency with the MS Office Suite.
Proficiency with project management tools and methodologies.




Language Skills

Fluent English (C1‚ÄìC2), both written and spoken.




Soft Skills

Excellent writing, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Strong attention to detail, with a high sense of rigor and organization.
Ability to synthesize and simplify complex concepts for senior stakeholders.
Proactive mindset, able to leverage transversal networks.
High adaptability and ability to work in a changing environment.




What will you find at SMART?




A dynamic, hard-working and co-operative team;

Career plan and defined objectives;

Initial and ongoing training ;

Follow-up meetings and performance appraisals;

Business bonuses;

Personal and family benefits;

Numerous events, partnerships and internal dynamics;

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mutual Respect, Empathy, Innovation and Professional Pride. Do you identify with these values?

Founded in 2006 with the mission "To Challenge Complexity," Closer Consulting is a Data Science company specializing in Business Intelligence, Advanced Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence.

By developing projects in the most diverse industries ‚Äì Banking, Telecommunications, Health, Retail, Energy, Insurance or Aviation - we analyze data, transforming it into knowledge for our clients, allowing them to adopt the best decision-making for their respective organizations and businesses.




We seek a Data Analyst willing to accept new challenges in our Closer team.

Hybrid working mode with base in Porto.




Main Tasks:

‚Ä¢ Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.

‚Ä¢ Creative descriptive, predictive, and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholder‚Äôs decision making.

‚Ä¢ Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.




Technical Skills:

‚Ä¢ Data knowledge / Data processing / Data quality / IT Development

‚Ä¢ Database Management (SQL)

‚Ä¢ Methodologies (Agile)

‚Ä¢ Office Pack (MS Excel)

‚Ä¢ Power BI / Tableau




Language Skills:

‚Ä¢ English - Expert

‚Ä¢ French - Expert




Soft Skills:

‚Ä¢ IT - Business/IT relationship

‚Ä¢ Analytical Ability

‚Ä¢ Data Intelligence, Research and Quant Analytics

‚Ä¢ Ability to understand, explain and support change

‚Ä¢ Ability to collaborate/Teamwork

‚Ä¢ Attention to detail/rigor




If you believe in this match as much as we do, send your CV to leonor.carvalho@closer.pt and reach the closest side of life.




Closer is a company that values diversity and inclusion. We are committed to fostering an environment where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, regardless of race, gender, beliefs, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other personal characteristics.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Blip is a leading tech company focused on software engineering solutions for sports entertainment.

We operate at scale. As part of Flutter Entertainment, we play an essential role in the Group's goal of becoming the global leader in online sports betting and iGaming, developing innovative products and platforms for over 14 million monthly customers worldwide.

We are serious about Tech. We are problem-solvers with big ambitions, keeping a people-first mindset at the core of our work. We prioritize flexibility as we strive to deliver the best technological products and tackle the greatest industry challenges.

Recognizing that everyone brings their own strengths, backgrounds and new perspectives, we empower you to be yourself. That uniqueness shapes the culture of belonging we are so proud of.


The Role

Flutter Functions Global Sportsbook & Trading (GST) aims to empower Flutter brands shaping the future of sports betting by helping to drive their success and growth.

With over 400 colleagues working in roles across trading, operations, product, delivery, architecture and engineering, and by partnering closely with more than 1,100 people in the wider global trading and sportsbook community at Flutter, GST's Mission intends to raise the bar to be #1 on all sports; share Flutter's most innovative sportsbook products globally; transform Risk & Trading operations, unleashing the power of data; co-create the next generation sportsbook and build a culture of inclusion, innovation, personal growth and leadership excellence.


This role is an exciting opportunity for someone passionate about data analytics to pioneer the discipline in a rapidly growing area of the business. Critical thinking and problem solving will be key for exploring the challenges & opportunities as we develop the data team. You‚Äôll be working within Shared Platforms, alongside some of the main Flutter‚Äôs Brands to provide insights that will ensure we are making data-driven decisions to properly support the Inner Source strategy.


Your mission will be to uncover key insights from Flutter‚Äôs global data, enabling

quality decision-making about the future of our shared platforms and governance model. You will leverage your strong data analyst skills and data storytelling abilities to extract valuable insights from our vast data sources and communicate these insights to various stakeholders, to inspire action and change. Your role will involve transforming complex data into compelling narratives and supporting data-driven decision-making across our product lines.


What You‚Äôll Be Doing

  • Data Analysis: Explore, analyse, and interpret large datasets related to software development activies and the overall SDLC;
  • Collaboration: Build great relationships across teams and Divisional Leads, Product Owners, Managers and Engineers to understand their data requirements and provide valuable insights to optimize the efficiency of our co-creation model.
  • Data Storytelling: Craft data-driven visualisations and narratives which provide clear and actionable insights for our stakeholders, making complex data accessible and understandable to all;
  • Continuous Learning: Be enthusiastic about expanding your skillset, including learning new data platforms & tools, programming languages and techniques to enhance your data analysis capabilities.
  • Experimentation: Foster a culture of experimentation, leading the design, execution, and analysis of experiments to optimize our data extraction;
  • Data Transformation and Quality: Transform multiple raw data sources into clean views and continuously maintain data integrity, identifying and rectifying issues as they arise.


What You‚Äôll Bring

  • Experience as a seasoned data analyst;
  • Experience using Python to query large relational databases;
  • An ability to work independently and provide a personal resolution to projects;
  • A track record of excellence in subjects with a mathematical or statistical focus;
  • Advanced use of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint;
  • Knowledge of statistical programming software and techniques (e.g. Python, R, etc.);
  • Experience of extracting, analysing, and interpreting large and sometimes incomplete data sets;
  • Advanced communication skills including experience of delivering output that is clear and succinct despite the subject being complex to senior stakeholders;
  • Curious and questioning approach with a high attention to detail;
  • Willingness to learn and continuously improve;
  • Strong problem-solving skills;
  • Interest in the sports betting industry is a distinct advantage;
  • Other desirable skills: Tableu, Looker, Power BI


This is what you should have. What do we have, you ask? Well...you can check our amazing perks & benefits right here!

So ... are you in?


Equal opportunities

At Blip, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We strongly encourage people from all backgrounds, ways of thinking, and working to apply.

We are committed to including everyone regardless of their race, disability, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, and religion.


Everyone brings different perspectives and experiences; you don‚Äôt have to meet all the requirements listed to apply for this role.


If you need any adjustments to apply for the position and to ensure this role aligns with your needs, please send an email to accommodations@blip.pt.

We will only respond to inquiries related to disabilities.

Title: Data Analyst ‚Äì Alteryx
Description:
Welcome to Felps Lisboa




üëã A community of passionate experts who combine their skills to take your company to higher levels of excellence. üöÄ




üîí Our expertise: The Felps Group is an alliance of ‚ÄòPure Players‚Äô made up of four distinct squads: Telecoms, IT, Cybersecurity and Change Management. Each squad is led by a Captain who is a specialist in that particular area. The captains coach the consultants throughout their careers in the Felps Group, guiding them in their choice of missions and the stages of their training. Our aim is to facilitate the growth and development of our consultants, enabling them to take their careers to the next level.




üåê Our approach: In our model, consultants are the central focus, which is why we dedicate all our attention to them. The team, led by the Captain and Associate Director, provides expert support to ensure the consultants receive the highest level of guidance. Drawing on our extensive experience, we are able to deliver personalized, comprehensive, and impactful assistance tailored to their needs.




üëâüèº Felps Group believes in the power of diversity and inclusion. We are committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all employees feel respected, supported and encouraged to contribute to the company.

As a member of our team, you will be part of a culture that celebrates diversity in all its forms, be it age, gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, skills, socio-economic background or any other personal characteristic. We pride ourselves on our commitment to equal opportunities and justice.

We encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including people with disabilities who are accredited by DGERT/IEFP. We are committed to providing an inclusive work environment and accommodation to support the integration of all our employees. If you have any specific accessibility requirements during the recruitment process, please let us know and we will do our best to support you.




We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst specialized in Alteryx, experienced in handling date/time datasets (PDATEN), and capable of transforming complex data into actionable insights to support strategic decision-making.




Your Key Responsibilities:

Design, build, and optimize Alteryx workflows for analytics and reporting.
Integrate Alteryx solutions with BI platforms such as Tableau and Power BI.
Collaborate with international teams to gather and translate requirements.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards.
Prepare, transform, and analyze temporal datasets, ensuring consistency and quality in pipelines and BI reports.

Requirements:

Proven experience with Alteryx Designer and Server.
Strong SQL and ETL knowledge.
Experience in data modeling and analytics projects.
Fluency in English is mandatory; French is highly valued.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Technical Skills Required:

Alteryx workflow design and optimization.
SQL querying and data transformation.
ETL processes for structured and temporal datasets.
Integration with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI).
Data quality control, consistency checks, and reporting standards compliance.




Transform data into actionable insights and join our Felps Lisboa team today!

Our aim is to facilitate the growth and development of our consultants, enabling them to take their careers to the next level.


üåê Our approach: In our model, consultants are the central focus, which is why we dedicate all our attention to them. The team, led by the Captain and Associate Director, provides expert support to ensure the consultants receive the highest level of guidance. Drawing on our extensive experience, we are able to deliver personalized, comprehensive, and impactful assistance tailored to their needs.


üëâüèº Felps Group believes in the power of diversity and inclusion. We are committed to creating an inclusive working environment where all employees feel respected, supported and encouraged to contribute to the company.

As a member of our team, you will be part of a culture that celebrates diversity in all its forms, be it age, gender, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, skills, socio-economic background or any other personal characteristic. We pride ourselves on our commitment to equal opportunities and justice.

We encourage applications from all qualified candidates, including people with disabilities who are accredited by DGERT/IEFP. We are committed to providing an inclusive work environment and accommodation to support the integration of all our employees. If you have any specific accessibility requirements during the recruitment process, please let us know and we will do our best to support you.


We are looking for a skilled Data Analyst specialized in Alteryx, experienced in handling date/time datasets (PDATEN), and capable of transforming complex data into actionable insights to support strategic decision-making.


Your Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and optimize Alteryx workflows for analytics and reporting.
  • Integrate Alteryx solutions with BI platforms such as Tableau and Power BI.
  • Collaborate with international teams to gather and translate requirements.
  • Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards.
  • Prepare, transform, and analyze temporal datasets, ensuring consistency and quality in pipelines and BI reports.

Requirements:

  • Proven experience with Alteryx Designer and Server.
  • Strong SQL and ETL knowledge.
  • Experience in data modeling and analytics projects.
  • Fluency in English is mandatory; French is highly valued.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Technical Skills Required:

  • Alteryx workflow design and optimization.
  • SQL querying and data transformation.
  • ETL processes for structured and temporal datasets.
  • Integration with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI).
  • Data quality control, consistency checks, and reporting standards compliance.


Transform data into actionable insights and join our Felps Lisboa team today!

Title: Reporting Specialist - Porto, Portugal
Description:
Come and work with us.




We are looking for a talented and accomplished Reporting Specialist to join our team. The purpose of this role is to directly assist the reporting team by collecting and reporting all KPIs data from Foundever Operations, Supporting Departments and Leadership.




As a Reporting Specialist, your daily responsibilities will include:




Under limited supervision, prepare and maintain databases & statistical reports used in financial/quality/performance management decision-making.
Investigate and analyze data and decide upon alternatives to complete assignments.
Assemble and assess statistical information from system databases and other sources.
Independently plan, prepare and maintain business unit reports critical to organizational success/profitability and meeting client expectations.
Investigate, analyze and assess trends and campaign/brand activity.
Monitor, evaluate and assess unit productivity on a daily basis.
Communicate with the manager on a daily basis to resolve problems/issues, assess scores/trends and maximize efficiency.
Additional operations support duties as assigned.
Creation of ‚Äúad hoc‚Äù reports under short timelines
Takes personal responsibility to understand and comply with all company and client security requirements and policies.




To succeed in the role, you will need to have:




English C1 advanced level
Strong computer, communication and analytical skills.
Strong knowledge Microsoft Excel
Microsoft Access/Database skills appreciated
Power BI experience is highly valued
VBA knowledge/experience is highly valued
SQL knowledge/experience is highly valued
SAP Business Objects knowledge/experience highly valued
Data Architecture knowledge/experience is highly valued
Ability to collect and assess large sets of data, dashboard creation and KPI evaluation.
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Ability to work with minimal supervision, make independent decisions and solve complex problems
Strong understanding of the call center industry and operations,
Ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment,
Demonstrated ability to develop professional relationships and interact with all levels of internal and external clients.
Solution driven mindset
Must hold EU citizenship or valid work permit for Portugal
Be a local candidate or willing to relocate to Porto, Portugal
Availability to work 100% from our site in Porto




Education and experience.




Minimum 1 year experience as Reporting Specialist or Real Time Analyst




Benefits.




Competitive wages
Paid professional training
Employee discounts
Private healthcare & dental insurance (after six months of employment)
Growth opportunities through various development programs
Fun and engaging company-wide initiatives, including our EverBetter wellness program
Job stability
Life-long skills and experience
Excellent work culture




Go further with Foundever¬Æ




We believe in memorable associate experiences. Here, you can improve your quality of life and grow your career.




Apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there‚Äôs a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there‚Äôs always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis;
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems;
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations;
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management;
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

At Celfocus, we are committed to cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants of all backgrounds, gender identities, and abilities. We are dedicated to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with specific needs. If you require any adjustments during the selection process, please inform our Talent Acquisition Team.

Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing leading edge professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions ‚Äì addressing Telecommunications, Financial Services, Retail, Energy & Utilities, Pharmaceutical, and other markets' strategic opportunities.

As a highly specialised engineering company, Celfocus helps clients undergo their innovation path, providing technological solutions to extract value from data and make it actionable.

Serving clients in +25 countries, Celfocus delivers solutions that boost customer experience and enhance operational efficiency, via our Cognitive Automation, Data & Analytics and Digital offers.

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What you will do


Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.



What you‚Äôll bring


1‚Äì2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)



Nice to have:


Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
Participation in academic or personal analytics projects



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: DATA ANALYST ‚Äì ENERGY & MANUFACTURING
HTML:
DATA ANALYST ‚Äì ENERGY & MANUFACTURING

 

ABOUT WIIMER

Wiimer is an AI and data analytics consulting firm on a mission to unlock the potential of data-intensive industries providing an innovative approach to business processes and decision making. We develop and deliver expert-trained decision-aid models and digital solutions based on a unique combination of business acumen, advanced analytics and information technologies. We are proud to have filled in #themissingdot for tier one companies located in more than nine different countries.

Wiimer recruits globally, resorting to cutting edge teamwork technology. Wiimers are currently based in Portugal, Spain, and Latin America.

 

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

Wiimers are bright, curious, enthusiasts, hard-working individuals together on a mission: delivering expert-trained decision-aid models and digital solutions to data-intensive industries, by combining business acumen, advanced analytics and information technologies.

This time we are looking for a Data Analyst eager to work in the Energy and Manufacturing Sectors to join us in Porto (Hybrid).

 

AT WIIMER YOU WILL

Participate in AI & data analytics end-to-end client projects, tackling complex business problems with strategic thinking and creativity, and developing solutions that bring significant business value to our clients;

Be involved in highly dynamic teams, multi-disciplinary and cross-industry projects (although a strong focus in the Energy and Manufacturing sectors is expected)

Be in direct contact with the client and be involved in meetings to present results and insights to the client;

Be responsible for core project activities, including, notably, extraction, transformation and loading of datasets, as well as developing learning algorithms and BI dashboards.

 

WHAT YOU‚ÄôLL NEED TO SUCCEED

  • Degree/master‚Äôs in engineering, computer science, information technologies or related field;
  • Working and/or academic background in the Energy and Manufacturing Sectors (not mandatory, although appreciated);
  • Maximum 2 years of relevant technical experience in analytics /business intelligence delivering end-to-end projects;
  • Understanding of machine learning and optimization techniques and algorithms;
  • Experience in data engineering and ML programming languages (Python and/or R);
  • Experience in working MLOps tools (e.g. MLflow) (not mandatory, although appreciated);
  • Experience with Big Data frameworks (e.g. Azure, Databricks, GCP, AWS) (not mandatory, although appreciated);
  • Experience with visualization tools, such as Microsoft PowerBI or Google Looker;
  • Experience in SQL programming with data bases, such as SQL Server, MySQL, SQLite, PostgreSQL;
  • Experience with generative AI tools (e.g. Azure OpenAI, Microsoft Copilot Studio, ChatGPT builder) (not mandatory, although appreciated);
  • Excellent English language skills;
  • Knowledge in Agile methodology, using tools like Planner, Trello or Jira;
  • Written and verbal communication skills.

 

WHAT YOU WILL FIND AT WIIMER

At Wiimer, we offer more than just a workplace. You‚Äôll discover a dynamic and collaborative environment, where every day brings new and exciting challenges, working with major clients across various geographies. We prioritize work-life balance, offering a hybrid work model and flexible benefits designed around your needs. And when your birthday comes, it‚Äôs time to celebrate ‚Äì with the day off!

We are committed to your ongoing development, providing access to specialized learning platforms and continuous training opportunities. At Wiimer, we foster an environment where your professional journey and personal development thrive together, all within a supportive, human-centered, and inclusive culture.

More on our culture and values at www.wiimer.com

 

Wiimer is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We foster a diverse culture where individual differences are recognized and appreciated. More on our Mission and Values at www.wiimer.com

Apply also at www.wiimer.com

Title: Data Analysis HR Trainee (f/m/div)
Description:
Are you passionate about HR technology and digitalization? Do you want to kick-start your career with a team of Digital HR experts, in a dynamic and multicultural work environment, and support our Human Resources Digitalization? Look no further than our HR Digital team in Porto! You'll gain precious experience and be part of an exciting journey towards becoming a digital expert.

Job Description

As an HR Data Analysis Trainee, you will support the HR Digital team, located across various regions. You will play a crucial role in HR digitalization, influencing global HR processes and communicating with multiple stakeholders to implement our digital strategy for HR on a global scale.

In your new role, you will:


Develop new self-service data solutions, such as Certified Data Sources, Dashboards, or List Reports
Support data solutions as they go into sustain, namely by troubleshooting and bug-fixing, enhancing and maintaining features throughout the life-cycle, as well as enabling and supporting end-users
Managing relationships and relevant communication flows with stakeholders
Trend-scout and consult on data-related matters
Support HR and Business in taking better, faster, fact-based decisions, driving HR transformation even further


Your Profile

You have a proactive, structured, and autonomous working style. You have an excellent team spirit and a creative mindset. You possess great communication skills and are an artist when it comes to stakeholder management. You can think and act strategically and like to work on new concepts, where you can apply your technical knowledge, as well as your understanding of HR processes.

You are best equipped for this role if you have:


A degree in Data Science, Information Technology, Economics, Business Administration, Human Resources, or a similar field of study
Concrete knowledge and understanding of reporting solutions & data analysis process, acquired by your educational background and/or through hands-on experience (e.g., curricular internship)
Know how on Business Intelligence software ‚Äì both on data flows and visualization ends - preferably Tableau
Knowledge of HR processes is a plus
Fluency in English (mandatory). Knowledge of German is a plus


Please apply with your CV in English.

Contact:

Maria Julia Mello

#WeAreIn for driving decarbonization and digitalization.

As a global leader in semiconductor solutions in power systems and IoT, Infineon enables game-changing solutions for green and efficient energy, clean and safe mobility, as well as smart and secure IoT. Together, we drive innovation and customer success, while caring for our people and empowering them to reach ambitious goals. Be a part of making life easier, safer and greener.

Are you in?


Welcome to Infineon Technologies Business Solutions in Porto! - Infineon Technologies Business Solutions is a vibrant global hub, driven by diverse talents and an operational culture of excellence, in a privileged geographic location. The team of more than 25 nationalities works together in a dynamic, diverse and inclusive environment. We lead innovation and digital transformation, shaping the future of Infineon Technologies. At the heart of everything we do, people matter most. Our ultimate goal is to craft a unique experience for both our customers and employees.


At our site you will find a range of diverse teams that have built a reputation for delivering high-quality services for all Infineon in Finance, Procurement, Human Resources, IT, Audit, Legal, Compliance, Business Continuity and Sustainability, Cyber Security, Communication, Corporate Supply Chain Logistics and Sales & Marketing. Porto is a powerhouse of ideas and solutions, a key player in the global company‚Äôs puzzle, delivering specialized services and innovative solutions.

Together, Infineon Technologies Business Solutions will continue to shape the future, driving innovation and excellence for years to come.

We are on a journey to create the best Infineon for everyone.

This means we embrace diversity and inclusion and welcome everyone for who they are. At Infineon, we offer a working environment characterized by trust, openness, respect and tolerance and are committed to give all applicants and employees equal opportunities. We base our recruiting decisions on the applicant¬¥s experience and skills. Learn more about our various contact channels.

We look forward to receiving your resume, even if you do not entirely meet all the requirements of the job posting.

Please let your recruiter know if they need to pay special attention to something in order to enable your participation in the interview process.

Click here for more information about Diversity & Inclusion at Infineon.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Tribe




'Prozis is a powerhouse product developing company. Every day we make new products. That is only possible because we developed our own proprietary technology that ensures that we bring you high quality, beautiful and fair priced products. We endure in our philosophy of a 4.0 vertical process, manufacturing in our own facilities or with the help of our super partners. We do everything: idea, concept, design, manufacturing, quality control, marketing, sales, logistics, printing, distribution, client support, software development, photo, video, 3D and philosophy. We deliver wherever you are, whenever you want. We don‚Äôt compromise. We breathe technology, drink design and feed on our will to exceed ourselves making the best products in the world. This all starts in 2007 with a crazy guy in a garage that thinks he can change the world for the better. Right now, we are hundreds, going to thousands of crazy but focused people. Will is a skill. There is a lot of people that want to buy us out. We don‚Äôt have a F****** price tag. It‚Äôs not about the money. It‚Äôs about our mission. Trust us. We will feed your body and mind with everything you need to exceed yourself.'




- miguel milh√£o




The Team




Prozis is growing and Data is flying everywhere, do you think you can catch it? Prozis Data Analytics Team collaborates with multiple business stakeholders, including C-level, and has a value-driven proposition in the company.




The Role




As a Data Analyst, you are a dynamic and multifaceted person, with a combination of technical skills, analytical thinking and strong communication capabilities. You will be working in a multitalented team and your role will be collecting, analyzing and interpreting complex data to identify trends and insights that will drive business decisions.




Your daily activities will include:

Work with large datasets, clean and transform data
Review and analyze data to provide insights using SQL, Power BI and/or Python
Identify patterns and trends, spot anomalies, and inform business teams
Conduct ad hoc analysis to answer specific questions or investigate particular areas of the business
Create and maintain reports and dashboards to provide ongoing visibility into business performance
Design and build scalable and reliable data pipelines
Guarantee data quality across business domains
Communicate in a clear and concise manner, explaining findings and insights in a way that is easy to understand, even for those who are not data experts




You




You are an ambitious data professional, with a degree in Computer Science or a related field, experienced in a similar role and knowledge of at least some of the following:

Strong SQL knowledge
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI
Data Warehousing modeling concepts
Relational and Non-Relational databases
Experience working with the Microsoft Tech Stack (PowerBI, SSAS, SSIS) is a plus
Python is a plus
Azure/Databricks ecosystem is a plus




Your superpowers

Business-oriented
Keen eye for detail to ensure that data is clean, accurate, and reliable
Excellent communication skills
Proactivity and autonomy
Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment




Btw: Prozis is not for everyone.
